loan.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is twenty-seven years old and married with a child, living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He wants to secure a sustainable income for his family. For five years he has been into the motorcycle transport business, and so far owns two motorcycles. His dream is to have at least five of them on the road. Godfrey needs the loan to complete payments on a motorcycle.

loan.use: Completing payments on a motorcycle.

loan.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is thirty-seven years old and married to a teacher. They have three children and live in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to build a permanent house and to educate his children. He is in the motorcycle transport sector. He has been in the business for fourteen years, and the business is still profitable. His dream is to buy a taxi. At this time, Patrick needs the loan facility to buy land.

loan.use: Buying land

loan.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a forty-four-year-old ambitious married woman, living in her own house with nine children in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has been growing sugar cane for ten years now, and with the income generated she has been able to buy land and to farm extensively. Her business plan is to become a supplier to the sugar factories. Jane intends to use the credit facility to plant sugar cane.

loan.use: Planting sugar cane

loan.name: Lonh

texts.en:
Lonh C. L. is 40 years old and the mother of three children. Two are single and the other one is married and has already started a new family. In the beginning of 2008, Lonh C. L. built a small store in front of her home. In her shop, she sells Khmer noodles and rice from morning to evening to neighbors who live near her house in the village.
Lonh C. L. is married to Van Yit, 46, a local vet who earns daily income by treating the villagerâ€™s animals. In order to make more profit, Lonh C. L. would like to request a loan to purchase essential ingredients for cooking Khmer noodles and rice for selling in her shop. She proposes to use the rest of the loan to buy some medicine for giving injections to animals.

loan.use: To purchase essential ingredients for cooking Khmer noodles and rice, and to buy medicine for giving injections to animals.

loan.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 27 years old and married. He sells water to earn a living. He has been in the business for almost two years. So far, he has employed one person in his business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save his money and has acquired business skills. He needs more workers to supply water to other regions, so he has requested 20,000 KES.

loan.use: To pay for laborers

loan.name: Nelius

texts.en: Nelius is 27 years old, married and blessed with one child. She has been running a beauty salon for three years. She has managed to grow her business since she joined Faulu Kenya. She hopes to open a wholesale cosmetic shop in the future. She has requested 40,000 KES to buy hair weaves, shampoos and hair oil.

loan.use: To buy hair weaves, shampoos and hair oil

loan.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas is a 32-year-old member of Faulu Kenya. He runs a cereal shop to earn a living. His business is located in the Kibera slums so most of his customers are low-income earners. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has managed to save his money and grow his business. He dreams of expanding his shop into wholesale sales in five years. He has requested 40,000 KES to buy maize, rice and beans.

loan.use: To buy maize, rice and beans

loan.name: Evans

texts.en: Evans is a 27-year-old single man. He runs a retail shop where he sells vehicle spare parts. He earns extra income from tailoring. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been motivated to work hard in his business. He dreams of opening other outlets in the future. He needs 40,000 KES to buy spare parts for resale.

loan.use: To buy spare parts for resale

texts.en:
The women of the group Danaya are all married and average 31 years of age and three children living in traditional extended families in DioÃ¯la city, DioÃ¯la prefecture, RÃ©gion de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members know one another through ties of kinship, and they do commerce in peanut butter, clothing, and local soaps. The group members are now on their sixth solidarity loan, which will be used to buy peanuts, soap, and clothing.
Accepting cash or credit from a customer base composed of especially of women, the group members make their sales locally after processing the peanuts into peanut butter. Â
Ms. YOUMA T. gets her supplies of peanuts from producers at the DioÃ¯la market on the days the fair takes place. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will be used to pay off the loan and to meet expenses related to healthcare, food, and schooling. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loan.use: Buying peanuts

The group Badenya is composed of women, both married and unmarried. Â They live in traditional families and average 32 years of age and three children each living in DioÃ¯la City, DioÃ¯la Prefecture, Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members know one another through ties of kinship, and they do commerce in condiments, fish, and fruit and vegetables. Â The group members are on their 16th solidarity loan, which will be used to buy condiments, fish, and fruit and vegetables. Â
Each day, Ms. MAGNA S. gets her supplies of fresh fish from the fisherfolk in the surrounding villages, and she buys oil and millet, for making fish cakes. Â Accepting cash or credit from a customer base composed of women and men, she makes her sales locally and also at the DioÃ¯la market on the days the fair takes place.
She envisions making an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will be used to pay off the loan and to meet expenses related to healthcare, food, and schooling. Â The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loan.use: Buying fish

texts.en: Ms. Dicko B. is 35 years old and the mother of eight children. Â She lives in a traditional family with her husband and her co-spouses and her children. Â She is situated in Fana City, in the Fana Coura district, which belongs under DioÃ¯la Prefecture, in the Koulikoro region (Republic of Mali). Â  Dicko did not attend school. Â She was married early on, and she started off in commerce, so as to have something to do. Â Little by little, she came to like commerce, as far as to come looking for a loan from this micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. Thus, she is now on her seventh individual loan at this institution. Her goal is to endure the current competition. With this loan, she intends to purchase: Â wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth), bed sheets, and a few read-to-wear items at the big market in Bamako (capital of Mali). Â Then she will return to sell the goods, accepting cash or credit from a customer base composed of women and men. Â  She envisions making an average monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover the loan payments and to meet expenses related to healthcare, food, and schooling. Â The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loan.use: Selling bed sheets and cloth

loan.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr: Les femmes du groupe Djiguiya, toutes mariÃ©es, ont en moyenne 45 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles Ã©largies dans la ville de Fana, prÃ©fecture de la rÃ©gion de Koulikoro (deuxiÃ¨me rÃ©gion administrative de la rÃ©publique du Mali). Ces femmes sont Ã leur sixiÃ¨me prÃªt. ASSAN C., la prÃ©sidente du groupe Djiguiya compte utiliser son prÃªt pour acheter des habillements et du bois de chauffe. Elle sâ€™approvisionne en habillements gÃ©nÃ©ralement Ã Bamako et le bois de chauffe sur place. Elle effectue sa vente sur place, au marchÃ© de Fana, au comptant, en dÃ©tail et Ã crÃ©dit, Ã une clientÃ¨le composÃ©e de femmes et dâ€™hommes. texts.en:
The women in the Djiguiya group are all married and are on average 45 years old with five children. They all live in traditional extended families in the Fana prefecture, part of the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
They got acquainted through family ties and as neighbors, and are retail merchants of plastic kitchen utensils, clothing, firewood, culinary condiments and peanuts. This is their sixth loan request.
Assan C. - president of the Djiguiya group â€“ wants to use her loan to buy clothing and firewood. She usually gets her clothing supplies in Bamako and the firewood locally. She sells her products at retail prices at the market in Fana, for cash or credit, to both men and women customers.
She hopes to attain average monthly earnings of 25,000 FCFA which she will devote in part to the familyâ€™s daily expenditures, the remainder being reinvested in her commercial activities.

loan.use: Buy various items

loan.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr: Les femmes du groupe Tiessiri, toutes mariÃ©es, ont en moyenne 41 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles Ã©largies dans la ville de Fana, prÃ©fecture de DioÃ¯la, rÃ©gion de Koulikoro (deuxiÃ¨me rÃ©gion administrative de la rÃ©publique du Mali). Elles se sont connues Ã travers des liens de parentÃ© et de voisinage et font la restauration, le commerce de condiments et dâ€™habillements. Ces femmes du groupe Tiessiri sont Ã leur quatriÃ¨me prÃªt solidaire. TATA T. du groupe Tiessiri compte utiliser son prÃªt pour acheter des habillements. Elle sâ€™approvisionne en habillement gÃ©nÃ©ralement Ã Bamako et quelques fois sur place. Elle effectue sa vente sur place, au marchÃ© de Fana, au comptant, en dÃ©tail et Ã crÃ©dit, Ã une clientÃ¨le composÃ©e de femmes et dâ€™hommes. Elle compte rÃ©aliser un bÃ©nÃ©fice moyen mensuel de 20 000FCFA qui sera utilisÃ© dans les dÃ©penses quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera rÃ©investi dans les activitÃ©s de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the group Tiessiri are all married and average 41 years of age and four children living in traditional extended families in Fana city, DioÃ¯la prefecture, Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members know one another through ties of kinship and community. They work in food service, and they sell condiments and clothing. The group members are now on their fourth solidarity loan.
Ms. TATA T., who is a member of the solidarity group, intends to use her loan to buy some clothing. She gets her supplies of clothing generally in Bamako (capital of Mali) and sometimes locally. Â Accepting cash or credit from a customer base composed of women and men, she makes her sales retail in the area and at the Fana market.
She plans on making an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will be used for day-to-day family expenses. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loan.use: Buying clothing

loan.name: Javier Orlando

texts.es: El seÃ±or Javier Orlando A. C. tiene 37 aÃ±os y vive con un primo en el sector de Suba en BogotÃ¡. Posee un salÃ³n de estÃ©tica en el cual ofrece el servicio de corte, alicer y tinturado de cabello. El estudiÃ³ contabilidad y finanzas bÃ¡sicas al terminar sus estudios de secundaria, pero nunca ejerciÃ³ esa profesiÃ³n. EmpezÃ³ a trabajar en una peluquerÃ­a y allÃ­ permaneciÃ³ siete aÃ±os. MÃ¡s tarde, realizÃ³ algunos cursos de especializaciÃ³n en corte de cabello y hace nueve aÃ±os decidiÃ³ que era hora de abrir su propio negocio en un local cercano a su residencia. El Ã©xito fue total porque atrajo la clientela que atendÃ­a cuando era empleado. Actualmente y sobre todo para realizar arreglo de uÃ±as en manos y pies, el seÃ±or Javier utiliza los servicios de una joven a quien le paga un porcentaje del producido diario. Este es el segundo prÃ©stamo que tramita con la FundaciÃ³n Mario Santo Domingo y planea invertirlo en la compra al por mayor de champÃº, tintes y cremas capilares. El volumen promedio de ventas diarias es de $ 80.000 COP y el margen de utilidad es del 60%. La reciente temporada invernal que azotÃ³ el paÃ­s incidiÃ³ en una baja de sus ingresos. En un futuro el seÃ±or Javier piensa remodelar el local de su negocio para mayor comodidad de sus clientes y contratar otro estilista para Ã©l dedicarse a vender en otras peluquerÃ­as productos de un importante laboratorio que le ofreciÃ³ la posibilidad de convertirse en distribuidor mayorista. Por ahora Ã©ste es sÃ³lo un proyecto y, mientras se hace realidad, el microempresario seguirÃ¡ cuidÃ¡ndoles el cabello a sus clientes, algunos de hace tantos aÃ±os que ya no necesitan decirle quÃ© tipo de corte quieren que les haga.
texts.en:
Javier Orlando A. C. is 37 years old and lives with a cousin in Suba sector of BogotÃ¡. He owns a beauty salon where he offers hair cuts, hair straightening and hair coloring services. Javier studied accountancy and basic finances when he finished his high school studies but he never worked in the profession. He started working in a hairdressing salon and stayed there for seven years. Later, he carried out some specialization courses in hair cutting and nine years ago he decided that it was time to open his own business in premises near to his home. It was a complete success because he attracted the customers he had when he was an employee.
Currently, and above all to do manicures and pedicures, Javier uses the services of a young woman who he pays a percentage of his daily income. This is the second loan that Javier has taken from FundaciÃ³n Mario Santo Domingo and he plans to invest the money in buying shampoo, hair dyes and hair creams wholesale.
Javier's average daily sales amount to 80,000 Colombian pesos and his profit margin is 60%. The recent winter season that hit the country led to a reduction in his income. In the future, Javier is thinking of remodeling his business premises so that he can make his customers more comfortable and so that he can hire another stylist so that he can dedicate himself to selling products in other hairdressing salons as an important laboratory has offered him the possibility of becoming a wholesale distributor. For now, this is only a project and, until it becomes a reality, this small businessman will continue looking after his customers' hair. Some of his customers have been with him so long that they no longer need to tell him what hair cut they want him to give them.

loan.use: To buy shampoo, dyes and hair creams wholesale

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: the purchase of home equipment merchandise to sell

loan.name: Marlin Del Socorro

texts.es: Marlin Del Socorro tiene 51 aÃ±os, ella tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con FundaciÃ³n LeÃ³n 2000. Su actividad es la compra y venta de ropa usada. Hace mÃ¡s de 5 aÃ±os que tiene este negocio, Marlin siempre ha tenido que trabajar muy duro para sacar a su familia adelante. Ella estÃ¡ muy contenta con este financiamiento que le serÃ¡ de gran ayuda para su negocio. AsÃ­ lograra comprar pantalones, camisas, faldas y trajes.
texts.en: Marlin Del Socorro is 51 years old. She has been working with FundaciÃ³n LeÃ³n 2000 for a long time. Her business is buying and selling used clothes. She has been in this business for more than 5 years. Marlin has always had to work very hard to get her family ahead in life. She is very happy to be receiving this loan which will be a great help to her business. She will use her loan to buy pants, shirts, skirts and dresses.

loan.use: Working capital

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Working capital

loan.name: Rosibel

texts.es: Rosibel es madre soltera con dos hijos menores de edad que mantener. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva de manera ambulante, por lo que recorre calles, mercados y barrios con el propÃ³sito de conseguir algo de ingresos para su hogar. Inicio este medio de vida por cuenta propia, con pocos productos y con el paso del tiempo logro obtener experiencia y sus propios clientes. Rosibel enfrento ciertos desafÃ­os como problemas de salud, aun teniendo este obstÃ¡culo sabia que tenÃ­a que trabajar todos los dÃ­as y salir adelante. El financiamiento es para la compra de faldas, vestidos, pantalones, camisas y trajes debido a los constantes pedidos que tiene de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosibel is a single mother who has two dependent children to support. She sells new clothes as an itinerant street vendor. She walks through streets, markets and neighborhoods with the goal of making income for her household.
Rosibel started this business on her own initiative. At first she had few products to sell but, over time, she gained experience and her own customers. Rosibel has faced certain challenges such as health problems but, despite these obstacles, she knew that she had to keep working every day and get ahead in life.
Rosibel will use her loan to buy skirts, dresses, pants, shirts and dresses to fill the constant orders that her customers make.

loan.use: Working capital

texts.en:
Ms. Mariam S. is 51 years old and the mother of nine children living in a traditional family with her husband, her co-spouse, and her children. She resides in Fana city, in the Fana Coura district, DioÃ¯la prefecture, Region of Koulikoro, Republic of Mali. Â
Mariam did to attend school. Â She buys and sells a variety of store goods with the goal of meeting her own needs and those of her children. Â She just started with this micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, which she discovered through her friends and family. Â Mariam intends to use her loan to purchase: packs of Maggie (bouillon cubes), sugar, oil, and several other items at the Fana market. She accepts cash or credit in her sales to a customer base composed of women and men.
She envisions making an average monthly profit 35,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover the loan payments and to meet expenses related to healthcare, food, and schooling. Â The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loan.use: Buying various store goods

loan.name: Aminata

texts.en: Ms. Aminata T. is 35 years old, unmarried, and the mother of one child living in a nuclear family in Fana Badialan, a district of Fana City, Region of Koulikoro, Republic of Mali. With her degree from a management institute, the Institut Universitaire de Gestion (IUG), and as a teacher in an elementary school, Aminata also has a side business involving clothing, cosmetics, and footwear. She does this to do better in meeting her personal expenses. She started with a solidarity loan before coming to individual loans. She has paid back her two preceding loans without any problems at all. Â  For this new loan, Aminata intends to purchase shoes, cosmetics, and clothing. Â She gets her supplies in LomÃ©, the capital of Togo. She sells wholesale to men and women customers of Bamako. She sells retail at work and out of her home. She plans on having 450,000 francs CFA in profit over the course of her loan cycle. Â The profits will be used to meet personal expenses and to cover the loan interest. Â

loan.use: Buying shoes, clothing, and cosmetics

loan.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr: Les femmes du groupe Danaya, toutes mariÃ©es, ont en moyenne 47 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles Ã©largies dans la ville de BarouÃ©li, prÃ©fecture de BarouÃ©li ; RÃ©gion de SÃ©gou (quatriÃ¨me rÃ©gion administrative de la rÃ©publique du Mali). Elles se sont connues Ã travers des liens de parentÃ© et font le commerce du lait, des habillements et font de la restauration. Les femmes du groupe Danaya sont Ã leur douziÃ¨me prÃªt solidaire qui sera utilisÃ© pour acheter des tÃªtes dâ€™animaux abattus dans les abattoirs, du lait et des tissus. ASSAN D. sâ€™approvisionne en tÃªtes dâ€™animaux quotidiennement avec les bouchers de la place, quâ€™elle prÃ©pare dans la sauce pour ensuite revendre, au comptant et Ã crÃ©dit, Ã une clientÃ¨le composÃ©e de femmes et dâ€™hommes. Elle envisage rÃ©aliser un bÃ©nÃ©fice moyen mensuel de 30 000FCFA qui sera utilisÃ© pour payer les Ã©chÃ©ances du prÃªt, prendre en charge les dÃ©penses relatives Ã la santÃ©, Ã la nourriture, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera rÃ©investi dans les activitÃ©s.
texts.en:
The women of Danaya Group ("Confidence") are all married. On average, they are 47 years old and have three children. They live in extended traditional families in the city of BarouÃ©li, prefecture of BarouÃ©li, region of SÃ©gou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know each other through ties of kinship.
They sell milk and clothing and work in catering. This is their twelfth solidarity loan which they will use to buy heads of slaughtered animals, milk and clothes.
Assan D. buys every day heads of slaughtered animals from the local butchers. She cooks them in a sauce and sells them, for cash and credit, to a clientele made up of women and men.
She expects to make an average profit of 30,000 CFA francs a month, which she will use to pay the installments of the loan, and provide her family with health care, food and tuition fees. Any remaining amount will be reinvested in her business.

texts.en:
Mr. Alou K. is 43 years old and lives in a polygamous family with his eight children and two wives in Konobougou city, BAROUELI prefecture (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). He is a teacher at the Koranic school. In addition to this profession, he is interested in revenue-generating work, especially in the commerce of grains.
Concerned about having substantial working capital, Alou joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on his sixth individual loan. Â He has paid back his previous loans properly. He plans on using this new loan to buy a few tonnes of grain in and around Beleko, Tisala, Nangola at an affordable price in order to resell the grain in his shop at the Konobougou market when grains are high in value. Â
Alou sells retail and for cash to customers from all walks of life in the city. He hopes to make an average monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA that will be used to meet family expenses. The rest will be invested in his business.

Monsieur Youba K. is 40 years old and he lives in a polygamous family with his four children and his wives in the town of Konobougou in the BarouÃ©li prefecture in the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

The women of Kafokatoala Group are all married. On average, they are 31 years old and have three children. The women of group Benkadi are all married and average 41 years of age and five children living in traditional extended families in Konobougou City, in BarouÃ©li prefecture, Region of SÃ©gou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members know one another through ties of kinship. Â They do commerce in clothing, and they work in food service. The group members are now on their 12th solidarity loan, which will be used to buy cosmetic products, clothing, condiments, and milk. Â
Ms. Bintou D. gets her supplies of clothing in Dakar and in Bamako. Accepting cash or credit from a customer base composed of women and men, she goes door-to-door each day selling in the different districts of Konobougou City. Â
Bintou envisions making an average monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA that will be used for making the loan payments and for assisting with societal ceremonies. The rest will be reinvested in her clothing business.

The women of the group Djekafo are all married and average 40 years of age and five children living in traditional extended families in Fana City in the Banankabougou district, Fana sub-prefecture, Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members know one another through ties of friendship, and they do commerce in clothing, vegetables, and honey. The group members are now on their 10th solidarity loan.
Ms. DJENEBA G. gets her supplies of clothing from wholesale merchants in Bamako (capital of Mali) almost monthly. Each day, accepting cash from a customer base composed of women and men, she makes her sales out of her home. Â On market days, she sells at the market. Â
She envisions making an average monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA that will be used for repaying the loan and for meeting expenses related to healthcare, food, and schooling. The rest will be reinvested in her clothing business.

The women of the group Siguidolo are all married and average 37 years of age and four children living in traditional extended families in Konobougou City, in BarouÃ©li prefecture, Region of SÃ©gou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). loan.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos es una madre de familia de 60 aÃ±os de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su Ãºltimo hijo de 17 aÃ±os en el caserÃ­o Pomape, una zona rural dedicada bÃ¡sicamente a labores agrÃ­colas que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de MonsefÃº, conocido a nivel nacional por sus festividades turÃ­stico â€“ religiosas, situado a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
Se dedica desde muy joven a labores de ganaderÃ­a, ella crÃ­a vacas y aprovecha la leche que producen para venderla a un acopiador de la zona que provee de este producto a una empresa procesadora de lÃ¡cteos, esta actividad es una fuente importante de ingresos para su familia por lo que trata de esforzarse para mantener el negocio. Para optimizar su producciÃ³n ella suele alimentar a sus animales con pastos naturales que adquiere a los agricultores del lugar.
Santos desea adquirir alimento balanceado para ayudar a sus vacas a seguir mejorando la calidad de la leche que producen. Esta inversiÃ³n es bastante importante para su negocio ya que en esta temporada los pastos y forrajes con los que usualmente alimenta a sus animales se ha vuelto escaso, por ello Santos ha querido solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crÃ©dito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su meta.
Santos ya ha tenido un crÃ©dito financiado por Kiva a travÃ©s de Edpyme Alternativa a travÃ©s de Edpyme Alternativa y del producto Capital Semilla. En aquella oportunidad pudo adquirir alimento balanceado y complementÃ³ la alimentaciÃ³n que solÃ­a darle a sus animales. Ello la ayudÃ³ a obtener una buena producciÃ³n y por eso se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida con las personas que colaboraron con ella a travÃ©s de Kiva.
texts.en: Santos is a 60-year-old mother who lives with her husband and youngest child, age 17, in the Pomape hamlet. Pomape is a rural zone dedicated mainly to agricultural labour and located in the MonsefÃº district, known on the national level for its tourist and religious festivities. It is located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She has worked in livestock from a very young age. She raises cows and sells the milk that they produce to a local collector who provides this product to a milk processing company. This is an important source of income for her family, so she tries to work hard to maintain the business. In order to optimize her production, she normally feeds her animals natural grass that she acquires from the local farmers. Santos wants to acquire balanced food to help her cows continue to improve the quality of their milk. This investment is very important for her business, since in this season the grass and fodder that she normally feeds them is scarce. Thus, Santos has decided to request a loan of 1000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa, which will allow her to achieve her goal. Santos has already had a loan financed on Kiva through Edpyme Alternativa and Capital Semilla. With that loan, she was able to acquire balanced food to complement the food that she normally gives her animals. It helped her to obtain a good production, an so she is very happy and grateful to the people who are working with her through Kiva.

loan.use: to acquire balanced food for her cows, to improve the quality of the milk that they produce.

loan.name: Deysi

texts.es:
Deysi tiene 25 aÃ±os de edad, es soltera y reside junto a su familia en el caserÃ­o Tranca Sasape, una zona agrÃ­cola que se encuentra situada en el distrito de MÃ³rrope. La localidad se caracteriza por estar habitada por personas bastante humildes y trabajadoras. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a mÃ¡s de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
Se dedica a la comercializaciÃ³n de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en un ambiente de su vivienda. Ella ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos de consumo diario que les son de difÃ­cil acceso debido a su ubicaciÃ³n alejada del pueblo central. Los ingresos que ella percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a sus padres con el sostenimiento de la economÃ­a de su familia.
Deysi siempre trata de brindar el mejor trato a sus clientes y por ello su negocio siempre cuenta con clientela estable. Actualmente ella desde adquirir mÃ¡s productos para satisfacer la demanda con la que cuenta, por ello ha creÃ­do conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crÃ©dito de 1200 nuevos soles con los cuales espera lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Deysi, 25, is single and lives with her family in the village of Tranca Sasape, in an agricultural area of MÃ³rrope district where quite humble and hard-working people live. It belongs to Lambayeque province and is located more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo. She sells staples and groceries in a store in part of her house. She has different products of daily use that are hard to find because of the distance from the town center. Deysi uses the earnings that she receives for personal expenses and to help her parents with the support of the family.
Deysi always tries to offer the best deal, and because of that, she has regular customers. She would now like to add more products to satisfy the demand that she depends upon, and so she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1200 new sols that she hopes will help her succeed.

loan.use: To add more products to satisfy the demand that she depends upon

loan.name: MarÃ­a Eugenia

texts.es:
MarÃ­a Eugenia tiene 58 aÃ±os de edad, es casada y no tiene hijos dependientes. Reside junto a su esposo en el caserÃ­o Huaca Rivera, una de las localidades que conforman el distrito de Pacora, una zona agrÃ­cola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque a mÃ¡s de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
Se dedica desde hace diez aÃ±os a la crianza y comercializaciÃ³n de animales menores. Ella crÃ­a los animales en unos corrales instalados en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un correcto desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Esta actividad le permita ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economÃ­a de su familia.
MarÃ­a desea adquirir mÃ¡s animales y alimento balanceado con la finalidad de ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos que le permitan mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Para realizar esta acciÃ³n y lograr su objetivo ha creÃ­do conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crÃ©dito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
MarÃ­a Eugenia is 58 years old, married and doesn't have any dependent children. She lives with her husband in the Huaca Rivera settlement, one of the localities that makes up the district of Pacora. This is an agricultural zone that is located in the Lambayeque province more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo.
She has been raising and selling small animals for ten years. She raises the animals in a pen that is set up in the rear of her house. She feeds them natural grains and grasses and when they are fully developed, she sells them to the businessmen that usually visit the area where she lives. This activity allows her to help her husband with the family's expenses.
MarÃ­a wants to purchase more animals and balanced feed so that she can expand her business, increase her income and thereby, improve her family's quality of life. To do this she is requesting a loan of 1500 nuevos soles [Peruvian currency] from Edpyme Alternativa.

loan.use: To purchase more small animals and feed

loan.name: Cory Yoovany

texts.es:
Cory tiene 39 aÃ±os de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrÃ­cola de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a mÃ¡s de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
Ella se dedica a la comercializaciÃ³n de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad en una bodega que se encuentra ubicada en su domicilio. El negocio tiene ya varios aÃ±os de funcionamiento y durante este tiempo ella se ha esforzado por brindar productos de buena calidad y un buen servicio a sus clientes. Estos factores le han permitido contar con una clientela estable, la cual siempre acude a su establecimiento para adquirir productos de consumo diario.
Cory desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mÃ¡s productos de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda con la que actualmente cuenta, por ello ha creÃ­do conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crÃ©dito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Cory is 39 years old and she lives with her husband and their two children in the Olmos district, a rural area with a regular commercial activity located in the Lambayeque province, located at more than three hours and a half from the town of Chiclayo.
She engages in selling groceries and general merchandise in a shop located in her own house. She has been running her shop for various years already, and during this time she has made many efforts to offer her customers good quality products and to treat them in a pleasant way. This has helped her gaining regular customers, who always go to her shop to buy everyday products.
Cory wishes to expand her shop by buying more products, in order to satisfy the request she currently receives. This is why she has judged it necessary to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 PEN loan that will help her reach her goal.

loan.use: To buy more products to expand her activity.

loan.name: Pedro Faustino

texts.es:
Pedro es un padre de familia de 47 aÃ±os de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en uno de los caserÃ­os que conforman el distrito de Las Lomas, una zona agrÃ­cola que pertenece a la regiÃ³n Piura y que se encuentra ubicado a mÃ¡s de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la regiÃ³n Lambayeque.
El cuenta con una panaderÃ­a y una bodega instalada en su domicilio. En la bodega el ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos de uso diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. En la panaderÃ­a el produce panes principalmente por la tarde. Pedro trata siempre de brindar a sus clientes productos de buena calidad y un buen trato por lo que cuenta siempre con una clientela fidelizada. Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades los utiliza para solventar los gastos econÃ³micos de su familia.
Pedro desea adquirir mÃ¡s insumos y productos para ampliar sus negocios y percibir mayores ingresos que le permitan seguir creciendo como empresario y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crÃ©dito de 700 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Pedro is a 47-year-old family man, living with his wife and their two children in one of the rural communities of the Las Lomas department, a rural area of the Piura region located at more than three hours and a half from Chiclayo, the capital city of the Lambayeque region.
He runs a bakery and a shop he has established in his house. In the shop he sells to his customer a variety of everyday products, among which general merchandise products and groceries. In the bakery he produces bread, mainly during the afternoon. Pedro always tries to offer his customers good quality products and to treat them well, and this is why he can count on regular customers. The money he earns with these activities is used to cover the economic expenses of his family.
Pedro wishes to buy more ingredients and products to expand his activities and obtain better incomes that will allow him to keep on growing as a businessman and to improve his familyâ€™s quality of life. For this reason he has judged it necessary to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a 700 PEN loan that will help him reach his goal.

loan.use: To buy more ingredients and products to expand his activities.

loan.name: Martha Yndalira

texts.es:
Martha tiene 31 aÃ±os de edad, es soltera y reside junto a sus padres y hermanos en uno de los caserÃ­os que conforman el distrito de Las Lomas, una zona agrÃ­cola que pertenece a la regiÃ³n Piura y que se encuentra ubicado a mÃ¡s de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la regiÃ³n Lambayeque.
Se dedica a trabajar en la venta de cerveza en su domicilio. Ella ofrece esta bebida a sus vecinos, los cuales la consumen preferentemente los fines de semana. El negocio le permite ayudar a su familia a mantener su economÃ­a diaria. El buen trato que brinda a sus clientes le ha permitido contar con una clientela estable que mantiene una preferencia por su negocio.
Martha desea comprar mÃ¡s cerveza para poder ampliar su negocio y satisfacer la demanda con la que cuenta actualmente, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crÃ©dito de 500 nuevos soles que contribuyan al logro de su objetivo.
texts.en:
Martha is 31 years old, she is single and lives with her parents in one of the rural communities of the Las Lomas department, a rural area of the Piura region located at more than three hours and a half from Chiclayo, the capital city of the Lambayeque region.
She engages in selling beer at her house, offering this beverage to her neighbors who consume it mainly during the week-ends. The activity allows her to help her family paying for their daily expenses. As she treats her customers very well, she has been able to gain regular customers she can count on as they keep choosing her shop.
Martha wishes to buy more beer in order to expand her activity and satisfy the request she currently receives. This is why she has judged it necessary to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a 500 PEN loan to help her reach her goal.

loan.use: To buy more beer in order to expand her activity.

loan.name: Juana MarÃ­a

texts.es:
Juana MarÃ­a tiene 41 aÃ±os de edad, es madre soltera y reside junto a sus dos hijos en uno de los caserÃ­os que conforman el distrito agrÃ­cola de Tambogrande. La zona es un distrito de clima semitropical que produce principalmente frutas como mango, maracuyÃ¡ y limÃ³n. Se encuentra ubicada en la regiÃ³n Piura, a mÃ¡s de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
Ella cuenta con un establecimiento en su domicilio en donde ofrece en venta comida, cerveza, piqueos y chicha de jora (bebida tradicional del perÃº hecha en base a maÃ­z). Juana MarÃ­a prepara sus alimentos en su domicilio y los ofrece en venta los fines de semana. Debido a la buena sazÃ³n con la que prepara su comida y a la buena atenciÃ³n que brinda, su negocio cuenta con una demanda estable. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para sacar adelante la economÃ­a de su familia.
Juana MarÃ­a desea adquirir mÃ¡s insumos para ampliar su negocio y poder satisfacer la demanda con la que actualmente cuenta, por ello ha creÃ­do conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crÃ©dito de 1000 nuevos soles que contribuyan al logro de su objetivo. Ella es una mujer bastante activa y trabajadora. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria hasta poder instalar un restaurante.
texts.en:
Juana MarÃ­a is 41 years old. She is a single mother and lives with her two children in one of the villages that make up the agricultural district of Tambogrande. This area has a semi-tropical climate and the main produce of the area is fruit such as mangoes, passion fruit and lemons. It is located in Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo.
Juana MarÃ­a has an establishment in her home where she sells meals, beer, snacks and 'chicha de jora' (a traditional Peruvian, corn-based drink). Juana MarÃ­a prepares the food in her home and sells it on weekends. Owing to the good taste of her meals and the good service that she provides, there is a stable demand for her business. She uses the profits that she makes from this activity to get her family ahead financially.
Juana MarÃ­a would like to acquire more supplies to expand her business and satisfy the demand that she has right now. For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa that will help her achieve her goal. Juana MarÃ­a is an active and hard-working woman. Her greatest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman until she is able to set up her own restaurant.

loan.use: To acquire more supplies so that she can expand her business and satisfy the demand that she has right now

loan.name: Rosa Delia

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 38 aÃ±os de edad, es divorciada y reside junto a sus tres hijos en uno de los caserÃ­os que conforman el distrito agrÃ­cola de Tambogrande, una zona de clima semitropical que produce principalmente frutas como mango, maracuyÃ¡ y limÃ³n. Pertenece a la regiÃ³n Piura y se encuentra ubicado a mÃ¡s de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la regiÃ³n Lambayeque.
Se dedica a la comercializaciÃ³n de prendas de vestir para todo pÃºblico. Ella ofrece su mercaderÃ­a en base a pedidos y tambiÃ©n cuenta con un stock permanente en su domicilio. Usualmente ofrece su mercaderÃ­a a los vecinos de la zona, aunque tambiÃ©n suele recorrer los caserÃ­o aledaÃ±os en busca de mÃ¡s clientes. Esta actividad es la Ãºnica que le permite hacerse cargo del mantenimiento de sus menores hijos, por lo que siempre trata de mantenerlo del mejor modo posible.
Rosa desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mÃ¡s mercaderÃ­a con prendas de vestir de temporada de verano, con esa inversiÃ³n ella pretende aumentar sus ventas y percibir mayores ingresos con los cuales pueda sacar adelante a sus menores hijos. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crÃ©dito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Rosa is 38 years old. She is divorced and lives with her three children in one of the villages that make up the agricultural district of Tambogrande. This is an area with a semi-tropical climate that mainly produces fruit such as mangos, passion fruit and lemons. It is located in Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.
Rosa sells clothes to the general public. She takes orders for her merchandise and also has a fixed stock in her home. She usually offers her merchandise to her neighbors, though she also travels to neighboring villages in search of more customers. This is the only business activity Rosa carries out to support her dependent children so she always does her best to maintain her business as well as possible.
Rosa would like to expand her business, buying more merchandise: clothes for the summer season. She is making this investment to increase her sales and make more profits which she can use to get her children ahead in life. In order to achieve her goal, she is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loan.use: To buy more merchandise: summer clothes

loan.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto tiene 54 aÃ±os de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en uno de los caserÃ­os que conforman el distrito agrÃ­cola de Tambogrande, la zona cuenta con un clima semitropical que produce principalmente frutas como el mango, limÃ³n y maracuyÃ¡. Pertenece a la regiÃ³n Piura y se encuentra ubicada a mÃ¡s de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la regiÃ³n Lambayeque.
Se dedica a trabajar en la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno y ovino. El crÃ­a ovejas y vacas en unos corrales situados cerca a su domicilio. Alberto vende las ovejas a sus vecinos y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Adicionalmente ofrece en venta la leche que producen sus vacas. Los ingresos que el percibe de estas actividades le sirven para sacar adelante la economÃ­a de su familia.
Alberto desea adquirir alimentos para mejorar la crianza de sus animales y poder percibir mayores ganancias que le permitan mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Por ello ha creÃ­do conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crÃ©dito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Alberto is 54 years old, married and lives with his wife and three children in one of the villages that make up the agricultural district of Tambogrande. The area has a semi-tropical climate and mainly produces fruit such as mangos, lemons and passion fruit. It is located in Piura region, more than one hour from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.
Alberto raises and sells cattle and sheep. He raises his sheep and cows in some pens located behind his home. Alberto sells the sheep to his neighbors and the traders who usually visit the area where he lives. He also sells the milk that his cows produce. The profits that Alberto makes from this business help him to get his family ahead financially.
Alberto would like to acquire animal feed so that he can improve his animal raising business and make more profits that will allow him to improve his family's quality of life. For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa that will help him achieve his goal.

loan.use: To acquire animal feed to improve his animal raising business

loan.name: Ballivian Group

texts.es: El Banco D. emprendimiento "Ballivian" esta en su segundo ciclo ha tenido un buen desempeÃ±o en su primer ciclo ha cumplido con el pago D. sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad las socias D. dicho banco son comerciantes minoristas D. venta D. comida y servicios, la presidenta es la Sr. MarÃ­a que se dedica a la venta D. comida es una persona muy trabajadora se levanta desD. muy tempranas horas D. la maÃ±ana para preparar sus deliciosos platos y despuÃ©s lo va a vender en su puesto D. venta donD. le va muy bien ya que tiene mucha clientela por el buen sazÃ³n D. sus platillos, con el dinero del crÃ©dito comprara insumos como aceite, papa, fideo, por mayor para la elaboraciÃ³n D. sus platillos, esta agradecida con la instituciÃ³n por el apoyo brindado. Las socias sacaron el crÃ©dito para aumentar su capital para sus actividades y se fueron muy satisfechos con el crÃ©dito
texts.en: The Ballivian bank is in its second cycle and had a good performance in its first cycle, paying its quotas with great responsibility. The members of this bank are merchants who sell food and proviD. services. The president is Maria, who sells food. She is a very hard-working woman who gets up very early in the morning to prepare her delicious dishes, and after she goes to her sales stall. It is going very well and she has many customers because of the good flavour of her dishes. With the money from this loan she will purchase wholesale inputs such as oil, potatoes, and pasta for making her dishes. She is grateful to the institution for the support offered. The members have taken out this loan to increase their capital for their businesses and have been very satisfied with the loan.

loan.use: the purchase of inputs

loan.name: Yegana

texts.ru:
Yegana M. 37 let. Ona yavlyayetsya IDP personom , ona pereselenec iz Kalbadjar regiona i seychas projivayet v Absheron regione so svoyey semyoy. Ona ne zamujem i ne imeyet detey.
Yegana uje 8 let kak rabotayet uchitelnicey. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit knigi i testi dlya svoix uchenikov.
texts.en:
Yegana M. is 37 years old. She is an Internally Displaced Person from the Kalbadjar Region, now living in the Absheron Region with her relatives. She is single, without children.
Yegana has been working as a school teacher for eight years. At present she needs 2,000 AZN in order to buy books and tests for her students.

loan.use: Purchasing books and tests for her students

loan.name: Gulnara

texts.ru:
Gulnara B. 41 let. Ona zamujem i imeyet odnu dochku kotoraya uchistya v kolledje. Ona jivet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoim mujem i dochkoy.
Gulnara uje 9 let kak rabotayet parexmaxerom v s voyom solone. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit nujnuyu elektro-texniku dlya svoyey raboti, tak kak yeyo elektro -texniks uje staroye i mnoqiye isportilis.
texts.en:
Gulnara B. is 41 years old. She is married and has a daugther, who is a college student. She lives in the Absheron Region with her husband and daughter.
For nine years already, Gulnara has been working as a hairdresser in her own salon. At present she needs 2000 AZN to buy the necessary electrical appliances for her work, since her appliances are old and many donâ€™t work properly.

loan.use: Buying the necessary electrical appliances for her work

loan.name: Huseyn

texts.ru:
Huseyn A. 29 let. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. On projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoimi roditelyami.
Seychas Huseyn nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit testi i knigi dlya svoix uchenikov kotoriye sobirayustay postupat v universiteti, tak kak eti testi stoyat dorogo ne kajdiy uchnik imeyet vozmojnosti pokupat ix. Huseyn uje 2 qoda kak rabotayet uchitelem.
texts.en:
Huseyn A. is 29 years old. He is single, without children. He lives in the Absheron Region together with his parents.
At present Huseyn needs 2000 AZN in order to buy tests and books for his students who plan to apply to college, because these tests are expensive, and not all students can afford them. Huseyn has been working as a schoolteacher for two years.

loan.use: Purchasing tests and books for his students

loan.name: Tunzala

texts.ru:
Tunzala S. 40 let. Ona zamujem i imeyet 2 detey. Tunzala jivet v qorode Baku vmeste so svoim mujom i detmi, kotoriye uchatsya v kolledje.
Tunzala uje 7 let kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom prodaji produktov. Ranshe Tunzala prodovala korm dlya jivotnix ,tak je moyushiye sredstva i t.d a seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chto bi kupit uje pishiviye produkti dlya prodaji i razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa.
texts.en:
Tunzala S. is forty years old. She is married and has two children. Tunzala lives in the city of Baku with her children, who study in college, and with her husband.
Tunzala has been selling foodstuffs for seven years. Before that, Tunzala sold pet food, cleaning supplies, and other things. Now, she needs 2000 AZN to buy foodstuffs for sale and to expand her business.

loan.use: Buying goods for resale

loan.name: Shakhin

texts.ru:
Shakhin Z. 28 let. On jenat no poka ne imeyet detey. Shakhin jivet v qorode Baku so svoyey jenoy. Shakhin uje 5 let kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom , v qruzavoy mashine vodit qruz.
Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya svoyey qruzovoy mashini, tak kak yeqo mashina isportilas i on ne mojet vodit qruzi.
texts.en:
Shakhin Z. is 28 years old. He is married, but as of yet still does not have children. Shakhin lives in the city of Baku with his wife. Shakhin has been working as a truck driver hauling freight for five years.
Now he needs 2000 AZN to buy parts for his truck. His truck broke down and he currently cannot haul freight.

loan.use: Buying parts for a truck

loan.name: Sevda

texts.ru:
Sevda B. 47 let. Ona zamujem i imeyet 5 detey, 3 iz kotorix uchatsya v kolledje a dva ix kotorix uchatsya v shkole. Sevda jivet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoim mujem i detmi.
Sevda uje 12 let kak rabotayet uchitelniccey. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi rasshirit pomesheniye qde ona zanimayetsya so svoimi uchenikami tak kak ix stanovitsya bolshe i ona zanimayetsya qruppami.
texts.en:
Sevda B. is 47 years old. She is married and has five children. Three of her children go to college while the other two go to school. Sevda lives in the Absheron region with her husband and children.
Sevda has been a teacher for twelve years. She needs 2000 AZN to expand her classroom since the students she teaches as a group are growing up.

loan.use: To expand her classroom

loan.name: Shasta Daisy Group

texts.en:
Nancy R. is from the village of Sepac Sapang Dalaga Mis. Occ. She is 37 years old. Nancy is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Shasta Daisy.
Nancy is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Nancy owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as canned goods, noodles, milk, sugar, spices, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Nancy has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2010, Nancy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nancy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Nancy is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Nancy from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.
About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: to purchase additional products to resell and acquire working capital.

loan.name: Lucel's Group

texts.en:

Lucel is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a tailoring business, providing new clothing services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $46 a month for these activities.

loan.name: Ikhbayar

texts.en: Ikhbayar is 30 years old, married, and the father of two children. He lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. His family lives together in a small wooden house. His wife Urangua works as a warehouse keeper at a construction company. His older son goes to a local secondary school, while his younger son stays at home. Ikhbayar has been operating a taxi service in the city for the last three years. He also works for a construction company as a plumber on a part-time basis. In the mornings, he takes his wife to work and his son to school. He is a very hard-working person who is providing a good education for his children. This is his third Kiva loan through Credit Mongol. He has used his previous loans appropriately, paying them back in full on time. This time he is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to complete improvements to his house.

loan.use: Home improvements

loan.name: Junifer

texts.en:
Junifer A. is from the village of Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 24 years old. Junifer is single. To make a living, Junifer works in someone else's business operating jeepney transport services. Junifer has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2010, Junifer joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Junifer is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Junifer from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

loan.name: Odelio's Group

texts.en:
Odelio A. is from the village of Brgy. Lantap, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 42 years old. Odelio is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
Odelio is single. To make a living, Odelio owns & operates a business preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Odelio has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2010, Odelio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Odelio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Odelio is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Odelio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.
About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loan.name: Zahidahan's Group

texts.en:
Zahidahan U., 37, is the leader of this group. She is married and brings up a daughter and two sons. Her husband earns money by repairing household appliances and the children are at school. Zahidahan herself is engaged in farming. She started this activity in 1996, when the collective farms broke up. The family was given a piece of land for farming. She applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase mineral fertilizers and to hire labor for plowing the land. In the future, she wants to provide a good education for her children.
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line â€“ People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan â€“ Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loan.use: To purchase mineral fertilizers

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: To pay for services to increase his crop yield

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loan.name: Munkherdene

texts.en: Munkherdene is 24 years old, married, and has one son. His family lives together in a wooden house on their plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife Nyamdulam, who is also 24 years old, is studying to become a lawyer at a state university. Their parents take care of their son in Bayankhongor province. Munkherdene used to work at an auto repair shop as a manager. In 2009, he began operating his own business replacing and fixing car windshields. Munkherdene is planning to expand his business in the future. He is requesting 2,800,000 MNT loan to increase his working capital.

loan.use: Working capital

loan.name: Bernard

texts.en:
46-year-old Bernard M. is a farmer from the town of Murang'a in central Kenya. He has been in the farming business for 10 years and employs two farmhands. His farm produces coffee and horticultural products, which he sells through a local cooperative society. Farming is his main source of income.
He has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo of 53,000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He hopes that his income, through the sale of milk and this loan, will help improve the livelihood of his family. His primary challenges are lack of reliable vet doctors and artificial insemination services. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to produce over 50 liters of milk daily.
Bernard is married with three children who all attend school.

loan.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loan.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a farmer from the town of Murang'a in central Kenya where she has been farming for 18 years. She employs one farmhand. Her mixed farm produces milk, maize and beans, which she sells to the local market. She also earns income from her small-scale business.
Agnes is 48 years old and married with four children. Two of the children are adults and two attend school.
She has requested this loan of 53,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase an insured cow and construct a dairy unit. She says that this loan will enable her to acquire a quality dairy cow that will increase her income through the sale of milk. In future, she hopes to construct a good zero grazing unit that will enable her to increase the number of dairy cows from one to five.

loan.use: To purchase an insured cow and construct a dairy unit.

loan.name: Soeun

texts.en:
Mr. Soeun S. (shown in the photo) is 32 years old and his wife, Mrs. Somnang Poch, is 31 years old. They have been married since 1996 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number One about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
Soeun and his wife are farmers. They grow rice and lotus on their farmland in the village. Besides farming, Soeun is a fisherman as well. He is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm.

loan.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide

loan.name: Thai

texts.en:
Mr. Thai H. (shown in the photo) and his wife, Mrs. Sakhorn Sbaung, live along National Road Number Six, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. The couple is old, but they are still strong enough to work.
Mr.Thai H. and his wife are rice and lotus farmers. Farming is the main business to support their standard of living. They hope to continue the business by purchasing seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain their farm. Therefore, Thai is applying for another loan in the amount of $500.

loan.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm.

loan.name: Sam-Aun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-aun S. (shown in the photo) is 35 years old and her husband, Mr. Borom Pil, is 36 years old. They have been married since 1996 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. All of them are in school. The family lives along national road number six about 10 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
Sam-aun sells steamed corn. Her husband is a construction worker. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting and to buy construction materials for her husband.

loan.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting and to buy construction materials for her husband.

loan.name: David

texts.en:
David is 42 years old and married with three school-aged children who all attend school. He is a farmer from Murang'a town in central Kenya where he has been farming for 20 years and employs five farmhands. His mixed farm produces coffee, horticultural products and milk which he sells to the local market and through Kenya Co-operative Creameries. He depends solely on the income from his farming activities to cater for his family's basic needs.
He has requested this loan of 53,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help improve his family's livelihood. He faces the challenge of a lack of veterinary services. He hopes to acquire five more high-yielding dairy cows in future.

loan.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loan.name: Sal

texts.en:
Mrs. Sal H. (pictured above), 33 years old, and her husband, Mr. Savon Leng, also 33 years old, have been married since 1998 and have three children - two sons and one daughter. They live in a small village along National Road Number Three about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Mr. Savon Leng sells fruit in the local market.
Mrs. Sal H. stays at home and does housework. The main source of income is from her husbandâ€™s business. She is requesting her first loan of US$1,000 to purchase neighboring land to expand her property.

loan.use: To purchase neighboring land to expand her property

loan.name: Shaimkan's Group

texts.en:
Kyrgyz and Russian markets are interdependent. Russia imports fresh vegetables, fruits and dried fruits from Kyrgyzstan, which in turn is dependent on Russian flour and grains. So far the exchange has been successful and both sides are hoping for a bright future of goods exchange.
Shaimkan A., 52, is a treasurer of this group. Itâ€™s been 19 years since she and her husband began exporting fresh vegetables and fruits to Russian markets. They have raised two sons and a daughter, who have chosen different professions in life. Their daughter became a professional cook, one of their sons chose electrical maintenance, the other became a musician.
After she was widowed, Shaimkan decided to stop her involvement in international trade and she started working in a local food market. She invested 20,000 soms for a business start-up. Now she earns 17,000 soms in monthly profit and puts this back into goods circulation. Shaimkan joined this group for a loan that would bring changes to her life. She would like to diversify the goods in her shop, and spend the proceeds on purchasing a new house.
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line â€“ People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (being environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our lending team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan â€“ Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loan.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables to sell

loan.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is a farmer from Murang'a town in central Kenya where she has been farming for 16 years. She employs 2-4 casual laborers daily. Her main products are maize, milk, beans and eggs which she sells locally. She also runs a small business in the same location.
She has requested this loan of 50,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to improve her poultry project. The income from the sale of eggs will help improve her family's livelihood. She is currently rearing 30 layers but hopes to increase to over 2000 layers in future.
Winnie is 36 years old and married with five children who are between the ages of three and 16. Three of the children attend school.

loan.use: To improve her poultry project

loan.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has a mixed farm in Murang'a town, central Kenya, that produces coffee, tea and milk which he sells through Kenya Co-operative Creameries and Kenya Tea Development Authority. He occasionally employs three casual laborers. Farming is his only source of income.
He has requested this loan of 53,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help improve his family's livelihood. In future, he hopes to increase the number of his dairy cows from the current one to five high-yielding dairy cows.
Joseph is 37 years old and married with one child aged seven who attends school.

loan.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loan.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a farmer from Murang'a town in central Kenya. She has been farming for 13 years and employs one farmhand. Her mixed farm produces maize, beans and eggs, which she sells to the local market.
She has requested this loan of 50,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to expand her poultry farming. The extra income from this loan will help improve the livelihood of her family. Her biggest challenge in farming has been diseases, which affects her production. She currently has 12 layers and intends to improve in the future by acquiring at least 3,000 layers.
Lucy is 32 years old and married with three school-aged children who all attend school.

loan.use: To expand her poultry farming.

loan.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 46 years old and married with four children who are between the ages of 1 and 15. Three of the children are currently attending school. He is a farmer from the town of Murang'a in central Kenya where he has been farming for 30 years. He employs one farmhand. His farm produces coffee and milk, which he sells to the local market and through Kenya Co-operative Creameries, respectively. He is also employed.
He has requested this loan of 53,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will go towards the education of his children. In five years' time, he hopes that he will be able to produce more than 50 litres of milk daily.
He is happy for the development projects that Juhudi is giving to the small-scale farmers.

loan.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loan.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew has a mixed farm in the town of Murang'a in central Kenya that produces coffee and milk. He has been in the farming business for the last 10 years and employs one farmhand. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to provide the basic needs of his family.
He has requested this loan of 53,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help improve the livelihood of his family. In the future, he would like to acquire at least three dairy cows, which will improve his milk production. He faces the challenge of lack of artificial insemination services.
Mathew is 37 years old and married with one child, age 4, who attends school.

loan.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loan.name: Malikahon's Group

texts.en:
Malikahon S., 50, is the treasurer of this group. She is married to a barman. She has raised two sons. Both sons are working in Russia in a furniture factory. In order to earn money to cover family expenses, Malikahon sells convenience goods on the market. In this way, she earns 8,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase a variety of goods in order to increase the turnover of her business. In the future she wants to expand her business and open one more trade place.
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line â€“ People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan â€“ Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loan.use: To purchase convenience goods

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loan.name: Edith Amondi

texts.en:
Edith Amondi N. is 24 years old and resides at Kopere in Kapsabet town. She is a single lady and has one child who she supports. Her child is one year old. For the past two years, Edith has operated a salon in Kopere trading centre. Her monthly profits from the business are 8,500 KES.
She has borrrowed a loan of 40,000 KES, which she intends to use to purchase braids and hair driers for her business. The anticipated profits will be saved for her child's future education. This is Edith's third loan from KADET LTD. Her previous loan of 20,000 KES was paid back successfully. In the future, she hopes to move her business from a rural area to the city. She also hopes to open a supermarket and educate her child.

loan.use: To purchase braids and hair driers

loan.name: Karamathon's Group

texts.en:
Karamathon S. is the leader of this group. She is 65 and married. Her husband is retired and receives a monthly pension of 2,500 soms. Together they raised three sons and a daughter. The sons are working in construction and the daughter is in Russia. Karamathon and her husband are engaged in livestock breeding. By reselling the livestock animals after fattening, they earn 5,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, the family wants to purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future, Karamathon wants to purchase a piece of land and start building a house for her older son.
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line â€“ People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan â€“ Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loan.use: To purchase livestock

loan.name: Aurenila Domingo's Group

texts.en:
Aurenila D., aged 44, is from the village of Pulay, Luna, Isabela. She is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
Aurenila is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Aurenila owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Aurenila has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP monthly.
In 2007, Aurenila joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. Aurenila is requesting a new loan of 22,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the sixth loan that Aurenila has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.
About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loan.name: Sophie

texts.en:
Sophie N. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Sophie has a retail shop business, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Sophie has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase sugar and soap. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Sophie hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, she hopes to become an accountant. Sophie is a member of BRACâ€™s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her to protect herself in a positive way.

loan.use: To purchase sugar and soap for resale

loan.name: Rady

texts.en:
Mrs. Rady S. (in the photo), 46 years old, and her husband, Mr. Vannak Monh, 47 years old, live in a village along National Road Number Two about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1984 and have seven children - three sons and four daughters. One is married, another one is a garment factory worker and five attend school.
Rady is hired by manufacturers in her village to recycle. Her husband is a construction worker. She is asking for her first loan of $1,200 to dig a well for family use, to fill up the land of her house's foundation and to purchase a motorbike for her daughter to get to work.
