loan.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loan.name: Felix

texts.es: El Sr. FÃ©lix oriundo de la Zona de Valle grande Santa Cruz hace 5 aÃ±os se dedica al transporte publico vive junto con su esposa quien es ama de casa y sus 2 hijos que se encuentran estudiando, cuenta con una lÃ­nea (acciones) y un microbÃºs el dinero que solicita es para hacer repara el motor de su microbÃºs la cual es su Ãºnica fuente de ingresos cuenta con deuda en otra instituciÃ³n pero ha demostrado ser un buen cliente. El sr FÃ©lix junto a su familia viven en alquiler y mas adelante desean tener su propia casa en la cual puedan vivir tranquilos y con comodidad es una persona muy trabajadora y siempre velando por el bienestar de sus hijos y de su esposa, esta agradecido con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
FÃ©lix is from Valle Grande district, in Santa Cruz. For the past 5 years he has been providing public transport services. He lives together with his wife, who is a housewife, and his two children who are studying. FÃ©lix has a route (shares) and a minibus. He is requesting this loan to repair his minibus engine as it is his only source of income. He has a debt with another institution but he has shown himself to be a good client.
FÃ©lix and his family rent their house and, in the future, they would like to own their own home in which they could live peacefully and comfortably. FÃ©lix is a very hard-working person who is always looking out for the well-being of his children and his wife. He is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered him.

loan.use: To repair his minibus engine

loan.name: Mabel Yudy

texts.es: La seÃ±ora Mabel Yudy R. FigueR. es una emprendedora mujer de 40 aÃ±os que vive en el barrio Universal de la ciudad de Barranquilla en compaÃ±Ã­a de sus tres hijas y un nieto. Tiene una venta de comidas rÃ¡pidas en la cual ofrece perros calientes, hamburguesas, bandejas de papitas fritas con salchichas y arepas rellenas con queso, pollo y carne molida. El negocio funciona en su casa los viernes, sÃ¡bados, domingos y festivos. Su jornada laboral comienza a las 4 P.M. y se extiende hasta la media noche. En la preparaciÃ³n de los alimentos y la atenciÃ³n al pÃºblico le colaboran sus dos hijas mayores. El negocio naciÃ³ hace 3 aÃ±os por sugerencia de algunos vecinos quienes conocen sus aptitudes culinarias. AdemÃ¡s del negocio de comidas, ella tiene una mÃ¡quina de coser familiar en la que elabora cubre lechos y cortinas por encargo. Este es el primer crÃ©dito que ella tramita con la FundaciÃ³n Mario Santo Domingo y planea invertirlo en comprar varios juegos de sillas y mesas plÃ¡sticas al igual que ingredientes para sus productos. El promedio de ventas semanales es de $400.000 COP y el margen de utilidad es del 40%. El esposo de la microempresaria estÃ¡ en Europa y a pesar que le colabora en los gastos de la casa, siente la ausencia de la figura paterna en la educaciÃ³n de sus hijas. En un futuro, la seÃ±ora Mabel piensa alquilar un local para independizar el negocio del hogar y tambiÃ©n para vender almuerzos diariamente. Si Ã©ste proyecto llega a concretarse, piensa utilizar la misma estrategia empleada hasta ahora: excelentes productos al mejor precio de la plaza.
texts.en:
Mabel Yudy R. FigueR. is an enterprising, 40 year-old woman who lives in Universal neighborhood, in the city of Barranquilla, together with her three daughters and a grandchild. Mabel's business is selling fast food. She sells hot dogs, burgers, trays of French fries with sausages and rolls filled with cheese, chicken and ground meat. She runs her business from her home on Fridays, Saturdays, Sundays and holidays. Her work day starts at 4.00pm and lasts until midnight. Mabel's two eldest daughters help her in preparing the food and serving customers. She started her business 3 years ago on the recommendation of some of her neighbors who know how good she is at cooking.
As well as running her food business, Mabel also has a family sewing machine with which she sews bedclothes and drapes to order. This is her first loan from FundaciÃ³n Mario Santo Domingo and she plans to invest it in buying several sets of plastic tables and chairs as well as ingredients for making her food.
Mabel's average weekly sales amount to 400,000 Colombian pesos and her profit margin is 40%. This small businesswoman's husband is in Europe and although he helps with the household expenses, the absence of a father figure is felt in the education of her daughters. In the future, Mabel is planning to hire premises so that she can separate her business from her home and also so that she can sell meals every day. If this project becomes a reality, she is planning to use the same strategy she has used up to now: offer excellent products at the best price.

loan.use: To buy several sets of plastic tables and chairs as well as ingredients for making her food

loan.name: Magoma Nezikokolima Group-Mityana

texts.en: Emmanuel K. is 45 years old, married, and has five children. He is a member of the Magoma Nezikokolima group-Mityana. Emmanuel has been operating his pub business in Kiyoganyi trading center for 20 years. He says he got ideas on how to run a business from his parents. Before that, he was working as a bartender and doing some farming. Emmanuel's business generates 20,000 shillings weekly. With this loan, Emmanuel is going to buy more crates of both soft and hard drinks to sell at his pub.

loan.use: To purchase crates of both soft and hard drinks for resell at his pub

loan.name: Julio

texts.es: El seÃ±or Julio tiene como principal actividad econÃ³mica el servicio tÃ©cnico en reparaciÃ³n de televisores, radios DVD y otros aparatos electrÃ³nicos, la mayor parte de su conocimiento en el Ã¡rea lo adquiriÃ³ de manera empÃ­rica con la practica y tambiÃ©n pasando cursos de mantenimiento tÃ©cnico, brinda este servicio en un ambiente en una calle muy comercial de la ciudad de la Paz, el vive en la zona de alto Tacagua en casa de su mama junto a su esposa y a sus hijos, su esposa es enfermera y ayuda en los gastos familiares, don julio trabaja desde la maÃ±ana hasta la noche para poder solventar los gastos de su familia y en un futuro poder comprar una casa propia, el prÃ©stamo que solicito es para la compra de televisores actividad en la que piensa incursionar para incrementar sus ingresos, sus conocimientos en esta Ã¡rea ayudaron a tomar esta decisiÃ³n, esta agradecido con la instituciÃ³n por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Julio's main business activity is repairing televisions, radios, DVD players and other electrical appliances. He acquired most of his knowledge in the field in an empirical manner, through practice. He also took some courses in technical maintenance. He provides his service in a street with a lot of commercial activity in the city of La Paz.
Julio lives in Alto Tacagua district, in his mom's house, together with his wife and children. His wife is a nurse and helps with the family's expenses. Julio works from morning to evening in order to cover his family's expenses and so that, in the future, he can buy his own home. He will use this loan to buy televisions, an activity which he is thinking of breaking into in order to increase his income. His knowledge in this field helped him to take this decision. He is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered him.

loan.use: To buy televisions

loan.name: Ong'angi

texts.en:
Ong'angi is 36 years old and married with four school-aged children who all attend school. He is a farmer from the town of Kisii in western Kenya where he has been farming for eighteen years. He sells his maize, beans, vegetables and tea to the local market and through Kenya Tea Development Authority. Ong'angi is also a primary school teacher.
Ong'angi is requesting a loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The income from the sale of milk will go towards the education of his children. Ong'angiâ€™s biggest business challenges have been diseases, poor weather conditions, and poor infrastructure. In future, Ong'angi plans to acquire a vehicle to help him transport his products to the market. He also plans to open a big retail shop.

loan.use: to purchase a cow

loan.name: Sandra

texts.es: La seÃ±ora Sandra VÃ¡squez L. tiene 39 aÃ±os, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 21 y 16 aÃ±os en el barrio Los Jardines de la ciudad de Cartagena, la mÃ¡s turÃ­stica e histÃ³rica de Colombia. Ella tiene en su residencia un taller de modisterÃ­a en el cual produce principalmente blusas, faldas y vestidos de mujer. AprendiÃ³ ese oficio hace veinte aÃ±os ayudÃ¡ndole a una amiga en otro taller, luego decidiÃ³ independizarse y compro su primera mÃ¡quina de coser. Hoy cuenta con una buena clientela formada por vecinos, familiares, amigos y referidos de otros sectores de la ciudad. El Ã©xito de su negocio estÃ¡ en producir prendas sobre medida, porque segÃºn ella, no existen dos mujeres que tengan cuerpos idÃ©nticos. AdemÃ¡s de confeccionar, la seÃ±ora Sandra suele aconsejar a sus clientas quÃ© tipo de moda y color es el que mejor se acomoda a su figura. Con los ingresos que genera su negocio aporta a la financiaciÃ³n del 40 % de los gastos familiares y ha podido sufragar los estudios universitarios de su hijo mayor. Este es el sexto prÃ©stamo que tramita con la FundaciÃ³n Mario Santo Domingo y planea invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos y accesorios. Con el primer prÃ©stamo recibido comprÃ³ una mÃ¡quina de coser industrial y con el segundo una fileteadora, esto le ha permitido mejorar sustancialmente el acabado de las prendas.Sus ventas mensuales ascienden a $1.200.000 COP y el margen de utilidad es del 45%. La seÃ±ora Sandra alterna su oficio de confeccionista con la producciÃ³n de adornos en cerÃ¡mica. En la decoraciÃ³n de estos Ãºltimos le colabora su hijo menor en sus ratos libres, ella dice que hay que ser ingeniosos a la hora de generar ingresos porque en materia de trabajo no se pueden colocar todos los huevos en la misma canasta.
texts.en:
Sandra VÃ¡squez L. is 39 years old. She lives with her husband and two children, aged 21 and 16, in Los Jardines neighborhood, in the city of Cartagena, the most historic city in Colombia which also attracts most tourists.
Sandra has a dressmaking workshop in her home where she mainly makes women's blouses, skirts and dresses. She learned this trade twenty years ago, helping a friend in another workshop. She then decided to start working independently and bought her first sewing machine. Today she has a good customer base made up of neighbors, family members, friends and people from other areas of the city who she has been recommended to. The success of Sandra's business lies in producing made-to-measure clothes because she believes that no two women have identical bodies.
As well as making clothes, Sandra usually advises her customers about what type of fashion and color best suits their figure. She uses the profits from her business to cover 40% of her family's expenses and she has also been able to pay for her eldest son's university studies.
This is Sandra's sixth loan with FundaciÃ³n Mario Santo Domingo and she plans to invest it in buying fabric, threads and accessories. She used her first loan to buy an industrial sewing machine and her second to buy an overlock sewing machine. This has allowed her to substantially improve the finishing steps of making her clothes.
Sandra's monthly sales amount to 1,200,000 Colombian pesos and her profit margin is 45%. Sandra divides her time between her dressmaking business and making ceramic decorations. Her youngest son helps her to decorate these in his free time. She says that you have to be clever when it comes to making income because, as far as work is concerned, you can't afford to put all your eggs in one basket.

loan.use: To buy fabric, threads and accessories

loan.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is 57 years old and married with seven adult children. For the past 25 years, he has been in the farming business. Fredrickâ€™s farm is located in Kisii town, western Kenya, where he produces beans, maize and tea to sell at the local market and through the Kenya Tea Development Authority. He depends on the income from his farm to provide for the basic needs of his family.
Fredrick is requesting a loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that his family will be assured of enough milk for both domestic consumption and sale. The profits from this loan will help improve Fredrickâ€™s farm. In the future, he plans to acquire more dairy cows and expand his milk production.

loan.use: to purchase a cow

loan.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunalâ€ CHIKONâ€; El banco estÃ¡ ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Luzmila; ella tiene 25 aÃ±os de edad, conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia es ama de casa, se dedica al cuidado de su hijo y de su casa , por el momento es la Ãºnica actividad que realiza ya que despuÃ©s desea buscar un empleo el cual le pueda brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y ella pueda sentirse mejor.
La socia solicita el prÃ©stamo para la compra de productos para su hogar de primera necesidad y para su uso personal.
La socia estÃ¡ feliz por el prÃ©stamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Luzmila is a member of the "CHIKON" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.
Luzmila is 25 years old. She lives with her partner and has one child. She is a housewife who looks after her child and her home. At the moment, this is the only activity that she carries out since she later wants to look for a job which will enable her to provide her child with a better quality of life and enable herself to feel better.
Luzmila is requesting this loan to buy essentials for her household and for personal use. She is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loan.use: To buy essentials for her household and for personal use

loan.name: Moises

texts.es: El Sr. MoisÃ©s vive en la zona del plan 3000, vive ahÃ­ desde hace 8 aÃ±os en alquiler, tiene dos lotes en la urb. SatÃ©lite donde esta construyendo su casa. El tiene una imprenta y serigrafÃ­a el cual lo atienden junto a su esposa y una de sus hijas, por estas fiestas de fin de aÃ±o tienen mucho trabajo en la elaboraciÃ³n de tarjetas y calendarios, el crÃ©dito que esta solicitando es para comprar materiales de construcciÃ³n para terminar de construir su casa. El sr. MoisÃ©s es proactivo en su trabajo y cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijas, son una familia muy unida, esta agradecido con la instituciÃ³n por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
MoisÃ©s lives in Plan 3000 neighborhood. He has been living in a rented house there for 8 years. He has two plots of land in the SatÃ©lite development where he is building a house.
MoisÃ©s has a printing and silk screen printing business where he works together with his wife and one of his daughters. They have a lot of work with the end-of-year holiday season, making cards and calendars.
MoisÃ©s is requesting a loan to buy building materials so that he can finish building his house. MoisÃ©s is proactive in his work and has the support of his daughters. They are a very close family. He is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered him.

loan.use: To buy building materials

loan.name: Elena Mercedes

texts.es: La seÃ±ora Elena Mercedes MelÃ©ndez Q. es una laboriosa mujer de 69 aÃ±os que vive en compaÃ±Ã­a de un hijo y tres nietos en el municipio de San Jacinto, centro del departamento de BolÃ­var, al norte del paÃ­s. Esta localidad es famosa nacionalmente por sus hermosas artesanÃ­as, especialmente hamacas, mochilas y sombreros. La microempresaria tiene desde hace treinta aÃ±os en su casa un taller de modisterÃ­a en el cual produce vestidos, pantalones, uniformes escolares, blusas y camisas. Estas Ãºltimas las decora con bordados manuales y vende en promedio a $120.000 COP por requerir tanto trabajo. Ella aprendiÃ³ la modisterÃ­a siendo muy joven en su pueblo natal, viendo cÃ³mo su mamÃ¡ les hacÃ­a los trajes y pantalones a sus hermanos menores. Al principio cosÃ­a a mano su propia ropa, luego su padre le regalÃ³ una mÃ¡quina de coser familiar y asÃ­ empezÃ³ a coser para otras personas. Este es el primer crÃ©dito que tramita con la FundaciÃ³n Mario Santo Domingo y planea invertirlo en comprar telas, hilos, botones y accesorios. El promedio de venta mensual es de $ 1.200.000 COP y su margen de utilidad es del 40%. En los meses de Enero y Febrero las ventas aumentan considerablemente por la demanda de uniformes para la temporada escolar. La seÃ±ora Elena es viuda, tiene cuatro hijos que trabajan y le colaboran econÃ³micamente. Confeccionar prendas de vestir es para ella un oficio muy agradable que seguirÃ¡ ejerciendo mientras tenga buena salud y bordar, mÃ¡s que un trabajo, es una actividad que la entretiene. Dice con orgullo que es una autodidacta, nunca asistiÃ³ a ninguna escuela tÃ©cnica y su mayor satisfacciÃ³n es ver lucir a sus clientes la ropa que ella produce.
texts.en:
Elena Mercedes MelÃ©ndez Q. is a hard-working, 69 year-old woman who lives with one of her sons and three grandchildren in the town of San Jacinto, in the center of BolÃ­var province, in the north of the country. This town is famous nationwide for its beautiful handicrafts, especially hammocks, backpacks and hats.
This small businesswoman has had a dressmaking workshop in her home for thirty years. She makes dresses, pants, school uniforms, blouses and shirts. She decorates these last items, embroidering them by hand and sells them for an average of 120,000 Colombian pesos as they require a lot of work. Elena learned her trade as a dressmaker in her home town when she was very young. She watched how her mom made dresses and pants for her younger siblings. At the beginning, Elena used to sew her own clothes by hand, then her father gave her a family sewing machine as a present and she started sewing for other people.
This is Elena's first loan with FundaciÃ³n Mario Santo Domingo and she plans to invest it in buying fabric, threads, buttons and accessories. Her monthly sales average is 1,200,000 Colombian pesos and her profit margin is 40%. During the months of January and February her sales increase considerably as there is a lot of demand for uniforms during the back-to-school season.
Elena is a widow. She has four children who all work and help out financially. Making clothes is a very enjoyable job for Elena and she will continue in this work while she still benefits from good health and embroidering, more than a job, is an activity that she really enjoys doing. She says with pride that she is self taught. She never attended any technical school and her biggest satisfaction is seeing her customers wearing the clothes that she makes.

loan.use: To buy fabric, threads, buttons and accessories

loan.name: Flora

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunalâ€ CHIKONâ€; El banco estÃ¡ ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Flora; ella tiene 30 aÃ±os de edad, es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de plantas para luego distribuirlo de forma ambulatoria a sus clientes que le solicitan a la vez la socia se dedica al prÃ©stamo de dinero ganando ella un porcentaje del monto que presta, la socia es una persona bien alegre y optimista y de esta forma ella sale adelante.
La socia solicita el prÃ©stamo para poder comprar mas mercaderÃ­a ( plantas) para su negocio.
La socia estÃ¡ feliz por el prÃ©stamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Flora is a member of the "CHIKON" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.
Flora is 30 years old and single. She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling plants. She delivers her plants to her customers who request them. Flora also lends money. She makes a percentage on the sums that she lends. She is a very happy and optimistic person and, in this way, she gets ahead in life.
Flora is requesting this loan so that she can buy more merchandise (plants) for her business. She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loan.use: To buy more merchandise (plants) for her business

loan.name: Fany

texts.es: La seÃ±ora Fany G. G. tiene 38 aÃ±os y vive en compaÃ±Ã­a de su esposo y dos hijos en el barrio El Tesoro de la ciudad de BogotÃ¡. Tiene un taller en el cual fabrica productos en fibra de vidrio como deslizadores, tÃºneles y balancines para parques infantiles. El negocio comenzÃ³ hace cuatro aÃ±os cuando el esposo de la microempresaria quedÃ³ desempleado luego de trabajar por mÃ¡s de veinte aÃ±os en el ramo de la fibra de vidrio. En un principio las ventas eran bajas, pero fueron aumentando gracias a la labor de promociÃ³n y mercadeo de la seÃ±ora Fany. Hoy sus productos gozan de un gran prestigio debido a la calidad de los mismos; son tan buenos que ella otorga dos aÃ±os de garantÃ­a, mientras que la competencia da sÃ³lo 18 meses. Los mÃ¡s importantes clientes del negocio son otras empresas que reciben contratos grandes del sector pÃºblico o privado para construir parques infantiles y ellos a su vez sub contratan con microempresas como la de la seÃ±ora Fany. Ella es quien maneja la parte administrativa y comercial, su esposo se encarga de la parte operativa, pero cuando los pedidos aumentan considerablemente no es raro verla con guantes y mascarilla pintando con soplete los productos. Este es el segundo prÃ©stamo que tramita con la FundaciÃ³n Mario Santo Domingo y planea invertirlo en la compra al por mayor de fibra de vidrio, resina, catalizadores y pinturas. Con el primer crÃ©dito comprÃ³ nuevos moldes y herramientas. Cuando los pedidos de piezas para parques infantiles disminuyen, la microempresaria tambiÃ©n produce guarda barros para automÃ³viles, lava cabezas para peluquerÃ­as, toboganes para piscinas y jacuzzis para baÃ±os. Ella en general produce cualquier objeto en fibra de vidrio, pero lo que mÃ¡s le gusta fabricar son piezas para parques infantiles porque, segÃºn su esposo, eso equivale a producir felicidad a los niÃ±os de Colombia.
texts.en:
Fany G. G. is 38 years old and lives with her husband and two children in El Tesoro neighborhood, in the city of BogotÃ¡. She has a workshop where she makes products from fiberglass such as slides, tunnels and seesaws for children's playgrounds.
Fany started her business four years ago when her husband lost his job after having worked for more than twenty years in the fiberglass industry. At first, her sales were low but they increased thanks to her work promoting and marketing the business. Today her products enjoy great prestige owing to their quality. The quality of her products is so good that she offers her customers a two year guarantee whilst her competition only offer 18 months.
Fany's most important customers are companies who receive large contracts, in the public or private sector, to build children's playgrounds. They, in turn, sub contract small businesspeople such as Fany. Fany manages the administrative and commercial side of the business. Her husband is in charge of the manufacturing side. However, when orders increase considerably it isn't unusual to see Fany with her gloves and mask on, spray painting the products.
This is Fany's second loan from FundaciÃ³n Mario Santo Domingo and she plans to invest it in buying fiberglass, resin, catalysts and paints wholesale. She used her first loan to buy new molds and tools. When the orders for children's playgrounds slow down, this small businesswoman also produces mudguards for cars, sinks for hairdressing salons, slides for swimming pools and jacuzzis for baths. In general, she produces any object in fiberglass but what she most likes making are items for children's playgrounds because, according to her husband, this means they are producing happiness for the children of Colombia.

loan.use: To buy fiberglass, resin, catalysts and paints wholesale

loan.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunalâ€ CHIKONâ€; El banco estÃ¡ ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Elsa; ella tiene 26 aÃ±os de edad, es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurante la socia trabaja todos los dÃ­as brindando el servicio de almuerzo y cena, esta es la Ãºnica actividad que realiza por el momento y de esta forma saca a su familia delante.
La socia solicita el prÃ©stamo para poder comprar mÃ¡s insumos para su negocio como arroz, azÃºcar, menestras entre otros mÃ¡s.
La socia estÃ¡ feliz por el prÃ©stamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Elsa is a member of the "CHIKON" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.
Elsa is 26 years old. She lives with her partner and child. Elsa divides her time between her daily activities and her restaurant business. She works every day, providing lunch and dinner service. This is the only business activity that she carries out at the moment and it is how she gets her family ahead.
Elsa is requesting this loan so that she can buy more supplies for her business such as rice, sugar, vegetables, etc. She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loan.use: To buy more supplies for her business such as rice, sugar, vegetables, etc.

She wants to have a store where she can sell beauty products. She is requesting this loan for home maintenance for her home; for personal use. She is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of her quotas.

loan.name: VÃ­ctor Hugo

VÃ­ctor Hugo C. M. tiene 35 aÃ±os, Es Soltero vive solo en el CantÃ³n Ventanas Provincia de los RÃ­os. No Tiene hijos.
Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVO AMANECER se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San LuÃ­s de Zapotal pertenece al CantÃ³n Ventanas, esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrÃ­colas en ciclo corto de siembra de maÃ­z, arroz.

loan.name: Marcia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunalâ€ CHIKONâ€; El banco estÃ¡ ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Marcia; ella tiene 36 aÃ±os de edad, conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia se dedica al negocio de venta de medicinas (botica) multiservicios ya que tambiÃ©n ahÃ­ vende celulares, regalitos para cumpleaÃ±os entre otros esta es la Ãºnica actividad que realiza por el momento y espera tal vez mÃ¡s adelante abrir otra botica para asÃ­ poder brindarles una mejor calidad vida a sus hijos.
La socia solicita el prÃ©stamo para la implemnetacion de su negocio.
La socia estÃ¡ feliz por el prÃ©stamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en: The member belongs to the Chikon community bank; this bank is located in the Urubamba district, belonging to the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco. The member is Mrs Marcia; she is 36, lives with her partner, and has 3 children. She sells multi-drug medicines (she has a pharmacy) and also sells cell phones and small birthday gifts, among other items. This is her only job at the moment and she hopes to later open another pharmacy in order to offer her children a better quality of life. She is requesting this loan to stock her business. She is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of her quotas.

loan.name: Sabina

texts.es: La Sra. Sabina llego a nuestra oficina por recomendaciÃ³n de un cliente de nuestra instituciÃ³n, La Sra. Sabina tiene su casita propia en la que vive con sus hijos, su actividad es venta de refrescos y cerveza los dÃ­as viernes, sÃ¡bados, domingo y lunes, tambiÃ©n tiene una rockola mientras los clientes disfrutan de sus bebidas frÃ­as pueden escuchar una buena mÃºsica, el dinero solicitado serÃ¡ para aumentar su capital, (compra de refrescos y bebidas), la Sra. Sabina esta agradecida con la institucion por el apoyo que le brindo cuando necesitaba.
texts.en: Sabina came to Emprender's office on the recommendation of another client. Sabina has her own home where she lives with her children, her activity is selling drinks and beer on Fridays, Saturdays, Sundays and Mondays. She also has a jukebox, so while her clients enjoy their cold drinks they can also listen to good music. The requested loan will be used to increase her working capital to buy drinks. Sabina is grateful to Emprender for the trust placed in her.

loan.name: Jaime

texts.es: El seÃ±or Jaime SÃ¡nchez Q. tiene 51 aÃ±os y vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos en la ciudad de BogotÃ¡. Posee un puesto estacionario en el cual vende galletas, confites, chocolates, cigarrillos, gaseosas y jugos; ademÃ¡s, presta el servicio de llamadas a telÃ©fonos celulares. El negocio estÃ¡ ubicado en el barrio Chapinero cerca al teatro nacional Fanny Mickey, famoso por realizar las mejores funciones teatrales y musicales del paÃ­s. El microempresario tiene 26 aÃ±os de estar ubicado en el mismo sitio donde es ampliamente conocido por los empleados y transeÃºntes frecuentes del sector. Es amigo de casi todos sus clientes con quienes comenta las noticias del dÃ­a mientras les vende un refresco o les regala un fÃ³sforo para que enciendan un cigarrillo. Cuando observa vehÃ­culos o personas sospechosas no duda en informarle a los vigilantes privados de los edificios cercanos para que estos le reporten a la policÃ­a. Su jornada laboral comienza a las 8 A.M. y termina a las 7 P.M. Su inclinaciÃ³n por el comercio la heredÃ³ de su padre quien fue lotero en un principio y luego tuvo un puesto similar al suyo en el mismo sector de Chapinero. Otros 6 hermanos del seÃ±or Jaime tambiÃ©n son comerciantes. Este es el tercer crÃ©dito que tramita con la FundaciÃ³n Mario Santo Domingo y planea invertirlo en la compra al por mayor de cigarrillos, chocolates y galletas. De Ã©sta forma obtiene importantes descuentos por pago en efectivo y volumen de compra. El promedio de ventas diarias es de $ 150.000 COP y el margen de utilidad es del 35%. En un futuro, el seÃ±or Jaime desea alquilar un local para seguir con su negocio y vender, ademÃ¡s, desayunos y almuerzos. Este proyecto le permitirÃ­a incrementar sus ventas y mejorar sus condiciones de trabajo, porque a veces sufre por la inclemencia del tiempo como en la reciente temporada invernal. En todo caso, el microempresario se declara un hombre feliz y junto a su negocio hace parte del paisaje Bogotano.
texts.en:
Jaime SÃ¡nchez Q., age 51, lives with his wife and their four children in the city of BogotÃ¡. He has a stationary stand where he sells cookies, sweets, cigarettes, soft drinks, and juice. He also provides cell phone call service. The business is located in the Chapinero neighborhood close to the Fanny Mickey National Theater. The theater is famous for putting on the best theatrical shows and musicals in the country.
This small businessman has been located in the same site for 26 years. He is widely known by the workers and people who frequently pass by the area. He is friends with almost all of his customers. He chats with them about the dayâ€™s news while he sells them refreshments or gives them a match to light a cigarette. When he sees a suspicious car or person, he does not hesitate to tell the private watchmen in the buildings that are nearby. He does this so that the watchmen can report it to the police.
His work day starts at 8:00 a.m., and it ends at 7:00 p.m. He got his propensity for business from his father. In the beginning his father sold lottery tickets. Later, his father had a stand similar to the Jaimeâ€™s stand in the same area of Chapinero. Six siblings of Jaime are also merchants.
This is his third loan with the FundaciÃ³n Mario Santo Domingo. He plans to use the loan to buy wholesale cigarettes, chocolates, and cookies. This way he gets important discounts for paying in cash and buying in volume. His average daily sales are 150,000 COP; and his profit margin is 35%.
In the future Jaime wants to rent a place to continue his business and to sell breakfast and lunch. This project will allow him to increase his sales and improve his work conditions. He sometimes suffers due to inclement weather like the recent winter season.
In any case, this small businessman says that he is a happy man. Together with his business, he is part of the landscape in Bogota.

loan.use: To buy wholesale cigarettes, chocolates, and cookies

loan.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal â€œTARPUYâ€; El banco estÃ¡ ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Lucila; ella tiene 58 aÃ±os de edad y es divorciada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de pijamas de dormir, ella vende en la feria del altiplano, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de pijamas. La socia solicita el prÃ©stamo para comprar mercaderÃ­a.
La socia estÃ¡ feliz por el prÃ©stamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.

Lucila belongs to the Tarpuy Communal Bank. It is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.
Lucila is 58 years old, divorced, and has three children. She alternates her daily activities with her business of selling pajamas. She sells at the Altiplano fair. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.
She wants to expand and improve her business of selling pajamas. She is requesting the loan in order to buy merchandise. She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loan.name: Ulbio Italo

texts.es:
Ulbito de 44 aÃ±os, el tiene un taller de zapaterÃ­a en donde elabora zapatos para venderlos y arreglarlos. Viviendo en una zona urbana en OrquÃ­deas trabajar en el negocio de una haciendo zapatillas, zapatos para mantener a sus dos hijos, en la actualidad el trabaja desde muy temprano haciendo zapatos en su taller de zapaterÃ­a.
Para tener variar diseÃ±os de zapatos el necesita comprar con el prÃ©stamo materiales como suelas, cuero, pegamento. En el futuro quiere tener una empresa de distribuciÃ³n en la lÃ­nea de zapatos con su propia marca.
texts.en:
Ulbito, age 44, has his own shoe shop. He makes shoes to sell, and he does repairs. He lives in an urban zone in OrquÃ­des. He works in his business making slippers and shoes in order to support his two children. He starts making shoes in his shoe shop very early in the morning.
In order to have various styles of shoes, he needs the loan to buy materials like soles, leather, and glue. In the future he wants to have a business distributing a line of shoes that is his own brand.

loan.use: To buy soles and leather

loan.name: Angel

texts.es: El seÃ±or Angel V. S. tiene 43 aÃ±os de edad, concubinado con la seÃ±ora Clementina hace 22 aÃ±os atrÃ¡s, viven en Colomi hace mÃ¡s 18 de aÃ±os en la Comunidad Chomoco hacia el sud, tienen 1 hijo dependiente. El seÃ±or Angel V. y su esposa son agricultores venden papa, haba, oca, papaliza en la feria semanal de Colomi, De tal modo ellos necesitan un prÃ©stamo para comprar abono orgÃ¡nico (gallinaza) por la temporada que esta a bajo precio, por esta razÃ³n se tuvo la iniciativa de ir a visitar a la zona para otorgarle un crÃ©dito , el seÃ±or Angel nos cuenta que siempre le gusta aprovechar costos bajos asÃ­ para luego tener mejores ingresos hacia futuro.
texts.en:
Angel V. S., age 43, has been in a common-law marriage with Clementina for 22 years. They have lived in Colomi towards the south in the Chomoco community for over 18 years. They have one dependent child.
Angel V. and his wife are farmers. They sell potatoes, beans, oca (an Andean tuber), and papalisa (another Andean tuber) at the Colomi weekly fair.
They need a loan to buy organic fertilizer (fowl) during the time that prices are low. That is why he took the initiative to visit the area in order to get a loan. Angel tells us that he always like to take advantage of low costs in order to have better income in the future.

loan.use: To buy organic fertilizer to his farming activity

loan.name: Kerly Maria

Kerly Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maÃ­z y arroz. Compra sus productos en Agro Servicios San Jacinto y vende en el mismo lugar.
Solicita el crÃ©dito para sembrar maÃ­z y arroz, compra de insumos y para pago de trabajadores, Con el apoyo del crÃ©dito le ayudarÃ­a econÃ³micamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafÃ­os como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueÃ±o es tener su propio vehiculo.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en: Kerly Maria G. V. is 20, single, and lives with her parents in the Ventanas Canton, in the Los Rios province. She has no children. The members of the community bank V.R.C. Nuevo Amanecer ["New Dawn"] are located in the San Luiz Zapotal district, belonging to the Ventanas Canton. She confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and climatic variability. Her dream is to have her own vehicle. She enjoys playing sports.

loan.name: Veronica Del Carmen

texts.es:
VerÃ³nica de 33 aÃ±os, tiene un negocio de un poco surtido en donde vende artÃ­culos de papelerÃ­a y tiene un centro de servicios para llamadas telefÃ³nicas.
Viviendo en una zona periurbana llamada suburbio ha vivido trabajando VerÃ³nica porque es una mujer trabajadora con ayuda de su esposo para solventar los gastos del hora ya que ellos tienen dos hijos. En la actualidad ella trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 23h00pm atendiendo su negocio mientras que su esposo vende mercaderÃ­a.
Quiere seguir trabajando para darle una buena vida a sus hijos por eso quiere comprar el prÃ©stamo papelerÃ­a, artÃ­culos, recargas para llamadas. En el futuro quiere que sus hijos sigan trabajando y seguir teniendo ella y su esposo ingresos estables.
texts.en: VerÃ³nica, age 33, has a business where she sells stationery, and she has a service center for telephone calls. She lives in a periurban zone called Suburbio. She works a lot because she is a hard-working woman. Her husband helps her to cover their household costs, as they have two children. She currently works from 8:00 am to 11:00 pm tending to her business while her husband sells merchandise. She wants to keep working to give her children a better life, so she wants to use the loan to purchase stationery, articles and phone credit. In the future, she wants her children to keep working, and for her and her husband to maintain a stable income.

loan.name: Elvis Edward

texts.es: El Sr. Elvis es casado vive en la zona de pacata baja urb. Vive en casa propia tiene un hijo pequeÃ±o su esposa es ama de casa y se dedica al cuidado de su hijita, el se dedica al transporte tiene su movilidad propia trabaja como taxista libre desde hace 5 aÃ±os es su principal fuente de ingreso para la subsistencia de su familia el saco el crÃ©dito para compra de repuestos y algunas mejoras para su movilidad es nuevo en la instituciÃ³n y con el crÃ©dito kiva el cliente se fue muy satisfecho , el es muy trabajador siempre velando por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en: Mr. Elvis is married and lives in the Pacata Baja Urb zone. He lives in his own home and has a small child. his wife is a housewife and takes care of their little daughter. Elvis works in transportation. He has his own vehicle and has worked as a taxi driver for 5 years. This is his main source of income for his family, and he is requesting this loan for the purchase of spare parts and some improvements for his vehicle. He is new to the institution and has been very satisfied with the Kiva credit. He is a very hard-working person, always working for his family's well-being.

loan.name: Heart Ggulwe Development Group-Mityana

texts.en:
M. Matia is a 37-year-old fisherman who resides in Ggulwe-Bagwe-Mityana. M. is a happily married father of two who has been a fisherman for the past ten years. He lives near the lakeside which helps keep his business expenses low. M. sells most of his fish to traders from Mityana town. He belongs to the Heart Ggulwe Development Group and also has side businesses selling cattle and poultry.
M. is diligent and he also has his own nets. However, his fishing nets are experiencing wear and tear that has been getting worse over the past year. M. is requesting a loan to purchase new nets. This will streamline his work as well as allowing him to expand his operation and sales.

loan.use: to purchase fishing nets

loan.name: Elizabeth Felipe

texts.es:
Elizabeth de 25 aÃ±os, es una joven emprendedora que desde joven le ha gustado el comercio por eso comenzÃ³ a vender productos Yanbal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes).
Viviendo en un cantÃ³n llamado Playas uno de los lugares turÃ­sticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensiÃ³n de mariscos ha trabajado como comerciante informal vendiendo cosmÃ©ticos y productos de uso personal desde muy temprano hasta las 20h00pm. Vende perfumes, cremas, desodorantes, ropa.
Con el prÃ©stamo quiere comprar ropa, cosmÃ©ticos, perfumes para seguir con su negocio y surtir mÃ¡s la mercaderÃ­a. En el futuro quiere tener un local para vender los productos y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en: Elizabeth, age 25, is a young entrepreneur who has enjoyed business from a young age. For this reason, she started selling Yanbal products (Yanbal is a company that offers enterprising women the ability to start selling independently). She lives in a canton called Playas, one of the tourist zones of Ecuador with diverse marine life. She works as an informal businesswoman, selling cosmetics and personal products from very early in the morning until 8:00 pm. She sells perfumes, creams, deodorants and clothing. With this loan, she wants to buy clothing, cosmetics and perfumes to keep going with her business and stock more merchandise. In the future she wants to have a store to sell her products, and she also wants to improve her home.

loan.name: Daysi

texts.es: La Sra. Daysi es una de nuestras socias antiguas que pertenece al Banco de Emprendimiento "Renacer", quien actualmente ocupa el cargo de tesorera dentro su grupo. Ella tiene 3 hijos pequeÃ±os. La Sra. solicito un crÃ©dito individual para poder montar una grÃºa ya que les facilitarÃ­a el transporte de las movilidades y asÃ­ poder aumentar sus ingresos, tiene como negocio una ChaperÃ­a junto a su esposo, trabajan juntos, son una pareja muy unida que estÃ¡n consolidÃ¡ndose con esta actividad donde les va muy bien, esta agradecida con la instituciÃ³n por el apoyo brindado en la otorgaciÃ³n del crÃ©dito.
texts.en: Mrs. Daysi is one of our old clients who belongs to the Renacer ["Rebirth"] Lending Bank, where she currently holds the post of treasurer. She has three small children. She is requesting an individual loan for a tow truck, as it will facilitate the transportation of the vehicles and thus increase her income. She and her husband have an auto body repair store. They work together; they are a very united pair who are working together in this business and it is going very well for them. She is grateful to the institution for the support offered in the authorization of this loan.

loan.name: Josefa

She has a common law husband and three children. Josefa would like this loan to invest in her business of raising animals. Principally, she raises roosters, buying them when they are young and selling them for meat or to hen houses. She is very happy with the loan being granted and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loan.use: to invest in more animals

loan.name: Silvia

texts.en: Silvia, 38 years old, belongs to the â€œSolidaridad Cachimayoâ€ cooperative bank, which is located in the Cachimayo district of the province of Chinceros. Silvia is married and has two children aged 7 and 18 years old. She is a seamstress who works from her home. She is requesting this loan to purchase more fabric to make more clothes and to invest in the maintenance of her sewing machine. She is very happy with this loan being granted and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loan.use: to purchase more fabric and for maintenance of her sewing machine

loan.name: Eliecer De Jesus

texts.es:
Eliecer es un hombre trabajador que con esfuerzo y dedicaciÃ³n convirtiÃ³ el dinero de la liquidaciÃ³n que le dieron en un negocio que ahora es su actividad econÃ³mica principal.
Viviendo en una zona periurbana llamada paraÃ­so ha trabajado durante algÃºn tiempo para que el dinero que invirtiÃ³ en la liquidaciÃ³n que le dieron cuando lo despidieron del trabajo sea Ãºtil. Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 23h00pm en su pequeÃ±a tienda vendiendo vÃ­veres como arroz, bebidas, aceite etc.
Para seguir con su negocio el quiere comprar con el prÃ©stamo bebidas, arroz, aceite etc. En el futuro quiere seguir con su negocio para darle una buena vida a su hijo de 13 aÃ±os.

Eliecer is a hard working man who, through his efforts and dedication, converted the money he got as severance pay, into his principle earning activity.
While living in a suburban zone called â€œParaÃ­so,â€ he has worked for some time so that the money from his severance would be useful. He works in his small store from 8:00 AM to 11:00 PM, selling consumable goods, such as rice, drinks, cooking oil, etc.
He would like to use the money from this loan to invest in more rice, drinks, cooking oil, etc, so that he can continue his business. He wants to continue his business into the future so that he can give his 13 year old son a good life.

loan.name: Fanny Tatiana

texts.es:
Fanny de 27 aÃ±os, es una joven emprendedora que hace un aÃ±o atrÃ¡s con ayuda de su esposo pudo tener su propia papelerÃ­a.
Viviendo en una zona periurbana ha trabajado durante un aÃ±o surtiendo he implementando nueva mercaderÃ­a para su papelerÃ­a. En la actualidad la mama le ayuda atender la tienda ya que tiene que atender a sus dos hijos de 7 y 2 aÃ±os ya que su esposo es electricista. Con el prÃ©stamo quiere surtir mas el negocio comprando juguetes y zapatillas. En el futuro quiere que su papelerÃ­a este bien surtida y asÃ­ tener mÃ¡s ingresos para ayudar a su familia econÃ³micamente.

Fanny is 27 years old. She is an enterprising young woman who, with her husband's help, opened her own stationery store one year ago. She lives in a peri-urban area and has worked for one year stocking her business with new merchandise. Her mom currently helps her to serve in her store since she has to look after her two children, aged 7 and 2, because her husband is an electrician. In her stationery store she sells toys, perfume, paper, exercise books, pens, etc.
Fanny will use this loan to better stock her business, buying toys and sneakers. In the future, she would like to have a well-stocked business and thereby more income with which to help her family financially.

loan.name: Balcon Florido Group

texts.es: â€œBalcÃ³n floridoâ€, es una AlcancÃ­a Comunal conformada por 8 personas muy emprendedoras ellos se dedican a distintas actividades como la agricultura la ganaderÃ­a y el comercio minorista. Tal es el caso D. Clinda quien es la presidenta del grupo, ella tiene 65 aÃ±os D. edad es madre soltera tiene 5 hijos que ya son mayores D. edad, Clinda se dedica a actividades como: la ganaderÃ­a (vacunos) y venta D. quesos, ella realiza esta labor gracias a la enseÃ±anza D. sus padres, con su esfuerzo y dedicaciÃ³n comprÃ³ un pequeÃ±o terreno para criar vacunos. Clinda solicitÃ³ el prÃ©stamo a EDAPROSPO para comprar comida (concentrado) para los vacunos que crÃ­a. Ella sueÃ±a con comprarse un terreno mÃ¡s granD. y adecuarlo para criar especialmente vacunos. En la fotografÃ­a podemos apreciar a todos los integrantes del grupo quienes estÃ¡n contentos con el prÃ©stamo y por supuesto son personas muy responsables.
texts.en:
â€œBalcÃ³n floridoâ€ is a community bank which has 8 very enterprising members who work in a number of different business activities such as crop farming, livestock farming and retail sales.
Clinda is the president of the group. She is 65 years old and a single mother with 5 grown-up children. Clinda carries out a number of activities such as: livestock farming (cattle) and cheese selling. She was taught this work by her parents and, through hard work and commitment, she bought her own little plot of land on which to raise cattle.
Clinda is requesting a loan from EDAPROSPO to buy feed (concentrate) for the cattle that she raises. She dreams of buying a larger plot of land and adapting it especially for raising cattle. In the photo we can see all the members of the group who are happy to be receiving their loans. They are, of course, very responsible people.

loan.use: To buy cattle feed (concentrate)

loan.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
Luis de 42 aÃ±os, trabajo es â€œAutolasaâ€ una empresa que repara y endereza autos pero despuÃ©s de salir de ese trabajo el ya tenÃ­a la experiencia necesaria para tener su propio negocio.
Con ayuda del papa el comenzÃ³ con su taller de enderezado y reparaciÃ³n de autos ya que tenÃ­a tambiÃ©n experiencia en esta actividad. Poco a poco viendo en una zona urbana ha incrementado su clientela durante estos aÃ±os. Trabaja desde muy temprano con ayuda del papa y otros empleados cuando es mucha la demanda del servicio. Cobra por vehÃ­culo dependiendo el choque a $ 150.00 - $ 300.00.
Para seguir con su negocio y darle una mejor vida a sus hijos y esposa el quiere comprar con el prÃ©stamo pinturas, cemento, bloques para arreglar el taller para tener mas espacio. En el futuro quiere mejorar el servicio ampliando el negocio.
texts.en:
Luis is 42 years old. He used to work for Autolasa, a company that repairs and fixes cars. He left his job with the experience he needed to start his own business. With his dad's help, he set up his own auto repair shop as he had experience in the business.
Luis lives in an urban area and he has gradually increased his customer base over the years. He works, with his dad's help, from very early in the morning. When he has a lot of demand he is also helped by other employees. He charges for each vehicle, depending on the collision, from $150 to $300. To continue with his business and in order to provide his children and wife with a better life, he would like to use this loan to buy paint, cement and blocks so that he can remodel his workshop to make it bigger. In the future, he would like to improve his service, expanding his business.

loan.use: To buy paint, cement and blocks

loan.name: SeÃ±or De Antahuaylla Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal â€œSEÃ‘OR DE ANTAHUAYLLAâ€; El banco comunal estÃ¡ ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas, provincia de Quispicanchis, departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Leandra Matilde; La socia tiene 51 aÃ±os de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 2 hijos, y la socia se dedica a la a y venta de leche y yogurt desde el aÃ±o 2004, la socia elabora yogurt, queso y vende leche ella tiene sus vaquitas que le dan leche y con ella derivados, la socia trabaja repartiendo leche fresca diaria las vecinas y a las clientas, la socia tambiÃ©n reparte yogur y de vez en cuando hace queso y quesillo para consumo y venta si alguna de sus clientas le hace pedido. La soca solicita el prÃ©stamo para invertir en la compra de envases para la leche y para el yogurt.
La socia valora el prÃ©stamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Leandra Matilde is a member of the â€œSEÃ‘OR DE ANTAHUAYLLAâ€ community bank which is located in Andahuaylillas district, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department.
Leandra Matilde is 51 years old. She is married and has 2 children. Leandra Matilde's business is selling milk and yoghurt. She has been in this business since 2004. She makes yoghurt and cheese and sells milk. She has her own cows who provide her with milk and, through this milk, other dairy products. She delivers fresh milk daily to her neighbors and customers. She also delivers yoghurt and sometimes makes cheese and 'quesillo' (a soft cheese) for consumption and sale if any of her customers make an order. She is requesting this loan to buy containers for her milk and yoghurt.
Leandra Matilde appreciates the loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loan.use: To invest in buying containers for her milk and yoghurt

loan.name: Iddai

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora Iddai S. GuzmÃ¡n, es casada con el seÃ±or Bernardo PÃ©rez DÃ­az, en donde procreo dos hijos que aun estÃ¡n a su responsabilidad y son: Elver Javier de catorce aÃ±os y el otro es Edwin Jais de ocho aÃ±os de edad.
InvertirÃ¡ el prÃ©stamo en la comercializaciÃ³n de ganado como es el marrano, para engordarlo y luego venderlo en la misma regiÃ³n, con esta actividad lleva siete aÃ±os y ocho meses el cual le va bien haya que ha tenido buenas ganancias de ello.
EmpezÃ³ con esta actividad ya que para tener ingresos en su hogar tiene que tener un trabajo del cual pudiera tener resultado mejor que sus actividades anteriores.
De lo que gana de su venta por cada cerdo lo invierte comprando mas y asÃ­ mejor sea su ganancia, como tambiÃ©n se negocio aumente dÃ­a con dÃ­a ya que de ello depende para sus ingresos.
De lo que pueda ahorrar lo estarÃ¡ guardando para comprar un lugar mÃ¡s amplio en donde los pueda criar con mas habilidad.
texts.en:
Iddai S. GuzmÃ¡n is married to Bernardo PÃ©rez DÃ­az. They have two children together who are still in their care. Elver Javier is 14 years old and Edwin Jais is 8 years old.
Iddai will invest her loan in buying pigs which she will fatten and then sell in the same region. She has been in this business for seven years and eight months. Her business is doing well and she makes good profits from it.
Iddai started this business because, in order to have income for her household, she needed to have a job which would give better results than her previous activities did.
Iddai invests all the money she makes from selling each pig into buying more and she thereby makes more profits. Her business grows day by day. She depends on it for her income. Iddai is keeping the money which she is able to save so that she can buy a larger place where she can better raise her livestock.

loan.use: To buy pigs to fatten and then sell in the same region

loan.name: Fidelina

texts.es:
Fidelina SÃ¡nchez VÃ¡zquez, es casada con el seÃ±or Celerino Patricio RamÃ­rez, en donde tuvo cuatro hijos quienes ya estÃ¡n casados.
Se dedica a su hogar, como tambiÃ©n a la elaboraciÃ³n de panes y solito el prÃ©stamo para comprar ingredientes con los que se elabora su actividad con esto lleva treinta y cinco aÃ±os en donde le ha ido muy bien ya que con ellos saco adelante a su familia.
Nos comenta que con esta actividad inicio desde hace tiempo por su mamÃ¡ quien fue que la enseÃ±o y desde que le quedo lo ha estado practicando y le va bien.
De lo que ha ganado durante todo este tiempo que ha estado elaborando esta actividad es comprar materiales para mejorar su casa y su cocina donde elabora sus panes.
Su sueÃ±o es que logre comprar mas material para construir su cocina en donde hornea los panes ya que hasta ahora lo tiene techado de tablas y le afecta en tiempo de lluvia.
texts.en:
Fidelina SÃ¡nchez VÃ¡zquez is married to Celerino Patricio RamÃ­rez. They have four children who are all married.
Fidelina works looking after her home and making bread. She is requesting this loan to buy ingredients for making her bread. She has been in this business for thirty five years. Her business has done very well and it has helped her to get her family ahead in life.
Fidelina comments that she started out in this business years ago. It was her mom who taught her the business and since she left she has been running the business which does well.
Fidelina has used the money that she has made over the years to buy materials for improving her home and her kitchen where she bakes her bread. Her dream is to buy more material to do building work in her kitchen where she bakes her bread since, up to this point, its ceiling has been made from planks and this affects her when it rains.

loan.use: To buy ingredients for making bread such as flour, eggs, oil, yeast, etc.

loan.name: Margoth

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora Margoth C. S., es originarÃ­a de la localidad de llano grande Municipio de Coapilla Estado de Chiapas MÃ©xico, es madre soltera con una hija de nombre Jasive HernÃ¡ndez C. de diez aÃ±os.
Ella se dedica a la venta de pollos aliÃ±ados y comenta que le va bien ya que con ellos ha estado obteniendo buenos ingresos en su hogar.
Se inspiro en esta actividad ya que para salir adelante tenÃ­a que tener una actividad del cual obtuviera dinero y con ello cubrir los pequeÃ±os gastos que se generan en su familia y tambiÃ©n apoyar a su hija para que siga estudiando.
De la ganancia que va obteniendo lo ahorra para que cuando se le termina su mercancÃ­a tiene de donde sacar para comprar mÃ¡s y su clientela no se vea limitada con la compra que quieren realizar.
Pues a un esta viendo que su sueÃ±o es que con el tiempo logre tener una casa propia ya que en la que vive es de su mama y pues no es igual que tener la suya.
texts.en:
Margoth C. S. is from Llano Grande, in the town of Coapilla, in the State of Chiapas, Mexico. She is a single mother with a 10 year-old daughter called Jasive HernÃ¡ndez C..
Margoth's business is selling seasoned chicken. She says that her business does well and that she has made good profits from it for her household.
Margoth started out in this business because, in order to get ahead in life, she needed a business which would make her money with which she could cover the small expenses that her family incurs and which would allow her to support her daughter so that she could continue studying.
Margoth saves the profits she makes in her business so that when her merchandise runs out she has money available with which to buy more. This means that her customers aren't limited in making their purchases.
Margoth's dream is to be able to own her own home since she currently lives in her mom's house which is not the same as having her own.

loan.use: To buy live chickens that she will later sell seasoned (as meat) in the same region

loan.name: Esther

texts.es:
L. seÃ±ora Esther G. D. L. C., vive en L. localidad D. llano granD., Municipio D. CoapilL. estado D. Chiapas MÃ©xico, es casada con el seÃ±or JosÃ© IvÃ¡n patricio SÃ¡nchez, en donD. procreo un hijo D. L. edad D. diez aÃ±os D. edad D. nombre Josmar Patricio G. en quinto D. primaria.
El prÃ©stamo que ha solicitado lo invertirÃ¡ en L. compra D. productos para su tienda D. abarrotes ya que para tenerlo surtida necesita mÃ¡s mercancÃ­a D. mejor calidad y obtenga mÃ¡s clienteL..
ComenzÃ³ con esta actividad para apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos D. su hogar, y si los dos aportar, ya que tambiÃ©n se dio cuenta que para poder ahorrar tenÃ­a que tener una actividad y L. D. abarrotes le pareciÃ³ muy bien.
Comenta que con las ganancias que va obteniendo compra mercancÃ­a, asÃ­ como tambiÃ©n estÃ¡ ahorrando para que cuando necesite algÃºn dinerito tenga D. donD. sacar y asa no se vea limitada con sus gastos D. su mini tienda.
Su mÃ¡s granD. sueÃ±o es que con el tiempo logre agrandar su tienda ya que con elL. a logrado Salir adelante con su familia y desea que a como baya parando los dÃ­as aumente mas su tienda D. abarrotes.
texts.en:
Esther G. D. L. C. lives in Llano GranD., in the town of CoapilL., in the State of Chiapas, Mexico. She is married to JosÃ© IvÃ¡n Patricio SÃ¡nchez and they have a ten-year old son called Josmar Patricio G. who is in his fifth year of elementary school.
Esther will invest her loan in buying products for her grocery store since, in order to keep it stocked, she needs more, better-quality merchandise. This will help her attract more customers.
Esther started out in this business to support her husband with their household expenses. She also realized that if they were to be able to save she would need to have a business activity. A grocery store seemed a very good business to have.
Esther comments that she buys merchandise with the profits that she makes in her business. She is also saving so that she has money available if and when she needs it. In this way, she will not be limited in her business.
Esther's biggest dream is to be able to expand her store over time since it has enabled her to get her family ahead. She would like to see her store increase over time.

loan.use: To buy merchandise to stock her grocery store: sugar, beans, oil, etc.

loan.name: Martha

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal â€œNUEVO AMANECER DE URUBAMBAâ€; Este banco estÃ¡ ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra: Martha La socia tiene 28 aÃ±os de edad, la socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, la socia trabaja junto a su conyugue ella le apoya en la zapaterÃ­a que Ã©l tiene en casa y ellos juntos, venden todo artÃ­culo relacionado con los zapatos y accesorios como suelas, plantillas de zapatos, pastas para todo tipo de zapatos, escobillas y otros. La socia se encarga de dar los Ãºltimos acabados a los zapatos que se hacen o tambiÃ©n a los accesorios o a la lustrada de zapatos. La socia solicita el prÃ©stamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para la elaboraciÃ³n de zapatos y tambiÃ©n para comprar plantillas y otros.
La socia estÃ¡ feliz con el prÃ©stamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of the â€œNUEVO AMANECER DE URUBAMBAâ€ (Urubamba's New Dawn) community bank which is located in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.
Martha is 28 years old. She lives with her partner and has two children. Martha works with her partner, supporting him in the shoe-making business that they have located in their home. Together they sell all sorts of items related to shoes and accessories such as soles, insoles, shoe polish, shoe brushes, etc. Martha is in charge of giving the finishing touches to the shoes that they make. She also sells the accessories and shines shoes.
Matha is requesting this loan to invest in buying materials for making shoes and also to buy insoles etc. She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loan.use: To invest in buying materials for making shoes and also to buy insoles, etc.

loan.name: Gamar

texts.ru: Gamar H. 48 let. Ona zamujem i imeyet 3 detey kotoriye uchatysa v kolledje. Gamar yeyo muj i deti jivut v qorode Baku. Gamar uje 9 let kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom prodaji produktov. Etomu biznessu ona nauchilas u sestri. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit produkti dlya pereprodaji i razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa.
texts.en:
Gamar H. is 48 years old. She is married and has three children who go to college. Gamar with her husband and children live in the city of Baku.
Gamar has been in the business of food sales for nine years. She has learned this business from her sister. Right now she needs 2000 AZN to buy foods supplies for resale and expansion of her business.

loan.use: To buy food for resale

loan.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal â€œNUEVO AMANECER DE URUBAMBAâ€; Este banco estÃ¡ ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra: Eugenia La socia tiene 32 aÃ±os de edad, la socia es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos, la socia trabaja vendiendo gelatinas y comidas caseras en el mercado central de Urubamba; la socia tambiÃ©n se dedica a la agricultura ella tiene un pequeÃ±o terreno en el cual ella siembra maÃ­z y los vende cuando llega la Ã©poca de cosecha. La socia requiere el prÃ©stamo para comprar insumos para preparar sus comidas y tambiÃ©n empezarÃ¡ a elaborar chicha de maÃ­z y vender en el mercado central para todo ello ella requiere el crÃ©dito para comprar insumos. La socia solicita el prÃ©stamo para comprar productos e insumos para su negocio.
La socia estÃ¡ feliz con el prÃ©stamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Eugenia is a member of the "NUEVO AMANECER DE URUBAMBA" (Urubamba's New Dawn) community bank which is located in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.
Eugenia is 32 years old. She lives with her partner and has four children. She works selling gelatin desserts and home-made meals in Urubamba's central market. She also farms. She has a small plot of land where she sells corn which she sells at harvest time.
Eugenia needs this loan to buy supplies for preparing her meals. She will also start making 'chicha de maÃ­z' (a traditional corn-based drink) that she will sell in the central market. For all this, she requires a loan to buy supplies. Eugenia is requesting her loan to buy products and supplies for her business.
Eugenia is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loan.use: To buy products and supplies for her business

loan.name: Margarita

texts.es: La seÃ±ora se llama Margarita GonzÃ¡lez E. tiene 44 aÃ±os, estudio hasta la secundaria tiene su certificado, ella vive en le localidad de Ahuehueyo, municipio de Ciudad Ayala en el estado de Morelos, MÃ©xico. La seÃ±ora Margarita tiene un negocio de venta de ropa y regalos, ademÃ¡s de vender perfumerÃ­a por catalogo (jafra) y artÃ­culos de plÃ¡stico. El prÃ©stamo lo va a utilizar principalmente para surtir su negocio de mercancÃ­as como son: Ropa para dama y caballero, invertir en un pedido de perfumerÃ­a (Jafra), monederos, bolsas de piel y va a surtirse de juguetes para el dia de Reyes. La seÃ±ora Margarita se entero de los prestamos de KIVA, a traves de una amiga que la invito a participar en un grupo y decidiÃ³ solicitar el apoyo para poner su propio negocio, ya que ella anteriormente trabajaba como empleada. Desde hace 25 aÃ±os tiene su negocio comenzÃ³ vendiendo casa por casa y poco a poco fue ganando clientela hasta que decidiÃ³ poner un puesto en su localidad, ella comenzÃ³ vendiendo perfumerÃ­a por catalogo (jafra), y despuÃ©s bolsas de piel que su hermana le traÃ­a de Toluca ademÃ¡s le traÃ­a zapatos, porque allÃ¡ son mÃ¡s baratos. AdemÃ¡s algo que le favorece en su negocio es que paga una renta muy baja su negocio esta en el mercado de Ahuehueyo ademÃ¡s de que su esposo la apoya econÃ³micamente. De su casa a su negocio ella camina muy poco ya que este se encuentra a dos cuadras por lo que se traslada caminando a su negocio. Para ella es muy importante su negocio pues es de ahÃ­ de donde obtiene ganancias para sus necesidades y por eso trata de sacarle el mÃ¡ximo provecho. A ella le gustan las ventas y normalmente trabaja hasta las tres de la tarde todos los dÃ­as y eso le da orgullo tener muchos clientes de todas las edades a los que vende de contado y en pagos. Sus ganancias normalmente las vuelve a invertir en comprar mÃ¡s mercancÃ­as; desea ampliar su negocio comprando otras dos vitrinas para poder exhibir mas mercancÃ­a y tener mejores ingresos. La seÃ±ora Margarita es casada, su esposo es albaÃ±il y no tienen niÃ±os. Ocasionalmente recibe ayuda de su papÃ¡ que estÃ¡ enfermo de la vista. Comenta que le gusta mucho su localidad porque es tranquilo y normalmente no suceden cosas malas y el paisaje es muy verde.la seÃ±ora Margarita nos menciona que los apoyos de kiva son muy buenos y menciona que es bueno que nos sigan prestando y que va pagar puntualmente su prÃ©stamo.
texts.en:
Margarita GonzÃ¡lez E. is 44 years old. She studied up to high school level and has her high school diploma. She lives in Ahuehueyo, in the town of Ciudad Ayala, in the State of Morelos, in Mexico.
Margarita has a business selling clothes and gifts. She also sells (Jafra) perfume through catalogs and plastic products. She will use her loan mainly to stock her business with merchandise such as men's and women's clothes. She will invest in a (Jafra) perfume order, purses, leather bags and will also stock her business with toys for 'Kings Day' (January 6th - when children receive gifts from the Wise Men).
Margarita found out about Kiva loans through a friend who invited her to take part in a group and decided to request support to set up her own business since she used to work as an employee. Margarita has had her business for 25 years. She started selling door to door and gradually attracted more and more customers until she decided to set up a sales location in her town. She started out selling (Jafra) perfumes through a catalog and then leather bags that her sister brought her from Toluca. She also brought shoes because they are cheaper there.
Something else that favors Margarita's business is the fact that she pays a very low rent on her business which is in Ahuehueyo market. Her husband also supports her financially. Margarita doesn't have far to travel from her home to her business since it is only two blocks away. This means that she can walk. Margarita's business is very important to her as it makes her the money she needs to cover her needs and, for that reason, she tries to benefit from it as much as possible. Margarita likes selling and she normally works until 3.00pm every day. It makes her very proud to have many customers of all ages who she sells to for cash and on credit. She normally re-invests her profits in buying more merchandise. She would like to expand her business, buying another two display cases so that she can display more merchandise and make better profits.
Margarita is married. Her husband is a construction worker and they don't have any children. She occasionally receives help from her dad who has medical problems with his vision. She comments that she likes her neighborhood a lot because it is very quiet. Bad things don't normally happen there and the landscape is very green. Margarita tells us that Kiva loans are very good and she mentions "it is good that they keep lending to us". She will make her loan repayments on time.

loan.use: To buy clothes, blouses, Jafra perfumes, bags and leather purses.

loan.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal â€œURPIâ€; El banco estÃ¡ ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Maria del Carmen; ella tiene 40 aÃ±os de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos lacteos y tambiÃ©n trabaja en un laboratorio,los productos lacteos que vende son quesos,mantequilla y leche de vaca,la socia quiere tener una tienda para vender los productos lacteos. La socia solicita el prÃ©stamo para productos para hacer la leche y mantequilla.
La socia estÃ¡ feliz por el prÃ©stamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria del Carmen belongs to the URPI community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.
Maria del Carmen is 40 years old and single. She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling dairy products. She also works in a laboratory. The dairy products she sells are cheeses, butter and cow's milk. She would like to have a store where she could sell her dairy products.
Maria del Carmen is requesting this loan to make her cheeses and butter. She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loan.use: To make cheese and butter

loan.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal â€œNUEVO AMANECER DE URUBAMBAâ€; Este banco estÃ¡ ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra: Victoria La socia tiene 32 aÃ±os de edad, la socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos de 3 y 14 aÃ±os de edad; la socia trabaja como docente en kinviri, La socia es profesora y ella viaja hasta Quillabamba que estÃ¡ situado a 8 horas de la ciudad del Cusco, La socia viaja dos veces a la semana para allÃ¡ y se queda en Quillabamba hasta terminar sus clases y retorna los viernes en la noche y se vuelve a ir los domingos, ella hace todo este viaje con el fin de estar todo el sÃ¡bado con sus hijos y se sacrifica por el bien de ellos, la socia estÃ¡ en espera de que le cambien de lugar tal vez a un sitio mÃ¡s cerca a Urubamba, la socia estÃ¡ de vacaciones desde el 18 de diciembre hasta los primeros dÃ­as del mes de abril; la socia estÃ¡ apoyando a su conyugue en la carpinterÃ­a que ambos tienen y se encarga de dar los acabados cuando ella estÃ¡ aquÃ­, ahora requiere el prÃ©stamo para invertir en los materiales para la carpinterÃ­a y comprar un poco de madera. La socia solicita el prÃ©stamo para invertir en la compra de madera.
La socia estÃ¡ feliz con el prÃ©stamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the â€œNUEVO AMANECER DE URUBAMBAâ€ (Urubamba's New Dawn) community bank which is located in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.
Victoria is 32 years old. She lives with her partner and has two children aged 3 and 14. Victoria works in teaching in Kimbiri. She is a teacher and she travels to Quillabamba which is 8 hours away from the city of Cusco. She makes the journey twice a week. She stays in Quillabamba until she has finished her classes and then returns home on Friday evening. She goes back again on Sunday. She makes this long journey so that she can be with her children for the whole of Saturday. She makes this sacrifice for her children's well-being. She is waiting for the authorities to change her teaching location to somewhere nearer Urubamba.
Victoria is on vacation from December 18th until the beginning of April and is supporting her partner in the carpentry business that they own. She takes care of making the finishing touches to the items they produce when she is there. She needs this loan to invest in buying materials for the carpentry business and to buy a little wood. She is requesting this loan to invest in buying wood.
Victoria is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make the repayments on time.

loan.use: To invest in buying wood

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy materials for making her handicrafts

loan.name: Paula

texts.es: La seÃ±ora Paula B. T. se encuentra localizada en Ahuehueyo, Cd. Ayala, en el estado de Morelos, MÃ©xico, ella tiene 51 aÃ±os de edad, ella vive en uniÃ³n libre y tiene 6 hijos 3 estÃ¡n aquÃ­ y 3 en Estados Unidos CaÃ­n de 33 aÃ±os de edad es casado, Adriana tiene 30 aÃ±os de edad es soltera, Marcela tiene 26 aÃ±os de edad es casada ellos tres estÃ¡n trabajando en los Estados Unidos, RaÃºl tiene 16 aÃ±os estudia el CECYTE, Antonia tiene 13 aÃ±os estudia la secundaria, Abdiel tiene 12 aÃ±os de edad estudia la secundaria, la seÃ±ora Paula tiene su negocio de venta de pollo por pieza o entero, venta de refrescos, chicharrones preparados, tostadas preparadas, ella solicito su prÃ©stamo para comprar pollo, chicharrones, refrescos y unas laminas para la pared. Ella inicio su negocio hace 8 aÃ±os eran de sus hijas pero se fueron a Estados Unidos a trabajar y le dejaron el negocio, el seÃ±or que vende pollo llego a ofrecer el pollo para venderlo y les pagaba a sus hijas por la venta del pollo ya despuÃ©s ellas agarraron el negocio, los sÃ¡bados y domingos vende mixiotes de pollo y milanesas de pollo asadas y empanizadas, ella inicio el negocio con un crÃ©dito de mil pesos que le dieron y lo invierte en mercancÃ­a y fue invirtiendo en mercancÃ­a, su negocio estÃ¡ en su casa y es importante porque de ahÃ­ le va dando a sus hijos para la escuela, los pasajes, los zapatos, los uniformes de la escuela, para comprar el gas, pagar el agua, a ella le gusta vender el pollo porque ya estÃ¡ listo para vender todos los dÃ­as se lo llevan a las 6:00 de la maÃ±ana nadamas lo destaza y estÃ¡ listo para atender a sus clientes que son sus familiares, vecinos, conocidos, seÃ±ores, seÃ±oras. Las ganancias del negocio la utiliza para los gastos de sus hijos de la escuela, y quiere comprar bolsas para darles a sus clientes en aÃ±o nuevo, el dÃ­a de san ValentÃ­n una bolsita de dulces. La seÃ±ora Paula quiere poner la pared de tabicÃ³n y el techo para que se vea mÃ¡s bonito su local porque la pared la tiene de lÃ¡mina y lo piensa lograr con las ganancias y con lo que le den sus hijas que estÃ¡n en Estados Unidos. Su negocio ha ayudado a su familia y le sigue ayudando, para los gastos de sus hijos en la escuela. Sus sueÃ±os son arreglar su casa poner las paredes y el techo para a completar su casa. Ella estÃ¡ muy contenta con este prÃ©stamo que le dan por que va a surtir su negocio y tener mercancÃ­a para ofrecerles a sus clientes, las mejoras que desea lograr para su hijo son abrirles una cuenta en el banco aunque sea chiquita su hijo pequeÃ±o tiene asma bronquial lo piensa lograr siguiendo en la venta de pollo y ahorrando las ganancias. La seÃ±ora Paula quiere decirle a Kiva y a FundaciÃ³n Realidad â€œles doy las gracias por la ayuda que me dan y mientras siga yo vendiendo si es posible me sigan ayudando con los prestamos. Ahuehueo le gusta porque ahÃ­ naciÃ³ celebran en dos fechas a San Juan el 18 de Febrero y el 24 de Junio hay misas. ProcesiÃ³n, 3 dÃ­as de toros.
texts.en:
Paula B. T. lives in Ahuehueyo, in Ciudad Ayala, in the State of Morelos, in Mexico. She is 51 years old and lives with her common-law husband. She has six children. Three of her children are here and three live in the United States. 33 year-old CaÃ­n is married, 30 year-old Adriana is single, 26 year-old Marcela is married. These three children are working in the United States. 16 year-old RaÃºl is studying at CECYTE - Colegio de Estudios CientÃ­ficos y TecnolÃ³gicos (College of Scientific and Technological Studies), 13 year-old Antonia is in high school and 12 year-old Abdiel is in high school.
Paula has a business selling chickens whole or in pieces. She also sells soft drinks, fried pork rinds and tostadas (fried tortillas). She is requesting this loan to buy chicken, fried pork rinds, soft drinks and some metal sheets for her wall.
Paula started out in her business 8 years ago. The business belonged to her daughters but they went to the United States to work and left her the business. The chicken salesman used to come to offer his chicken for sale and pay her daughters for selling it. Then her daughters took over.
On Saturdays and Sundays Paula sells chicken 'mixiotes' (a traditional, pit-barbecued meat dish) and breaded roast chicken. She started her business with a 1,000 peso loan and she invested it in buying merchandise. Her business is located in her home and it is important because it makes her money to send her children to school. It also pays for tickets, shoes, school uniforms, gas and water.
Paula likes selling chicken because they are ready to sell every day. She takes her chickens at 6.00am, she cuts them up and is ready to serve her customers who are family members, neighbors, acquaintances, ladies and gentlemen. She uses the profits she makes in her business to cover her children's school expenses and she would like to buy bags so that she can give her customers a little bag of sweet treats at the New Year and on Valentine's Day.
Paula would like to build a new wall and roof so that her premises look better because her current wall is made from metal sheets. She plans to achieve this goal using her profits and the money that her daughters send her from the United States. Her business has helped her family and continues to help, covering her children's school expenses.
Paula's dreams are to fix up her house, building new walls and a new roof to complete it.
