She is very happy to be receiving this loan which they are giving her to stock her business so that she has merchandise to offer her customers. The improvements that she would like to make for her son are to open a bank account. Although her son is still very young, he has bronchial asthma. Paula plans to achieve her goal by continuing to make her chicken sales and saving her profits.
Paula would like to say to Kiva and FundaciÃ³n Realidad "Thank you for the help that you give me and while I continue selling my products, if it is possible, I would like you to continue helping me with loans". Paula likes Ahuehueo because she was born there. They celebrate San Juan on two dates. On February 18th and June 24th there are masses, a procession and three days of bullfighting.

loan.use: To buy chicken, fried pork rinds, soft drinks and metal sheets for her wall

loan.name: Emilia

texts.es: Esta persona se llama Emilia MartÃ­nez M. tiene 34 aÃ±os de edad, vive en la localidad de Tenextepango, municipio de CD. Ayala del estado de Morelos, MÃ©xico. La Sra. Emilia estudio dos aÃ±os de universidad. El prÃ©stamo de FundaciÃ³n Realidad lo solicito principalmente para la compra de insumos para su negocio como son: harina, pavos, carnes frÃ­as, chiles, jamÃ³n salchichas, almendras, frutas secas y piÃ±a. La seÃ±ora Emilia tiene un negocio de panaderÃ­a en su localidad en el cual vende: pan de dulce, teleras, bolillos, pan blanco, etc. ella tiene un aÃ±o con su negocio, ella aprendiÃ³ a elaborar pan porque su papa le enseÃ±o desde pequeÃ±a ya despuÃ©s tambiÃ©n le enseÃ±o a su esposo a hacer el pan y actualmente su esposo hace el pan y ella lo vende, este negocio le a ayudado en todos los gastos, en la alimentaciÃ³n y para la escuela de su hijos. El predio donde esta ubicado su negocio se lo heredo su papa y aunque tiene su negocio bien establecido tambiÃ©n sale a vender su producto a Ahuehueyo en el mercado esta a 5 minutos de su casa se va en camioneta. Su negocio es importante porque es de ahÃ­ es donde mantiene a su familia, tambiÃ©n nos comenta que le gusta la elaboraciÃ³n de pan y que su trabajo le da muchas satisfacciones como por ejemplo que la gente le diga que su pan esta sabroso. Comenta que en promedio atiende entre 50 y 80 personas al dÃ­a, ella ofrece a sus clientes el navidad y aÃ±o nuevo pavos horneados, piernas horneadas, Algunas de los desafÃ­os que ha enfrentado en su negocio es el alza de los precios de sus materias primas como el azÃºcar, la harina, y tambiÃ©n el aumento de la competencia. Ella generalmente sus ganancias las reinvierte en su negocio y de esa manera va generando mÃ¡s ingresos y tiene planeado en un futuro ampliar su negocio poner otra panaderia. La seÃ±ora Emilia es casada y tiene dos hijos Ãmbar de 8 aÃ±os y estudia la primaria y Yael de 2 aÃ±os. Su esposo le ayuda a la elaboraciÃ³n del pan y esta orgullosa de seguir la tradiciÃ³n de su papa que fue panadero. Ella piensa que en el futuro su negocio va a crecer quiere tener otra panaderÃ­a, con un ingreso mayor va a poder sacar adelante a sus hijos con sus estudios. La seÃ±ora Emilia quiere decirle a Kiva y a FundaciÃ³n Realidad â€œgracias por el prÃ©stamo pero yo esperaba que me prestaran mayor monto del prÃ©stamoâ€
texts.en:
This person is called Emilia MartÃ­nez M.. She is 34 years old and lives in Tenextepango, in Ciudad Ayala, in the State of Morelos, in Mexico. Emilia studied for two years at university. She is requesting a loan from FundaciÃ³n Realidad mainly to buy supplies for her business such as flour, turkey, cold meats, chilis, ham, sausages, almonds, nuts and pineapple.
Emilia has a bakery business in her neighborhood where she sells: sweet bread, 'teleras' (Mexican flat bread), bread rolls, white bread, etc. She has been in her business for a year. She learned to make bread because her dad taught her when she was a young girl. She later taught her husband to make bread and he now makes the bread and she sells it. This business has helped her with all her expenses, in paying for food and in paying for her children's schooling. She inherited the premises where her business is located from her dad and although her business is well established, she also goes out to sell her products in Ahuehueyo, in the market. It is 5 minutes from her home. She travels there in a truck. Emilia's business is important because it is how she supports her family. She tells us that she likes making bread and that the work is very satisfying, for example when people tell her that her bread is very tasty. She says that she serves on average 50 - 80 people a day. She offers her customers baked turkeys and legs of meat at Christmas and New Year. Some of the challenges that she has faced in her business have been the rise in prices for her raw materials such as sugar and flour and also the rise in competition.
Emilia generally re-invests her profits in her business which makes more profits. In the future, she is planning to expand her business, setting up another bakery.
Emilia is married and has two children: 8 year-old Ãmbar who is in elementary school and 2 year-old Yael. Her husband helps her make her bread and she is proud to be following her dad's tradition as he was a baker. She is planning to grow her business in the future and she would like to set up another bakery. This will make her more income and she will be able to get her children ahead in their studies. Emilia would like to say to Kiva and FundaciÃ³n Realidad "thank you for the loan but I expected that you would lend me a larger loan amount".

loan.use: To buy flour, sugar, eggs, salt, turkeys, cold meats, ham, sausages, almonds, nuts, pineapple and cherries

loan.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal â€œNUEVO AMANECER DE URUBAMBAâ€; Este banco estÃ¡ ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra: Veronica La socia tiene 35 aÃ±os de edad, la socia es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, la socia trabaja administrando su restaurante de nombre las Brizas, ella trabaja directamente con los almuerzos, las extras y viendo todo el menÃº del dÃ­a, la socia tambiÃ©n apoya en las mezas y la atenciÃ³n directa de los clientes, la socia es una mujer muy trabajadora y viene siendo parte de este banco comunal desde hace 4 aÃ±os, la socia aprendiÃ³ a ahorrar y a producir ella ahora requiere el prÃ©stamo para asÃ­ poder implementar su restaurante y comprar los productos bÃ¡sicas que salen a diario como es el aceite, el arroz, azÃºcar, harina fideos y otros y poder abastecerse y comprar al por mayor, la socia desea poder comprar los productos para continuar con su negocio de restaurante. La socia solicita el prÃ©stamo para invertir en la compra de productos bÃ¡sicos.
La socia estÃ¡ feliz con el prÃ©stamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Veronica is a member of the "NUEVO AMANECER DE URUBAMBA" (Urubamba's New Dawn) community bank which is located in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.
Veronica is 35 years old. She lives with her partner and has three children. She runs her own restaurant called 'Brizas'. She works directly with the lunches, extra dishes and set meals. She also provides support at the tables and deals directly with the customers. Veronica is a very hard-working woman and she has been a member of her community bank for 4 years. She has learned to save and produce. She requires this loan so that she can keep her restaurant running and buy basic products that are used every day such as oil, rice, sugar, flour, noodles etc. She would like to stock up, buying her supplies wholesale. She would like to buy products to continue in her restaurant business. She is requesting the loan to invest in buying basic products.
Veronica is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loan.use: To invest in buying basic products

loan.name: Antonia Romana

texts.es: La seÃ±ora Antonia Romana R. es originaria de la localidad de Ahuehueyo municipio de CD. Ayala, en el estado de Morelos, MÃ©xico. Tiene 41 aÃ±os no concluyo la educaciÃ³n bÃ¡sica por falta de recursos pues desde pequeÃ±a tuvo que trabajar para ayudar en el sostenimiento de su familia, ella se dedica a las ventas por cÃ¡talo, ella va a utilizar su crÃ©dito para comprar perfumerÃ­a y cosmÃ©ticos por catalogo (Jafra, Avon, Fuller). Ella vende de casa en casa sus productos, los artÃ­culos que mÃ¡s desplaza son: perfumes, cremas, trastes, set de maquillaje, labiales, delineadores, rubor, etc. Ella tiene en el negocio desde hace 10 aÃ±os, el inicio de su negocio fue difÃ­cil pues tenÃ­a que complementar su ingreso lavando ajeno o vendiendo otro tipo de productos como verdura o fruta, pues inicialmente sus ingresos de la venta por catalogo eran muy bajos, pero poco a poco fue aumentando sus clientes y se fue dedicando Ãºnicamente a la venta de perfumerÃ­a y artÃ­culos por catalogo. TambiÃ©n nos comentÃ³ como al principio la necesidad la obligÃ³ a aumentar sus ventas pues se quedo sola con sus hijos y tuvo que ganar mÃ¡s para sacarlos adelante. Actualmente sigue vendiendo casa por casa, pero ya tiene una buena cartera de clientes y su ingreso es seguro cada semana. Ãšnicamente trabaja dentro de su localidad camina de casa en casa ofreciendo sus productos. Esta actividad es muy importante para ella porque de ahi obtiene los ingresos para sostener a su familia. La parte que mÃ¡s disfruta de su negocio es mostrar sus catÃ¡logos y convencer a sus clientes para que le compren sus productos y se siente orgullosa de tener los ingresos que actualmente tiene gracias a su negocio ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos sin descuidarlos. Ella atiende personalmente a sus clientes que son personas jÃ³venes y adultas que buscan sus productos y le da gusto que su negocio es reconocido por las personas de su comunidad a veces sus hijos le ayudan a entregar los pedidos. Algunos de los problemas que ha enfrentado su negocio es que a veces las personas la piden fiado y se atrasan en sus pagos cuando son las clausura de terminaciÃ³n de clases o el dÃ­a de muertos y se atrasan porque usan el dinero para otros gastos, pero poco a poco le van pagando y asÃ­ recupera lo que invierte. Algunos de los desafÃ­os que ha enfrentado en su negocio es la competencia de otras personas que venden por catalogo pero ella ya tiene su clientela por la atenciÃ³n y el trato al cliente, normalmente lo que gana es para la alimentaciÃ³n de su familia y gastos de la escuela de sus hijos. A futuro pretende instalar una vitrina y exhibir sus productos en su casa. La seÃ±ora Antonia es soltera tiene 4 hijos que son: Constantino de 19 aÃ±os y trabaja, AgustÃ­n de 16 aÃ±os trabaja, Leonardo de 13 aÃ±os estudia la secundaria y Patricia de 22 aÃ±os es casada, ellos tambiÃ©n participan del negocio le ayudan a entregar los pedidos. Ella quiere con las ganancias de su negocio y de los prestamos de KIVA ponerle techo de colado a su casa y ampliarla haciendo dos cuartos mas. Su sueÃ±o es que su negocio permanezca estable y poder incrementarlo hasta hacerlo un negocio bien establecido. Se siente contenta de recibir el prÃ©stamo porque de esta manera va poder cumplir sus metas e incrementar sus ventas. La seÃ±ora Antonia quiere decirle a Kiva y a FundaciÃ³n Realidad â€œgracias por la confianza y espero no defraudarlos y que sigan ayudando a mÃ¡s personas que lo solicitenâ€
texts.en:
Antonia Romana R. is from Ahuehueyo, in Ciudad Ayala, in the State of Morelos, Mexico. She is 41 years old and didn't finish her basic education through lack of financial resources as she had to work from a young age to help support her family. Antonia sells products through catalogs. She will use her loan to buy perfumes and cosmetics from catalogs (Jafra, Avon, Fuller). She sells her products from house to house. The products she sells most of are: perfumes, creams, utensils, make-up sets, lipsticks, eye liners, blusher, etc. She has been in her business for 10 years. At the beginning, her business was difficult because she had to supplement her income washing for other people or selling other types of products such as fruit and vegetables since initially her catalog sales were very low. However, she gradually increased her number of customers and started committing herself solely to selling perfume and other items through catalogs. She tells us that at the beginning necessity forced her to increase her sales as she was left alone with her children and she had to earn more to get them ahead in life.
Antonia currently continues to make her sales from house to house but she has a good customer base and her income is secure each week. She only works within her neighborhood. She walks from house to house offering her products for sale. This business activity is very important for her because it is how she makes her income to support her family. The part of her work she enjoys the most is showing her catalogs to her customers and persuading them to buy her products. She feels proud to be making the income she currently makes. Thanks to her business, she has been able to get her children ahead in life without neglecting them. She personally serves her customers who are young people and adults who buy her products and she is pleased that her business is well known by the people in her community. Sometimes her children help her to deliver her orders. One of the problems that Antonia has faced in her business is people who ask to buy on credit and then don't make their repayments on time. For example, when there are graduation ceremonies or people are celebrating 'DÃ­a de los Muertos' (Day of the Dead), they delay their payments because they use the money for other expenses. However, they pay her back bit by bit and she recovers the money she has invested. Another challenge she has faced in her business is the competition from other people who make catalog sales but she already has a customer base tnanks to her good customer service. She normally uses the money she makes to feed her family and to cover her children's school expenses. In the future, she plans to set up a display window and display her products in her home.
Antonia is single and has 4 children: 19 year-old Constantino who works, 16 year-old AgustÃ­n who works, 13 year-old Leonardo who is in high school and 22 year-old Patricia who is married. Her children also help her in her business, delivering her orders. Antonia would like to use the profits from her business and her Kiva loans to put a new roof on her house and to extend it, building two more rooms. Her dream is for her business to remain stable and to increase it so that she has a well-established business. She feels happy to be receiving this loan because it will enable her to achieve her goals and increase her sales. Antonia would like to say to Kiva and FundaciÃ³n Realidad "Thank you for putting your trust in me and I hope not to let you down. I hope that you will continue helping more people who need it".

loan.use: To buy Jafra, Avon and Fuller products and Estrella perfumes

loan.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys tiene 53 aÃ±os, vive con su hijo en la casa de un familiar. Desde hace 7 aÃ±os y medio vende comida en su mismo domicilio, por lo que tuvo que acondicionar un pequeÃ±o espacio dentro de su casa para ejercer este negocio. Su hijo es su gran apoyo, ya que Ã©l se encarga de ayudar en la atenciÃ³n de la clientela, mientras ella se esfuerza de preparar a tiempo el pedido de su comensal. Lo que le agrada de su trabajo, es su sentido de esfuerzo que pone cada dÃ­a, asÃ³ como los nuevas que se propone llegar y una de ellas es vender todo la comida que prepara durante el dÃ­a, ya que sus ganancias depende de lo que venda. Casi siempre lo logra, es por eso que esta muy contenta y se proyecta para el futuro ampliar su restaurante y que tengas todas la comodidades para sus asiduos clientes. Es su crÃ©dito nÃºmero 2 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ademÃ¡s le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serÃ¡n gestoras del prÃ©stamo que solicita ya que le serÃ¡ muy Ãºtil en el progreso de su actividad econÃ³mica. Con el crÃ©dito que solicita, lo invertirÃ¡ en la compra de ingredientes no perecibles para la preparaciÃ³n de sus comidas.
texts.en:
Gladys is 53 years old. She lives with her son in a family member's house. For seven and a half years, she has been selling meals in her own home. She remodeled a small space in her home so that she could carry out her business there. Gladys' son is a great support since he takes care of helping to serve her customers while she works hard to prepare her customers' orders on time. What she likes about her business is the sense of hard work that she puts in every day. She also likes to sell all the food that she prepares during the day since her profits depend on what she sells. She almost always manages to sell everything and this makes her very happy. In the future, she plans to expand her restaurant and to ensure that it has all the comforts her regular customers need.
This is Glady's second loan with MFP. She is happy to know that she has financial support. She also likes being part of her community bank because all the members are people that she knows. They are all responsible people who are very supportive of each other. Gladys would like to thank all the people who will help to fund her loan as it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business. She will invest her loan in buying non-perishable ingredients for making her meals.

loan.use: To buy non-perishable products for preparing more meals

loan.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal â€œNUEVO AMANECER D. URUBAMBAâ€; Este banco estÃ¡ ubicado en la provincia D. Urubamba, departamento D. Cusco.
La socia es la Sra: Maria Magdalena La socia tiene 58 aÃ±os D. edad, la socia es viuda; la socia trabaja comprando y vendiendo frutas al por mayor, ella tiene su proveedor que le trae desD. la ciudad D. Maranura - Quillabamba, la socia tambiÃ©n tiene una pequeÃ±a tienda D. abarrotes, la socia ahora estÃ¡ solicitando el prÃ©stamo para pagar a sus proveedores, y D. este modo continuar con su negocio. La socia solicita el prÃ©stamo para pagar a sus proveedores D. frutas.
La socia estÃ¡ feliz con el prÃ©stamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Maria Magdalena is a member of the "NUEVO AMANECER D. URUBAMBA" (Urubamba's New Dawn) community bank which is located in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.
Maria Magdalena is 58 years old and a widow. She works buying and selling fruit wholesale. She has a supplier who brings her products from the town of Maranura - Quillabamba. She also has a small grocery store. She is requesting this loan to pay her fruit suppliers so that she can continue in her business. She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loan.use: To pay her fruit suppliers

loan.name: Shahmar

texts.ru: Shahmar Z. 24 qoda. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Shahmar jivet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoimi roditelyami. Shahmar uje 2 qoda kak rabotayet v etom biznesse , delayet okna i dveri. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo otca kotoriy toje zanimalsya etim biznessom. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye instrumenti dlya svoyey raboti.
texts.en:
Shahmar Z. is 24 years old. He is not married and does not have children. Shahmar lives in the Absheron region together with parents.
Shahmar has been in this business for two years, he makes windows and doors. He learned this business from his father who also does the same. Right now he needs 2000 AZN to buy tools for his work.

loan.use: To buy tools for his work

loan.name: Campo Verde Group

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora Rosaura M. S. vive en Coapilla Estado de Chiapas MÃ©xico es casada con el seÃ±or JesÃºs Gomes P. y con quien procreo cuatro hijos que a un estÃ¡n a su responsabilidad son: Manuel de JesÃºs de diesi seis aÃ±os, la otra es Alejandra Guadalupe de trece aÃ±os, Ana Isabel de diez aÃ±os y la ultima es reina del rosario.
El prÃ©stamo solicitado lo invertirÃ¡ en la compra y venta de catÃ¡logos, como son: labiales, perfumes, desodorantes, entre oros, con esta actividad lleva tres aÃ±os y cometa que le va bien ya que a obtenido buenos resultados de su negocio.
ComenzÃ³ con esta ya que mucho mÃ¡s antes ya habÃ­a tenido otros prÃ©stamos y que tambiÃ©n era para tener o emprender un negocio y desde entonces le pareciÃ³ buena idea es asÃ­ como sigue trabajando.
Con las ganancias invierte comprando mas mercancÃ­a la cual su clientela le compra ya que es un producto de buena calidad selo compran muy bien, ya que se da cuenta que le deja buen resultado. Su deseo es que con el tiempo logre ahorrar parque con ello saca delante sus hijos dÃ¡ndoles una buena educaciÃ³n y logren tener una carrera de los que puedan ejercer.
Su grupo se llama campo verde y se integra de tres seÃ±ora que cada una tiene diferente actividad, la razÃ³n del nombre es porque por donde ellas viven es un luguar fresco y con pastos verde.
Las integrantes del grupo son las siguientes:
Antonia GÃ³mez P.: invierte el prÃ©stamo en la compra de ingredientes para elaboraciÃ³n de tamales.
Rosaura M. S.: invertirÃ¡ el prÃ©stamo en la compra de productos por catÃ¡logos como son: labiales, perfumes, desodorantes, entre otros.
Amelia P. T.: invertirÃ¡ el prÃ©stamo en la venta de tortilla para luego venderlo en la misma localidad.
texts.en:
Rosaura M. S. lives in Coapila, in the State of Chiapas, Mexico. She is married to JesÃºs Gomes P. and they have had four children together who are still in their care. Her children are 16 year-old Manuel de JesÃºs, 13 year-old Alejandra Guadalupe, 10 year-old Ana Isabel and their youngest Reina del Rosario.
She will invest her loan in her catalog sales business, buying products such as lipsticks, perfume, deodorants, etc. She has been in this business for three years and she comments that it is going well and she has obtained good results from her business.
Rosaura invests her profits in buying more merchandise. Her customers buy from her because she sells good-quality products. She makes good sales and obtains good results. Her wish is that, over time, she will be able to save to get her children ahead in life, providing them with a good education and enabling them to have a professional career.
Rosaura's group is called 'Campo Verde' (Green Countryside) and it has three members in total who each have a different business activity. The group has this name because the ladies live in a cool place with green pastures.
The members of the group are as follows:
Antonia GÃ³mez P. who will invest her loan in buying ingredients for making tamales
Rosaura M. S. who will invest her loan in buying catalog products such as lipsticks, perfume, deodorants, etc.
Amelia P. T. who will invest her loan in buying tortillas which she will then sell in her neighborhood

loan.use: To buy Avon and Fuller brand catalog products such as perfumes, creams, deodorants, etc.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To purchase 150 sets of womenâ€™s underwear

loan.name: Veronica

texts.es: La seÃ±ora VerÃ³nica DomÃ­nguez RamÃ­rez vive en la comunidad de Moyotepec, municipio de Cd. Ayala en el estado de Morelos, MÃ©xico, ella tiene 52 aÃ±os de edad, ella es casada su esposo es TopÃ³grafo y tiene 5 hijos Leonardo tiene 32 aÃ±os de edad trabaja es ingeniero, Juan Carlos tiene 31 aÃ±os de edad trabaja es TÃ©cnico en informÃ¡tica, Dulce MarÃ­a tiene 30 aÃ±os trabaja es Licenciado en relaciones pÃºblicas, Israel tiene 26 aÃ±os trabaja es licenciado en economÃ­a, Rodolfo tiene 15 aÃ±os estÃ¡ estudiando en el CBTIS de Cd. Ayala, La seÃ±ora VerÃ³nica concluyÃ³ la educaciÃ³n bÃ¡sica y estudiÃ³ una carrera comercial de secretaria ejecutiva. Su crÃ©dito lo va a utilizar principalmente para surtir su negocio, va a comprar medicamento de patente. Se entero de los prÃ©stamos de KIVA y FundaciÃ³n Realidad por una amiga que la invitÃ³. Ella tiene una farmacia en su localidad, en ella ademÃ¡s de vender medicamentos, tambiÃ©n vende productos de perfumerÃ­a, ropa de bebe y regalos. Su negocio se llama Farmacia â€œMegaâ€, tiene este negocio desde hace 15 aÃ±os. Anteriormente trabajaba en una farmacia en Cuautla, la gente que la conocÃ­a le recomendaba abrir una farmacia en su localidad, hasta que finalmente con la ayuda de su hermana establecieron la primera farmacia de la localidad, y entre las dos cuidaron el negocio y ya despuÃ©s le ayudo a su hermana a poner la suya. TambiÃ©n tuvo un restaurante en su localidad pero lo quito porque no pudo contratar gente que supiera del negocio. Ella renta un local que estÃ¡ a 200 metros de su casa, todos los dÃ­as se traslada caminando hasta su negocio. Ella Considera importante su establecimiento porque tiene mucha comunicaciÃ³n con la gente, ademÃ¡s de que le sirve de distracciÃ³n y gana dinero. La parte que mÃ¡s le gusta de su negocio son las ventas, ella desde chiquita ya vendÃ­a en la casa de su mamÃ¡, era un terreno grande y habÃ­a muchos Ã¡rboles frutales, ella juntaba la fruta de los Ã¡rboles en una canasta y salÃ­a a vender y el dinero se lo daba a su mamÃ¡ para que comprara algo sabroso para comer. A los 14 aÃ±os ya comparaba refrescos y los vendÃ­a a fuera de la casa de su mamÃ¡ [despuÃ©s] me fui para Jalisco y comenzÃ³ a comprar manteles, sabanas, almohadones, servilletas que allÃ¡ conseguÃ­a muy baratos y aquÃ­ les sacaba buena ganancias salÃ­a a Cuautla en el parque Zapata a vender su mercancÃ­a, Siempre le han gustado el negocio de las ventas Su trabajo le da gran satisfacciÃ³n porque puede comprar lo que ella quiere y le enorgullece decir que su trabajo saco adelante a sus hijos y los ayudo a tener una carrera universitaria. Sus clientes habituales son sus propios vecinos, en promedio atiende entre 20 y 30 personas de todas las edades al dÃ­a. Sus clientes le compran porque saben que los trata bien y es por eso que su negocio es reconocido en la localidad. En la actualidad se han establecido otras dos farmacias en su localidad pero menciona que no le afecta mucho. Las ganancias de su negocio las invierte principalmente en mantener las existencias de medicamento de su negocio, ademÃ¡s de pagar la renta del local y pagar un empleado, El prÃ©stamo de KIVA lo va a utilizar principalmente para comprar medicamento de patente y comprar una vitrina para exhibir peluches para regalos. Ella tiene sus planes y esperanzar de hacer unos locales para pasar su Farmacia y ya no pagar renta, las mejoras que desea lograr para el fututo de su hijo el pequeÃ±o son que siga estudiando y tenga una carrera, ella se siente feliz con el prÃ©stamo por quÃ© va a surtir su negocio. Algunas de sus palabras para el equipo de KIVA son â€œles agradezco que puedan ayudarnos con este prÃ©stamo, para mejorar los negocio. El pueblo de Moyotepec le gusta porque aquÃ­ naciÃ³ y aquÃ­ creciÃ³ es de clima cÃ¡lido, siembran caÃ±a, frijol, cebolla, milpa.
texts.en: VerÃ³nica DomÃ­nguez RamÃ­rez lives in the community of Moyotepec, in the town of Ciudad Ayala, in the state of Morelos, Mexico. She is 52, married to a surveyor, and they have 5 sons and daughters: Leonardo, 32 who is an engineer, Juan Carlos, 31 who is in information technology, Dulce MarÃ­a, 30, who is in public relations, Israel, 26, who is an economist, and Rodolfo, 15, who is studying in the CBTIS of Ciudad Ayala. VerÃ³nica finished basic education and studied to be an executive secretary. She will use her loan to supply her business. She is going to buy patented pharmaceuticals. She began with KIVA loans and FundaciÃ³n Realidad through the invitation of a friend. She has a pharmacy in her neighborhood, and she also sells patented pharmaceuticals, perfumes, baby clothes and gifts. Her business is called Farmacia (Pharmacy) Mega and she has had it for 15 years. Previously she worked in a pharmacy in Cuautla. People who knew her suggested that she open a pharmacy in her area until finally, with the help of her sister, they established the first one. Between the two of them they handled the business and then she helped her sister open one for herself. They also had a restaurant in the area but they closed it because they couldnâ€™t find people who knew about the business. She rents a store that is 200 meters from her house and every day she walks over to her business. She considers her business very important because she gets to meet and talk with many people, it serves as a distraction, and she earns money. What she most likes about it are the sales. From the time she was little she sold from her motherâ€™s house. It was a big lot and there were many fruit trees. She would gather the fruit from the trees in a basket and go out to sell, and then she would give the money that she made to her mother so that she would buy something delicious to eat. When she was 14 she was buying soft drinks and selling them outside of her motherâ€™s house. Later â€œI went to Jalsico and began to buy blankets, sheets, cushions, and napkins that I could purchase very cheaply and I would make good money when I went to Zapata park in Cuautla to sell the merchandiseâ€œ. She has always liked sales. She gets a lot of pleasure from her work because she can buy what she likes and she is proud to say that it has moved her sons and daughters ahead and helped them study for careers in the university. Her regular customers are her own neighbors. On the average she sees about 20 to 30 people of all ages every day. Her customers buy from her because they know she treats them well and that is why her business is known throughout the area. Now there are two other pharmacies that have opened there but they donâ€™t really affect her business. She uses the money that she makes mostly in keeping up her medicine supply, to pay the rent, and to pay an employee. She will use the KIVA loan to buy patented pharmaceuticals and to purchase a showcase for the stuffed animals that she sells for gifts. She has her plans and hopes to builf her own pharmacy so that she wonâ€™t have to pay rent any more. The best will be that her youngest son continues studying and have a career. She feels happy with the loan because it will supply her business. Some of her words for the KIVA team are â€œI appreciate that you help us with the loan to improve the business. The town of Moyotepec likes it because the business started here and grew here. Moyotepec has a hot climate, they grow sugar cane, beans, onions, and corn.

loan.use: To buy patented pharmaceuticals

loan.name: Gabriela

texts.es: La seÃ±ora Gabriela DomÃ­nguez RamÃ­rez vive en el poblado de Moyotepec del municipio de CD. Ayala, en el estado de Morelos. Ella tiene 37 aÃ±os de edad estudio secretaria ejecutiva, ella tiene su negocio de farmacia en el cual va a invertir el prÃ©stamo. Principalmente lo va a utilizar para comprar medicamento genÃ©rico, perfumerÃ­a, paÃ±ales, papel higiÃ©nico, etc. hace dos aÃ±os que inicio con su farmacia, ella aprendiÃ³ el negocio porque estuvo trabajando mucho tiempo en farmacias y despuÃ©s decidiÃ³ poner su negocio sacando prestamos. Sus ingresos son aproximadamente el 30% de sus ventas. Anteriormente no tuvo otros negocios. Su farmacia estÃ¡ en la Col. AÃ±o de JuÃ¡rez en Cuautla, su negocio se llama Farmacia GarcÃ­a de su negocio a su domicilio se hace una hora. Le gusta su trabajo por la disponibilidad de tiempo y que puede trabajar para ayudar a su familia. Su trabajo le enorgullece porque puede ayudar a la gente. hay una persona que le ayuda a atender el negocio en la maÃ±ana y ella lo atiende en la tarde, sus clientes son todo tipo de gente y al dÃ­a atiende entre 30 a 40 personas al dÃ­a. Las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio las utiliza para reinvertir, ademÃ¡s estÃ¡ ahorrando para ampliar su negocio y poder meter mÃ¡s mercancÃ­a como regalos. La seÃ±ora Gabriela es casada, su esposo es campesino y Ã©l no tiene un ingreso fijo, tienen un hijo que se llama Ãngel Gabriel, Ã©l actualmente estÃ¡ estudiando la primaria. Su negocio es muy importante para ella porque ha ayudado econÃ³micamente a su familia, tambiÃ©n desea en el futuro ampliar su casa y construir su cocina. ella Quiere lograr que a travÃ©s de su negocio pueda sacar adelante a su hijo y que estudie la universidad. Se siente muy contenta al recibir su prÃ©stamo y poder invertir mÃ¡s en su negocio y de esa manera obtener mÃ¡s ganancias para tener mÃ¡s dinero y salir adelante. La seÃ±ora Gabriela quiere decirle a KIVA y a Fundacion Realidad lo siguiente: â€œgracias por el prÃ©stamo y que amplÃ­en el monto del prÃ©stamoâ€
texts.en:
Mrs. Gabriela DomÃ­nguez RamÃ­rez lives in the town of Moyotepec, a municipality of Ciudad Ayala in Morelos state. She is 37 years old and studied to be an Executive Secretary. She has a pharmacy in which she will invest her loan. She will mainly use it to buy generic medicines, perfumery, diapers, toilet paper, etc. She started her pharmacy two years ago. She learned the business because she worked in pharmacies for a long time and she then decided to set up her own business taking out loans. Her income is about 30% of sales. She hasnâ€™t had any previous businesses. Her pharmacy is the AÃ±o de JuÃ¡rez neighborhood in Cuautla. Her business is called â€œFarmacia GarcÃ­a.â€ Travel time from home to her business is an hour.
She enjoys the work because time is available and she can work to help her family. Her work makes her proud because she can help people. She has a person who helps her tend to the store during mornings and she tends to it in the afternoons. Her customers are all kinds of people and she has between 30 and 40 customers daily. Profits from the business are used to reinvest. In addition, she is saving up to expand the business in order to stock more merchandise like gift items.
Gabriela is married. Her husband is a field hand and does not earn a steady income. They have a son, Ãngel Gabriel, who is currently in elementary school.
Her business is very important to her because it has helped her family economically. She also hopes in the future to enlarge her house and build her kitchen. She hopes to support her son through her business so that he can go to the university.
She feels very happy upon getting the loan and being able to invest more in her business thus obtaining more profits to have more money to get ahead.
Graciela would like to say the following to KIVA and to FundaciÃ³n Realidad: â€œThanks for the loan and for enlarging the amount of the loan.â€

loan.use: To buy generic medicines, perfumery, diapers and toilet paper.

loan.name: Ana Karen

texts.es: Ana Karen P. GarcÃ­a es originaria del poblado de Moyotepec municipio de Cd. Ayala en el estado de Morelos, MÃ©xico. Tiene 21 aÃ±os de edad, ella concluyÃ³ la educaciÃ³n bÃ¡sica, ella es casada y tiene 2 hijos se llaman Leyla de 4 aÃ±os de edad esta e preescolar, Iker de un aÃ±o tres meses de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de zapato por catalogo y va a utilizar su prÃ©stamo para comprar zapato para niÃ±o y niÃ±a y zapatos para dama y caballero. Inicio en los prÃ©stamos por una amiga que la invitÃ³ a invertir en un negocio a travÃ©s de un prÃ©stamo. Ella inicio su negocio hace 5 meses la invito la prima de su esposo con las ventas por catalogo con las ganancias fue comprando zapatos y los pone en exhibiciÃ³n, Le prestan una vitrina en una farmacia de la localidad para mostrar sus productos. Su negocio es importante por las ganancias que obtiene, que principalmente destina para comprar mÃ¡s mercancÃ­a y para los gastos de su casa. La parte que mÃ¡s le gusta de su negocio es salir cada dÃ­a a ofrecer sus productos y que le encarguen pedidos de calzado. En promedio visita de cinco a ocho personas por dÃ­a. Su negocio enfrenta los desafÃ­os de las inclemencias del tiempo, sobre todo cuando llueve, ademÃ¡s de que enfrenta la competencia de personas que tambiÃ©n venden por catÃ¡logo en su localidad. Las ganancias de su negocio las destina en mayor parte a comprar mÃ¡s zapatos. Tiene como meta a corto plazo meter productos diferentes como bolsas de dama, blusas y esto lo va lograr con el prÃ©stamo primero y despuÃ©s con las ganancias de la invierte. Su negocio es muy importante porque le va a ayudar a sacar adelante a su familia econÃ³micamente y ademÃ¡s de que en el futuro hacer mejoras a su vivienda como ponerle puerta a su casa, ventanas, echarle el piso de cemento y los vidrios. A ella le gustarÃ­a desarrollarse mÃ¡s en el campo de las ventas y crecer mÃ¡s profesionalmente. Con respecto al prÃ©stamo se siente contenta porque va a poder invertir mÃ¡s en su negocio. La seÃ±ora Ana Karen quiere decirle a Kiva y a FundaciÃ³n Realidad â€œgracias por apoyarnos con estos prÃ©stamos para crecer mÃ¡s en los negociosâ€.
texts.en:
Ana Karen P. GarcÃ­a is from the town of Moyotepec, a municipality in Ciudad Ayala, Morelos state, MÃ©xico. She is 21 years old and finished basic education. Sheâ€˜s married and has two children: Leyla, 4, who is in preschool and Iker, who is a year and 3 months old. Her business is catalogue based shoe sales for boys, girls, women and men. She will use the loan to buy shoes for boys, girls, women and men. A friend of hers invited her to join the loans to invest in a business through the loans. She started the business five months ago. Her husbandâ€™s cousin invited her to join the catalogue shoe sales. She has used profits to buy shoes to display. They lend her a display case in a local pharmacy to display her products.
Her business is important thanks to the profits it earns which she used primarily to buy more merchandise and to meet household expenses. The part she likes best about her business is going out daily to offer her products and receive orders for footwear. On average, she sees between 5-8 customers daily. Her business faces challenges like the inclemency of the weather, especially when it rains besides facing competition from people in her community who are also into catalogue sales.
She uses profits from the business primarily to reinvest in more shoes. Her short term goal is to add other items to her inventory like ladiesâ€™ purses and blouses. She hopes to accomplish this first with the loan and then with profits from the investment.
Her business is very important to her because it will help her support her family economically as well as make improvements to her house in the future like installing a door, window frames, cement flooring and glass windows.
She would like to develop further in sales and grow professionally. With respect to the loan, she feels happy because she will be able to invest more in her business. Ana Karen would like to say to Kiva and to FundaciÃ³n Realidad: â€œThanks for supporting us with these loans so that we can grow more in our businesses.â€

loan.use: To buy shoes for boys, girls and women.

loan.name: Antonia

texts.es: La seÃ±ora Antonia P. A. vive en la localidad de Moyotepec municipio de Cd. Ayala en el estado de Morelos, MÃ©xico. Tiene 41 aÃ±os, estudio la educaciÃ³n bÃ¡sica hasta la primaria de niÃ±a, y termino la secundaria ya casada en el INEA. El crÃ©dito lo va utilizar principalmente para comprar insumos para su negocio como son: un comal para tostar semilla de calabaza, una parrilla de gas, queso de hebra, tomates chiles, azÃºcar, hojas para tamal manteca, carne, chocolate. La seÃ±ora Antonia pretende utilizar una parte del prÃ©stamo para realizar algunas mejorÃ­as en su hogar que le permitan tambiÃ©n mejorar en su negocio como son: echar piso firme en la cocina de su domicilio. Ella tiene un negocio de venta de tamales, atole, semilla de calabaza tostada y molida para el mole verde (pipiÃ¡n); Este negocio lo tiene desde hace 10 aÃ±os, en aquel entonces la necesidad el obligo a iniciar una actividad econÃ³mica. AprendiÃ³ el oficio a traves de una prima de su esposo que le enseÃ±o a elaborar tamales, antes de dedicarse a la venta de tamales se dedico a otras actividades, vendiendo fruta y verdura de casa en casa, vendia tortillas elaboradas a mano, picaditas y le iba muy bien en su negocio. TambiÃ©n cuando es temporada vende mangos y toronjas. Su negocio no estÃ¡ establecido, ella vende de casa en casa los dÃ­as lunes, miÃ©rcoles y sÃ¡bado en su localidad. Su trabajo aunque es pesado, porque lo hace caminando, es importante porque le ayuda a sacar adelante a sus hijos en la escuela y los gastos de la casa, disfruta mucho las labores de su oficio como el dorar la semilla, preparar los tamales. Una gran satisfacciÃ³n que le da su negocio es que siempre tiene dinero para sus necesidades y tambiÃ©n para sus gustos. Un momento de gran orgullo para ella fue cuando, con unos ahorros que junto de su trabajo, comprÃ³ material para repellar las paredes de su casa. Su negocio principalmente ayuda a las amas de casa que cuando no prepararon de comer le compran a ella sus productos (tamales. Mole, picaditas, etc.). Nos comenta que en promedio atiende entre 50 y 60 personas. Algunos de los desafÃ­os que ha enfrentado en su negocio son la contante alza de los precios y las inclemencias del tiempo. La seÃ±ora Antonia seÃ±ala que para ella es muy importante su negocio porque le ha ayudado a salir adelante con sus hijos y le gustarÃ­a que a travÃ©s de su trabajo cada dÃ­a este mejor con su familia que no les falte nada. Le da gusto recibir este prÃ©stamo y siente una gran responsabilidad por pagarlo. La seÃ±ora Antonia quiere decirle a KIVA â€œmuchas gracias por confiar en mÃ­ y darme el prÃ©stamo porque es de gran ayuda para mi negocio y para mi familia y que ademÃ¡s le me dan facilidad para ir pagÃ¡ndolo y es poco el interÃ©sâ€. A ella le gusta su comunidad porque desde ahÃ­ en dÃ­as despejados se ve el volcÃ¡n (popocatepetl) y los cerros y es campo abierto.
texts.en:
Ms. Antonia P. A. lives in the town of Moyotepec, municipality of Cd. Ayala, in the state of Morelos, Mexico. She is 41 years old. As a girl she studied basic education in primary school and finished high school in the INEA open system after marriage. She is going to use this loan principally to buy consumable products for her business: a griddle to toast pumpkin seeds, a gas grill, string cheese, tomatoes, chiles, sugar, tamale leaves, butter, meat, and chocolate.
Ms. Antonia hopes to use a part of the loan to carry out some improvements to her home which will allow her to improve her business. Specifically, to put down a hard floor in the kitchen of her house. She has a business which sells tamales, atole (a maize drink), and toasted and ground pumpkin seeds for green mole/pipian (a sauce for stewing). She started this business 10 years ago when necessity obliged her to take on an economic activity. She learned the trade from a cousin of her husband who taught her how to make tamales. Before dedicating herself to tamale sales, she had other activities; selling fruit and vegetables door to door, and selling hand-made tortillas and picaditas, and her business was going very well. As well, she sells mangos and grapefuit when in season.
Her business is not fixed. She sells door to door on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Saturdays in her community. Her work, although heavy as she does it on foot, is important because it helps her to get her children ahead in school and with the household expenses. She enjoys the tasks of her trade, such as browning the seed and preparing the tamales. A big satisfaction she gets from her business is always having money for her necessities as well as for her pleasure. A moment of great pride for her was when, with some savings from her work, she bought material to plaster the walls of her house.
Her business principally helps housewives who, when they don't prepare something to eat, buy her products (tamales, mole, picaditas, etc.) We mention that on average she serves between 50 and 60 people. Some of the challenges she has confronted in her business are the constant rise in prices and harsh weather.
Ms. Antonia points out that her business is very important to her because it has helped her and her children to get ahead and she would like that through her work each day is better with her family and that they don't lack anything. She is pleased to receive this loan and feels a large responsibility to repay it. Ms. Antonoa wants to say to Kiva "thank you very much for having confidence in me and giving me this loan because it is a big help for my business and for my family. Also, it gives me easy repayment terms and small interest." She likes her community because from here on clear days you can see the volcano (popocatepetl) and the hills, and it is open country.

loan.use: To buy a tortilla griddle to brown the seed, a gas grill, leaves for tamales, chiles, butter, cane, Oaxaca cheese, sugar, chocolate

loan.name: Leticia

texts.es: La seÃ±ora Leticia T. MartÃ­nez vive en la localidad de Moyotepec, municipio de CD. Ayala en el estado de Morelos, MÃ©xico. Actualmente tiene 35 aÃ±os concluyÃ³ la educaciÃ³n bÃ¡sica termino la secundaria tiene su certificado. Ella tiene su negocio de renta de manteles, mesas y sillas. El prÃ©stamo lo va a utilizar para comprar mÃ¡s manteles para incrementar su negocio. Se enterÃ³ de KIVA y FundaciÃ³n Realidad a travÃ©s de una amiga que la invitÃ³ a participar en un grupo que habÃ­a en su localidad. Su negocio se llama â€œcasa Vargasâ€, ella y su esposo tienen este negocio desde hace ocho aÃ±os. Ellos regresaron hace ocho aÃ±os de trabajar en Estados Unidos y no sabÃ­an en que invertir el dinero que traÃ­an. Entonces un amigo les platico que era buena idea invertir en mesas y sillas para rentar y adquirieron el material para poner su negocio. Antes de este negocio habÃ­a vendido ropa pero ese negocio no le convenciÃ³. Su negocio esta en su casa y atiende a sus clientes su esposo lleva las sillas, las mesas y manteles en su camioneta. Considera su negocio muy importante porque de ahÃ­ obtienen los ingresos para los gastos grandes de su casa y tambiÃ©n para los gastos del diario. Los mayores desafÃ­os que enfrentan es el de surtir contratos grandes, porque es mucho trabajo. Su negocio le enorgullece que entre mÃ¡s tiempo pasa lo van recomendando mÃ¡s y viene gente incluso de otros pueblos a rentarles. Un momento muy especial para ella fue cuando compraron las primeras mesas y sillas para rentar las utilizaron para la fiesta de los tres aÃ±os de su hijo. Nos menciona que su negocio es popular porque aunque vengan de lejos ellos les dan servicio al precio. Algunos de los problemas que enfrenta es que a veces se le pierde al cliente y se los tienen que cobrar; no tienen competencia en su localidad y eso les facilita el trabajo. Piensa que a futuro va comprar mÃ¡s material para su negocio, mesas redondas fundas para silla y se vean mÃ¡s presentables, ella espera que con las ganancias extras del prÃ©stamo lo pueda lograr. La seÃ±ora Leticia es casada, su esposo trabaja dando clases de inglÃ©s de manera particular. Tiene dos hijos, Sergio de 9 aÃ±os estudia la primaria y Cynthia de 3 aÃ±os. Su esposo le ayuda entregando las mesas y recogiÃ©ndolas considera que su negocio es muy importante porque aunque invirtieron mucho al principio ahora el negocio les da buena ganancia. En cuanto a su domicilio nos comenta que quiere hacer un segundo piso y mÃ¡s recamaras para sus hijos. Sus esperanzas son que a travÃ©s de su negocio y esfuerzo puedan sacar adelante la educaciÃ³n de sus hijos. Comenta que cuando recibe el prÃ©stamo se siente muy contenta y comprometida a la vez porque sabe que tiene que invertir para su negocio y dar mejor servicio al cliente y pagar su prÃ©stamo. La seÃ±ora Leticia quiere decirle a Kiva y a FundaciÃ³n Realidad â€œque estÃ¡ muy bien que presten el dinero porque el interÃ©s es bajo y ayudan a los negociosâ€- Moyotepec localidad en donde vive le gusta mucho porque es muy tranquilo el paisaje se ven muchos Ã¡rboles y la gente siembra maÃ­z y caÃ±a de azÃºcar.
texts.en:
Leticia T. MartÃ­nez lives in the City of Moyotepec, located in the state of Morelos, Mexico. Sheâ€™s 35 years old, has completed junior high school and has her diploma. She runs a business where she rents out tables, tablecloths, and chairs and will use the money from this loan to buy more tablecloths to grow her business.
She found out about Kiva and FundaciÃ³n Realidad through a friend who invited her to participate in a local group. Her business is called â€œCasa Vargas,â€ and she and her husband have had it for eight years. When they returned from working in the United States eight years ago, they didnâ€™t know how to invest the money that they had. A friend told them that it would be a good idea to invest in tables and chairs to rent out, so they acquired the items they needed to start the business. Before starting this business, [Leticia] had sold clothing, but that business was not in her best interest.
She runs the business out of her home, where she attends to the customers and her husband delivers the tables and tablecloths in his van. She considers her business to be very important because it provides the money for their major expenses, as well as for their daily ones. The biggest challenge is in servicing large contracts because it is a lot of work.
They are proud that their business is recommended more and more as time passes, and people come from all around, even from other towns, to rent from them. A special moment for her was when they bought their first tables and chairs to rent out. They used them for their three year old sonâ€™s birthday party.
She tells us that her business is popular because, even though people come from far away, they give good service at good prices. One of the problems they face is that sometimes the customers lose the items and they have to charge them. They donâ€™t have any competition in the local area, so it makes things easier.
She believes that in the future they will buy more items for their business; round tables and seat covers, so that they will look more presentable, and feels that she will be able to do it from the extra income facilitated by this loan.
Leticia is married and her husband works as a private English teacher. She has two children; nine year old Sergio who attends elementary school, and three year old Cynthia. Her husband helps by delivering and picking up the tables. She thinks that her business is important because, even though they invested a lot of money up front, it now provides them with a good income. She tells us that she wants to add a second floor to her home, complete with more bedrooms for their kids. Her hopes are that they can provide an education for their children through their business and effort.
She tells us that when she gets the loan she feels very happy and committed because she knows that she needs to invest in her business, give better service to her customers, and repay her loan. Leticia wants to tell Kiva and FundaciÃ³n Realidad, â€œItâ€™s great that you loan the money because the interest is low and you help the businesses.â€ She likes Moyotepec, the place where she lives, very much because the landscape is very peaceful, one can see many trees, and the people there raise corn and sugar cane.

loan.use: Tablecloths

loan.name: Hortencia

texts.es: La seÃ±ora Hortencia DomÃ­nguez RamÃ­rez vive en la comunidad de Moyotepec municipio de Cd. Ayala en el estado de Morelos, MÃ©xico, ella tiene 61 aÃ±os de edad, estudio 2 aÃ±os de la primaria. Su negocio es de venta de refresco (coca-cola, pepsi, jarritos, etc.) y dulces. La seÃ±ora Hortencia cuando iniciÃ³ con su negocio (hace 12 aÃ±os) Ella iniciÃ³ con su negocio cuando comprÃ³ su primer refrigerador, decidiÃ³ vender refresco, despuÃ©s una de sus hijas tuvo un festejo en su casa (arrullada del niÃ±o Dios) le sobraron dulces y se los dio a su mamÃ¡ para que los vendiera. TambiÃ©n uno de sus hijos que se fue a E.U. le ayudÃ³ mandÃ¡ndole dinero para invertir en su negocio y para construir su casa. Con la ayuda de ellos fue haciendo crecer su negocio el cual considera muy importante porque de sus ventas tiene para su manutenciÃ³n y no tiene que andar pidiendo dinero, ademÃ¡s siente gran satisfacciÃ³n porque el dinero que gasta es de ella y no le debe a nadie. A ella le da orgullo que con el producto de su trabajo pudo construir el techo de losa de su casa y unos cuartitos que le ayudo a construir su esposo que es albaÃ±il. La clientela de la seÃ±ora Hortensia son principalmente sus vecinos y a la gente que va de paso, en promedio atiende de 10 a 20 clientes por dÃ­a. Una problemÃ¡tica que ha enfrentado es el aumento de la competencia, de seÃ±oras de su localidad que tambiÃ©n venden dulces. Las ganancias de su negocio las vuelve a invertir, ademÃ¡s de tomar de ahÃ­ para la alimentaciÃ³n. EstÃ¡ planeando ampliar su negocio poniendo otra mesita afuera de casa y meter mÃ¡s productos como chicharrones, dulces y galletas. Nos menciona que otra de las dificultades que enfrenta es que en la temporada de frÃ­o bajan las ventas de refresco, pero comenta que es en esta temporada cuando le ayudan los prÃ©stamos de KIVA, para sacar adelante su negocio en lo que se mejoran las ventas. Tiene tres hijos: Gabriela de 37 aÃ±os, Teresa de 32 aÃ±os e IsaÃ­as de 23 aÃ±os. Sus hijas le ayudan le dan dinero para invertirlo en el negocio cuando pueden. Considera que su negocio le ha ayudado mucho porque cuando sus hijas estudiaban ella les daba para el pasaje y para sus gastos de la escuela. Los planes que tiene a futuro son acabar bien el baÃ±o de su casa y la cocina ponerle losa, ademÃ¡s de poner un fregadero adentro de su cocina, para no tener que salir al patio sobre todo en la Ã©poca de frÃ­o. Se siente feliz de recibir su prÃ©stamo porque para ella representa una gran ayuda para poder salir adelante por sÃ­ sola, ademÃ¡s comenta que ella no ha quedado mal en ningÃºn ciclo. Algo que la seÃ±ora Hortensia quiere comentarle a la gente de KIVA es: â€œle agradezco mucho que me dan esta ayuda, ya que me aligera en temporada de ventas bajasâ€.
texts.en:
Hortencia DomÃ­nguez RamÃ­rez lives in Moyotepec neighborhood, in the town of Ciudad Ayala, in the State of Morelos, Mexico. She is 61 years old and studied two years at elementary school. Her business is selling soft drinks (Coca Cola, Pepsi, Jarritos, etc.) and candy.
Hortencia started her business 12 years ago. She started her business when she bought her first refrigerator. She decided to sell soft drinks after one of her daughters held a religious celebration in her home. She had candy left over and she gave it to her mother to sell. Also, one of her children who went to the United States helped her, sending her money to invest in her business and to build her house with. With their help, she grew her business which she considers very important because her sales provide her with enough money to support herself and she doesn't have to go asking for money. She also feels great satisfaction because the money she spends is hers and she doesn't owe anybody anything. She is proud of the fact that, through her work, she has been able to tile her house roof and she has been able to build some small rooms that her husband, who is a builder, helped her with.
Hortensia's customers are mainly her neighbors and people who pass by. She serves, on average, 10 to 20 customers a day. One problem that she has faced is the increase in competition from the ladies in her town who also sell candy. Hortensia re-invests her profits back into her business, as well as using some to pay for food. She is planning to expand her business, putting another table outside her house and stocking more products such as cracklings (pork scratchings), candies and cookies. She tells us that another difficulty she faces is that, during the cold season, she doesn't sell as many soft drinks. However, she says that it is during this season that KIVA loans help her to get ahead in her business, improving her sales.
Hortensia has three children: 37 year-old Gabriela, 32 year-old Teresa and 23 year-old IsaÃ­as. Her daughters help her, giving her money to invest in her business whenever they can. She considers that her business has helped her a lot because when her daughters were studying she was able to pay for their transportation and school expenses. Hortensia's plans for the future are to finish off her bathroom and her kitchen, laying tiles. She would also like to install a sink in her kitchen so that she doesn't have to go out to the yard, especially during the cold season. She feels happy to be receiving this loan because, for her, it represents a great help in getting herself ahead in life on her own. She also tells us that she has never had problems making her repayments. Hortensia has a message for KIVA lenders: "I am very grateful that you are giving me this help since it lightens my burden during the season when sales are low".

loan.use: To buy soft drinks

loan.name: Adriana

texts.es: La seÃ±ora Adriana RodrÃ­guez V. se encuentra localizada en la comunidad de Ahuehueyo, Ayala, en el estado de Morelos, MÃ©xico. ella tiene 38 aÃ±os de edad , estudio hasta el 3er. AÃ±o de la secundaria tiene su certificado, ella es casada tiene 3 hijos Roberto Carlos tiene 21 aÃ±os de edad es casado y trabaja, Marco Antonio tiene 16 aÃ±os de edad y trabaja y Bryan tiene 10 aÃ±os de edad estudia la primaria, la seÃ±ora Adriana tiene su negocio de venta de pollo, ella solicito su prÃ©stamo para comprar pollo, ella inicio su negocio hace 7 aÃ±os por necesidades ya que con el dinero que entraba de su esposo no alcanzaba, el local donde vende esta en el centro y lo renta paga muy poco de renta al ayudante, comenzÃ³ vendiendo al realizo le dejaban el pollo en la maÃ±ana y en la tarde lo pagaba, su negocio estÃ¡ en centro de Ahuehueyo a 2 cuadras de su casa llega caminando, su negocio es importante porque de ahÃ­ vive con su familia, la parte favorita de su negocio es cuando hay venta porque tiene dinero y le da gran satisfacciÃ³n y orgullo poder salir adelante, cuando puede comprar lo que sus hijos le piden. Sus clientes son sus amigas, sus vecinas, las seÃ±oras, las muchachas, los productos que ofrece a sus clientes son pollo por pieza o entero, bistec de pollo, su negocio es popular por el buen trato a los clientes le hacen su pedido y cuando pasan ya lo tiene listo para entregar, cuando hacen sus fiestas le apartan su pollo. Su negocio enfrenta la competencia hay mas pollerÃ­as cerca de su negocio, las ganancias las va ocupando con sus hijos, ella quiere tener un lugar para tener el pollo vivo y tener mÃ¡s ganancias y lo piensa logra esforzÃ¡ndose, su negocio le ha ayudado en lo econÃ³mico para los gastos de sus hijos para que sigan estudiando, sus planes y esperanzas son crecer en su negocio, aumentar las venta y estÃ¡ feliz con este prÃ©stamo que le proporcionan porque le da la oportunidad de adquirir su pollo y dar mejor servicio a los clientes, las mejoras que desea para el futuro de sus hijos son que sigan estudiando que se preparen para ser alguien importante y lo piensa lograr apoyÃ¡ndose en el prÃ©stamo utilizarlo para el negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adriana RodrÃ­guez V. is located in the community of Ahuehueyo Ayala in the state of Morelos, MÃ©xico. She is 38 years old and finished third grade of middle school; she has her certificate. Sheâ€™s married and has three children: Roberto Carlos, 21, who is married and works, Marco Antonio, who is 16 and works, and Bryan, who is ten and goes to elementary school.
Her business is selling chicken. She is asking for funds to buy chicken. She started the business 7 years ago due to need because her husbandâ€™s earnings didnâ€™t go far enough. The locale where she sells is located downtown and she rents it; the rent se pays to the helper is low. When she started her business sheâ€™d get the chicken in the morning and sheâ€™d have to pay for it in the afternoon. Her business is in downtown Ahuehueyo, two blocks from home. She walks to work.
Her business is very important to her because thatâ€™s what provides for her family. Her favorite part of the business is when sales happen because then she has money and that gives her much satisfaction and pride for being able to get ahead, when she is able to buy the things her children ask for.
Her customers are her friends, neighbors, housewives and domestics. The products she offers her customers are whole chickens and chicken parts, chicken filets. Her business is popular thanks to the good customer service she provides; when the customers come by she already has their orders ready for them to pick up and when they have parties they order the chicken from her.
Her business faces competition from chicken shops nearby. She uses the profits for her children. Sheâ€™d like to have a place to keep live chickens and earn better profits; she expects to accomplish this through hard work.
Her business has helped her economically to meet her childrenâ€™s educational expenses so that they can continue in school. Her plans and hopes are to see her business grow and increase sales.
She is happy with this loan she got because it will provide her with the opportunity to acquire her chicken and provide better customer service.
The improvements she hopes for the future are that her children stay in school so that they will prepare themselves to be people of importance some day and she aims to accomplish this with help from the loan sheâ€™ll use for her business.

loan.use: To buy live chickens and at wholesale to sell whole or in pieces.

loan.name: Ramiz

texts.ru:
Ramiz G. rodilsya v 1955 qodu. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey , odin iz kotorix uchitsya v kolledje. Ramiz jivet v qorode Baku vmeste so svoyey jenoy i detmi. Ramiz uje 17 let zanimayetsya etim biznessom. eto uje vtoraya ssuda Ramiza , posle pervoy ssudi on pochinil svoyu mashinu i prodav yeyo kupil druquyu mashinu. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya svoyey mashini.
http://www.kiva.org/lend/67095
texts.en:
Ramiz G. was born in 1955. He is married and has two children, one of whom is studying in college. Ramiz lives in the city of Baku together with his wife and children.
Ramiz has been in this business for seventeen years. This is the second loan for Ramiz, and after the first one he repaired his vehicle and sold it and bought a new car. Right now he needs 2000 AZN to buy spare parts for his vehicle.

loan.use: To buy spare parts for vehicle

loan.name: Vitalyi

texts.en:
Vitalyi, married with two daughters, lives in Novomokovsk and earns his living offering cargo transportation services in Ukraine. Vitalyiâ€™s business has been impacted by developments in the farming industry. Rich harvests have been keeping him busy as he travels all around the country with a variety of freight. Vitalyiâ€™s net profit amounts to 6,000 UAH a month.

Vitalyi owns two vans and is requesting a loan of 9,000 UAH to do some repair work on his vehicles. Properly operating vans will help him perform his work more efficiently, wasting less fuel and lubricants. Vitalyi is hoping to generate additional income to help his daughter pay for her college tuition.

loan.use: To repair his vehicles

loan.name: Nadjiba

texts.ru: Nadjiba S. 45 let. Ona zamujem i imeyet odnoqo rebonka kotoriy uchitsya v universitete. On jivet v qorode Baku vmeste s mujem i rebonkom. Nadjiba seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi rasshirit svoy magazin chtobi ona moqla pomestit tuda bolshe raznix tovarov. Nadjiba uje 15 let kak rabotayet v etom biznesse prodaji pishevix produktov. Etomu biznessu ona nauchilas u svoyey teti.
texts.en:
Nadjiba S. is 45 years old. She is married and has one child who goes to university. She lives in the city of Baku together with husband and child.
Nadjiba needs 2000 AZN right now to expand the space in her store so that she can include more produce there. Nadjiba has been doing this business selling food products for fifteen years now. She has learned this business from her aunt.

loan.use: Ð¢Ð¾ Ðµxpand store space

loan.name: Baba

texts.ru: Baba B. 29 let. On jenat i imeyet 1 rebonka. Baba jivet v qorode Baku vmeste so svoyey jenoy i rebonkom. Semya u Babi bila bednoy i poetomu on s malix let nachal rabotat. Baba uje 9 let rabotayet taxistom, Ranshe on rabotal prodavcom v magazine. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chto bi kupit zapchasti dlya svoyye mashini.
texts.en:
Baba B. is 29 years old. He is married and has one child. Baba lives in the city of Baku together with his wife and child. Baba's family was poor and this is why he started working since a very young age.
Baba has been working as a taxi driver for nine years. Before that he was working as a sales person in a store. At this time he needs 2000 AZN to buy spare parts for his vehicle.

loan.use: To buy spare parts for vehicle

loan.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose de 45 aÃ±os, es un hombre trabajador que desde hace 15 aÃ±os empezÃ³ a trabajar como comerciante informal y despuÃ©s empezÃ³ a vender loterÃ­a y frutas con su esposa pero para obtener mÃ¡s dinero comenzÃ³ a trabajar en â€œTÃ­aâ€ (supermercado).
Hace 5 aÃ±os atrÃ¡s con esfuerzo y dedicaciÃ³n decidiÃ³ tener su propio negocio e independizarse comprando una tienda. Por esa buena decisiÃ³n en la actualidad el tiene una tienda de vÃ­veres donde vende legumbres a $ 0.25c/u, lÃ¡cteos $ 0.60, bebidas $ 0.50, arroz, etc. Trabaja desde las 04h30am cuando va a comprar los vÃ­veres hasta las 06h00 que abre la tienda hasta las 20h00pm todos los dÃ­as.
Para seguir con su negocio Ã©l quiere comprar con el prÃ©stamo enlatados, granos, bebidas y otros vÃ­veres para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener un vehiculo para poder transportar la mercaderÃ­a.
texts.en:
JosÃ©, 45, is a hard working man who started working as an informal merchant 15 years ago. He then started selling lottery tickets and fruit with his wife. However, in order to earn more money, he started working at â€œTÃ­aâ€ (supermarket).
Thanks to his effort and dedication five years ago he decided to open his own business and become independent buying a store. That good decision has led to his having a grocery store today where he sells vegetables at $0.25 each, dairy products at $0.60, soft drinks at $0.50, rice, etc. He is open from 4:30am which is when he goes to buy foodstuffs and then opens the store at 6am and works until 8pm every day.
To stay in business he wants to use the loan to buy canned goods, grains, beverages and other foodstuffs for his store. In the future heâ€™d like to have a vehicle to transport his merchandise.

loan.use: For canned goods, sugar and rice.

loan.name: Jose Vicente

texts.es:
Jose de 46 aÃ±os, es un hombre trabajador que desde que se quedo sin trabajo ha buscado medios de ingresos como lo hizo hace 5 aÃ±os atrÃ¡s vendiendo colas en vaso.
Viviendo en una zona urbana llamada suburbio ha trabajado en la ventana de su casa vendiendo algunos vÃ­veres a sus vecinos poco a poco ha podido surtir y convertirla en una pequeÃ±a tienda. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 22h00pm vendiendo bebidas desde $ 0.30, confites desde $ 0.25, agua desde $ 0.30etc.
Tiene muchas aspiraciones para continuar con su negocio y surtirlo por eso quiere el prÃ©stamo para comprar ropa, bebidas y recargas celulares para sus clientes. En el futuro quiere tener un minimarket porque en el sector donde vive no hay.
texts.en:
JosÃ©, 46, is a hard working man who has been looking for ways to earn income since he lost his job like he did five years ago selling colas by the glass.
Living in an urban zone called Suburbio he has worked selling foodstuffs from his houseâ€™s window to his neighbors. Gradually he has managed to stock it and turn it into a small store. He currently is open from 7am until 10pm selling soft drinks for $0.30, sweets from $0.25, water from $0.30, etc.
He has many hopes for staying in business and stocking it. This is why he wants the loan: to buy clothes, beverages and cell phone recharges for his customers. In the future heâ€™d like to have a minimarket because there is none in the area where he lives.

loan.use: For recharges, beverages and clothes.

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Yadira Del Socorro

texts.es: Yadira es una pequeÃ±a comerciante en venta de ropa nueva, usada, y alquiler de cuarto. Lleva varios aÃ±os en el negocio, iniciando con poca mercaderÃ­a, con dinero que su esposo dio. Luego nace la iniciativa de mejorar un cuarto para alquiler lo que recurre al financiamiento para hacer las mejoras. Lo que logra tener mejores ingresos. Para apoyar a su familia. Este es su sÃ©ptimo ciclo de prÃ©stamo en donde invertirÃ¡ en la compra de ropa nueva como: pantalones jean de varÃ³n y mujer, ropa de niÃ±os, camisas, camisetas ropa interior, ya que tiene poco inventario y desea tener mejores ingresos atreves de las ventas de su mercaderÃ­a.
texts.en:
Yadira is a small businesswoman who sells new and used clothes and rents out a room. She has been in her business for several years, starting with just a little merchandise that she bought with some money her husband gave her. Then she got the idea of improving a room so that she could rent it out, taking out a loan to make the improvements. This way she has better profits and can support her family.
This is Yadira's seventh loan and she will invest it in buying new clothes such as men's and women's jeans, children's clothes, shirts, t-shirts and underwear since she doesn't have much inventory and she would like to improve her income through her sales.

loan.use: To invest in buying various items of clothing and underwear for men and women, increasing her sales

loan.name: Mercurio Group

texts.es:
La B.C. â€œMERCURIOâ€ estÃ¡ iniciando su primer ciclo en el Centro Focal de GermÃ¡n Busch. EstÃ¡ compuesta por ocho integrantes. A la cabeza se encuentra la seÃ±ora presidenta Ana Maria, seguida de la tesorera la seÃ±ora Beatriz y la secretaria de Actas la seÃ±ora Silvia. Los negocios que llevan adelante cada una de estas seÃ±oras son diferentes, por ejemplo tenemos: venta de ropa, venta de chicharrÃ³n de pollo, venta de pollo, venta de juguetes, costura de chamarras y trabajo en carpinterÃ­a.
En el caso del negocio de la seÃ±ora presidenta, su negocio es la venta de ropa. Ella ya tiene experiencia en el ramo, mÃ¡s de cuatro aÃ±os vendiendo ropa, cuenta con un puesto fijo en la Zona BalliviÃ¡n de la ciudad de El Alto. Este es su primer ciclo, por lo que la seÃ±ora Ana MarÃ­a considera que el crÃ©dito le servirÃ¡ para incrementar la mercaderÃ­a.
texts.en:
The Mercurio Communal Bank is starting its first cycle in the GermÃ¡n Busch regional office. The bank is comprised of eight members.
Ana Maria is at the head of the group, and she is the president. Beatriz is the treasurer, and Silvia is the secretary.
These women carry out different business activities. Examples of their activities are selling clothes, selling deep-fried chicken, selling chicken, selling toys, making jackets, and doing carpentry work.
The president sells clothes. She already has experience in this field, as she has been selling clothes for over four years. She has a fixed stand in the BalliviÃ¡n Zone in the city of El Alto.
This is her first cycle, and Ana MarÃ­a will use the loan to increase her merchandise.

loan.use: To buy clothes

loan.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma, de 33 aÃ±os, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo Adolfo de 40 aÃ±os y de sus 3 pequeÃ±os hijos, juntos se esfuerzan cada dÃ­a para salir adelante. Esta empeÃ±osa dama se dedica a la venta de fruta en el puesto que tiene en el mercado, pues su esposo es agricultor en la selva del paÃ­s y ella viaja dos veces al mes para traer la fruta que vende en su puesto. AdemÃ¡s comercializa fruta en las casas de sus clientes que le piden, de esta manera asegura las ventas; le gusta mucho su labor pues es bastante rentable lo que le permite ayudar a su esposo en los constantes gastos del hogar. AsÃ­ pasan los dÃ­as de Norma que trabaja con mucho esfuerzo pues quiere sacar a su familia adelante; y como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado ampliar la variedad de fruta que vende, ya que quiere mejorar sus ganancias. Es el segundo crÃ©dito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirÃ¡ continuar trabajando para crecer empresarialmente. Norma tiene planeado invertir el crÃ©dito solicitado en la compra de varias cajas para trasladar la fruta que comercializara, de esta manera espera cumplir con todos sus pedidos.
texts.en:
Norma, age 33, lives in her own house with her 40 year old husband, Adolfo, and their three small children. Together they put forth great effort every day in order to get ahead.
This hard-working woman sells fruit in a stand that she has at the market. Her husband farms in the countryâ€™s forest. She travels twice a month to get the fruit that she sells at her stand. She also sells fruit at the homes of customers who place orders. This way she is assured of sales.
She really likes her work because it is profitable enough, and it allows her to help her husband with the regular household expenses. This is how Norma spends her days; she works with great effort because she wants to get her family ahead.
As she is an enterprising woman, she has future plans to increase the variety of fruit that she sells. She wants to do this to improve her earnings.
This is her second loan with MFP, and she pledges to make her payments on time. She does not want to disappoint the people who made this loan possible. It will allow her to continue working in order to grow in her business. Norma plans to use the requested loan to buy various boxes to transport the fruit that she sells. This is the way she plans to fill all of her orders.

loan.use: Buy boxes of fruit for retail sales

loan.name: Gioconda

texts.es: Gioconda es una madre muy dedicada al trabajo para lograr apoyar a su familia. Hoy en dÃ­a su negocio es la venta de tortilla y ropa. Iniciando con poco dinero con una pequeÃ±a pulperÃ­a, en donde no logro equilibrar su negocio, lo que cambio. A la venta de tortilla asÃ­ como la venta de ropa. Pues no ha sido fÃ¡cil ya que su objetivo ha sido obtener ingreso ya que su familia es mucha. Lleva dos crÃ©ditos con la instituciÃ³n, los cual ha demostrado un buen comportamiento de pago, en donde con este nuevo crÃ©dito serÃ¡ para la compra variada de ropa nueva, a si como uniforme de colegios ya que se aproxima la fecha de los estudiantes lo que aprovechara a vender.a si como la producccion mas de tortillas.
texts.en:
Gioconda is a mother who is very committed to her work so that she can support her family. Her current business is selling tortillas and clothes. She started out with a little money and a small grocery store. However, she couldn't manage to balance her business and therefore changed it. Now she sells tortillas and clothes.
It has not been easy for Gioconda since her goal has been to make money as she has a large family.
Gioconda has had two loans with the institution and she has been responsible in making her repayments. She will use this new loan to buy a variety of new clothes as well as school uniforms since the back-to-school season is approaching and she will take advantage of this to make sales. She will also produce more tortillas.

loan.use: To invest in buying clothes and uniforms so that she can improve her sales. To increase her tortilla production

loan.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela, de 36 aÃ±os, vive en su casa propia al lado de su pareja y de sus dos pequeÃ±os hijos; cada dÃ­a se esfuerza por continuar adelante. Desde hace 4 aÃ±os, esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la venta de comida en un paradero de la zona por donde vive. Ella saca su parrilla todos los dÃ­as a las 4 de la tarde y empieza con la venta de pedazos de pollo, y corazÃ³n de res que cocina a la parrilla en el momento; y el tiempo le ha permitido captar varios clientes, sobretodo trabajadores de las lÃ­neas del paradero pues le consumen porque saben de su buena sazÃ³n y precios. Lo que no le gusta del trabajo es que por la zona tiene bastante competencia de venta de comida, por lo que debe esmerarse bastante en la buena presentaciÃ³n y los precios de las parrillas. Como es una mujer que siempre se proyecta al futuro tiene pensado instalar un restaurante, donde ofrezca todos variedad de platillos, de esta manera espera salir adelante. Es el cuarto crÃ©dito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirÃ¡ continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Adela tiene planeado invertir el crÃ©dito solicitado en la compra de ingredientes al por mayor que le hacen falta para continuar preparando sus platillos, ya que quiere aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Adela, age 36, lives in her own house with her life partner and their two small children. She puts forth great effort every day to continue getting ahead. For four years this enterprising woman has been selling food at a bus stop in the zone where she lives. At four every afternoon she takes her grill and starts selling pieces of chicken and beef heart. She cooks them on the grill at the bus stop. Time has allowed her to win various customers, mostly the workers of the bus lines at the stop. They eat her food because they know it tastes good and for the prices.
What she does not like about her work is that there is plenty of competition selling food in the area. Therefore, she needs to take great care in the good presentation and the prices of the grilled food. As she is a woman who always plans for the future, she plans to establish a restaurant where she would offer all types of dishes. This is the way she hopes to get ahead.
This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she pledges to make her payments on time. She does not want to disappoint the people who made this loan possible. The loan allows her to continue working as she seeks to make progress. Adela plans to use the requested loan to buy wholesale ingredients that she needs to prepare her dishes. She wants to increase her earnings.

loan.use: To buy wholesale ingredients to continue making food

loan.name: Tomasa

texts.es: La seÃ±ora Tomasa C. R. vive en la localidad de Moyotepec, del municipio de Cd. Ayala en el estado de Morelos, MÃ©xico. Ella tiene 42 aÃ±os de edad, estudio la educaciÃ³n bÃ¡sica. Su crÃ©dito lo va a utilizar para incrementar el inventario de su negocio, ella IniciÃ³ su negocio hace dos aÃ±os en la casa donde vive su hermana hay una cancha de fut-bol en la colonia Abelardo y los jugadores llegaban a preguntar si vendÃ­a agua o refrescos, Entonces decidiÃ³ poner un puesto con una inversiÃ³n pequeÃ±a, comenzÃ³ a vender agua y refrescos, El espacio que ocupa actualmente se lo prestÃ³ su hermana esta a un lado del campo de fut-bol de la colonia Abelardo, abre los dÃ­as sÃ¡bado y domingo y a veces sus sobrinos le ayuda a atender el negocio entre semana Antes de dedicares a la venta de abarrotes vendiÃ³ zapatos por catalogo pero esta actividad no le gusto porque tenÃ­a que caminar mucho, y en su negocio esta mÃ¡s descansada, ella va a comprar con su prÃ©stamo refrescos, botellas de agua, botanas, jugos y dulces que es lo que mÃ¡s vende. Para trasladarse a su negocio ella se hace 10 min. En transporte pÃºblico. Considera muy importante su negocio pues de su trabajo obtiene las ganancias suficientes para su manutenciÃ³n ademÃ¡s le da gran satisfacciÃ³n ser la administradora de su propio negocio, ademÃ¡s de que a travÃ©s de su negocio conoce a mucha gente y todos la tratan con respeto.
