En su negocio atiende principalmente a los jugadores y sus familias, a los aficionados que van a presenciar los partidos. Uno de los desafÃ­os que enfrenta en su negocio es la creciente competencia lo que ha hecho que disminuyan sus ventas. Las ganancias del negocio las utiliza para invertir en mÃ¡s producto para su negocio, ademÃ¡s de pagar los servicios de su negocio y su hogar. Dentro de sus planes esta comprar productos diferentes a los que vende para tener mÃ¡s variedad en su negocio. Dentro de sus planes a futuro esta establecer en forma s u negocio como una tienda de abarrotes e incrementar el nÃºmero de clientes. La seÃ±ora Tomasa es casada, su esposo es albaÃ±il, tiene 3 hijas: RubÃ­ de 17 aÃ±os, Yesica de 22 aÃ±os y JazmÃ­n de 20 aÃ±os, como sus dos hijas estÃ¡n casadas y se dedican al hogar no le pueden ayudar en su negocio y su hija mÃ¡s chica estudia. A veces le ayuda su sobrino a despachar entre semana y el sÃ¡bado y domingo ella atiende personalmente a la clientela. Moyotepec es un pueblo tranquilo, hay campo. La seÃ±ora Tomasa quiere decirle a Kiva y a FundaciÃ³n Realidad â€œles agradezco que pueden ayudarnos con este prÃ©stamo para mejorar los negociosâ€
texts.en:
Tomasa C. R. lives in the Moyotepec community in the city of Ayala in the state of Morelos, Mexico. She is 42 years old, and she has an elementary school education. She will use the loan to increase the inventory in her business. She started her business two years ago in her sisterâ€™s house. There is a soccer field in the Abelardo neighborhood, and the players asked if she sold water or soft drinks.
She then decided to make a small investment to establish a stand, and she started to sell water and soft drinks. Her sister lent her the space that she currently uses. It is on the side of the soccer field in the Abelardo neighborhood. She opens it on Saturdays and Sundays. Sometimes her sisterâ€™s children help her take care of the business during the week.
Before she sold food she sold shoes by catalog. She did not like this business activity very much because she had to walk a lot, and in her new business she is not as tired. She is going to use the loan to buy soft drinks, bottles of water, snacks, juice, and sweets. She sells these the most. It takes her ten minutes using public transportation to get to her business.
She feels that her business is very important because her work gives her enough income for her living expenses. In addition, it gives her great satisfaction to run her own business. Also, through her business she knows a lot of people, and they all treat her respectfully.
In her business she primarily waits on the players, their families, and the fans that go to the games. One of the challenges that her business faces is the growing competition, which has caused her sales to drop. She uses the income from her business to invest in more products for her business. She also pays for the utilities at her business and her home.
She plans to buy different products than the ones she sells in order to have more variety in her business. Her future plans are to set up her business like a grocery store and to increase the number of customers she has.
Tomasa is married, and her husband is a bricklayer. They have three daughters. RubÃ­ is 17 years old, Yesica is 22 years old, and JazmÃ­n is 20 years old. As two of her daughters are married, they keep house and are not able to help in her business. Her youngest daughter goes to school. Sometimes her nephew helps her take care of the business during the week. On Saturday and Sunday she personally takes care of the customers.
Moyotepec is a peaceful village with fields.
Tomasa wants to say thanks to Kiva and to the FundaciÃ³n Realidad, â€œI am grateful to those who are able to help us improve our businesses with this loan.â€

loan.use: To buy soft drinks like Coca-Cola, Pepsi, Jarrito, Squirt, Mirinda, and bottles of purified water and sweets

loan.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, de 38 aÃ±os, vive en la casa de su madre al lado de ella y de sus 2 hijos menores; juntos se esfuerzan cada dÃ­a por salir adelante en busca del progreso. Esta empeÃ±osa mujer se dedica a la venta de gaseosas, de manera ambulatoria, en las calles de un paradero muy concurrido. Esta muy satisfecha con su labor pues la desempeÃ±a de lunes a sÃ¡bado, desde las 8 de la maÃ±ana hasta las 6 de la tarde, y tiene muy buenas ganancias por lo que ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. AdemÃ¡s se dedica a la venta de ropa, que deja a crÃ©dito, y tambiÃ©n comercializa Ãºtiles escolares; dice que su labor es por temporadas, es por esta razÃ³n que no tiene un trabajo estable. Solo le disgusta que tiene que soportar las inclemencias del tiempo, y durante la temporada de invierno comercializa trozos de caÃ±a de azÃºcar que ella misma fabrica en unas bolsas, de esta manera siempre esta en busca de ganar dinero para sustentar a su familia. Como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado instalar un negocio fijo para lograr sacar a su familia adelante. Es el primer crÃ©dito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirÃ¡ continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Elizabeth tiene planeado invertir el crÃ©dito solicitado en la compra de mercaderÃ­a en ropa, pues tiene varios pedidos pendientes y espera concretarlos para mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, age 38, lives in her motherâ€™s house with her mother and her two minor children. Together they put forth great effort every day to get ahead in the search for progress. This enterprising woman sells soft drinks in an itinerant manner. She sells on the streets of a very busy bus stop.
She is very satisfied with her work. She works from Monday through Saturday from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. She has very good earnings, and she has managed to get her family ahead. She also sells clothes on credit, and she sells school supplies. Her work is seasonal, which is why she does not have stable work.
The only thing she does not like is having to put up with inclement weather. During the winter season she sells pieces of sugar cane in bags that she makes herself. She is always looking for ways to earn money to support her family. As she is an enterprising woman, in the future she plans to establish a steady business in order to manage to get her family ahead.
This is her first loan with MFP, and she pledges to make her payments on time. She does not want to disappoint the people who make this loan possible. The loan will allow her to continue working in the search of progress. Elizabeth plans to use the requested loan to buy clothing merchandise because she has several pending orders. She plans to fill them in order to improve her earnings.

loan.use: Stock up on more clothing to fill her customers' orders

loan.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal â€œNUEVO AMANECER DE URUBAMBAâ€; Este banco estÃ¡ ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr: Ignacio; El socio tiene 46 aÃ±os de edad, el socio es conviviente; el socio tiene 4 hijos; el socio trabaja como moto taxista; el socio brinda el servicio de moto taxi en la provincia de Urubamba, el socio acondicionÃ³ su moto a una especie de carreta llamada moto taxi, el vehÃ­culo transporta pasajeros de tramos cortos, el socio manifiesta que le va muy bien y que desearÃ­a tener una flota de este tipo de transporte pÃºblico, por el momento el socio requiere el prÃ©stamo para arreglar su casa, el socio harÃ¡ unos acabados en su sala y baÃ±o principal, el socio tambiÃ©n cubrirÃ¡ una pequeÃ±a deuda que adquiriÃ³ por concepto de un regalo que le compro a su conyugue. El socio solicita el prÃ©stamo para realizar un acabado en su hogar especÃ­ficamente la sala y baÃ±o.
El socio estÃ¡ feliz con el prÃ©stamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Ignacio is a member of â€œNUEVO AMANECER DE URUBAMBAâ€ (Urubambaâ€™s New Dawn) communal bank which is located in Urubamba province, Cusco department.
He is 46 years old, has a spouse and four children. He works as a taxi driver. He provides mototaxi services in Urubamba province. He modified his motorcycle adding a type of cabin called a mototaxi. The vehicle transports passengers on short runs. He states that he does quite well and would like to have a fleet of these kinds of public transportation vehicles.
For the moment, however, he needs a loan to do some home improvements. He will do some work in the living room and bathroom. He will also pay off a debt he incurred buying a gift for his spouse. He is asking for the loan to do some finishing touches in his home, specifically in the living room and bathroom.
He is happy with the granted loan and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loan.use: To do some home improvements, specifically in the living room and bathroom.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: For home improvements.

loan.name: Efrain

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal â€œNUEVO AMANECER DE URUBAMBAâ€; Este banco estÃ¡ ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr: Efrain; El socio tiene 31 aÃ±os de edad, el socio es conviviente; el socio tiene 2 hijos de 3 y 14 aÃ±os de edad; el socio trabaja en su carpinterÃ­a, el es carpintero y tiene tambiÃ©n su moto taxi de vez en cuando el maneja su transporte, el socio trabaja con su hermano y el hermano del socio es el que maneja su moto taxi y Ã©l se dedica a la carpinterÃ­a, es como si le rentara el vehÃ­culo, el socio ahora solicita el prÃ©stamo porque desea invertir en la compra de madera para su carpinterÃ­a el socio tiene unos pedidos y requiere la madera para empezar a trabajar. texts.en:
EfraÃ­n, 31, is a member of the â€œNUEVO AMANECER DE URUBAMBAâ€ (Urubambaâ€™s New Dawn) communal bank located in Urubamba province, Cusco department.
He lives with his spouse and two children who are 3 and 14 years old. He works in his carpentry shop. He is the carpenter but he also has his mototaxi which he himself drives sometimes to provide transportation. He works with his brother and his brother is the usual mototaxi driver whereas EfraÃ­n works as a carpenter; itâ€™s as if he rented his vehicle to his brother.
He now needs a loan because he wants to invest in lumber for his carpentry shop; he has a few pending orders and he needs lumber in order to start on the jobs. He is asking for the loan to buy lumber for his carpentry shop.
He is happy with the granted loan and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loan.use: To buy lumber for his carpentry shop.

loan.name: Madeline Jissell

texts.es: Madeline de 25 aÃ±os de edad, casada madre de un hijo. Labora como analista de unidad tÃ©cnica coordinadora de proyectos en una empresa privada. Teniendo el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja en publicidad. Juntos han logrado tener su casa y como objetivo es ir mejorando. Con este prÃ©stamo lograra poner cerÃ¡mica en toda su casa, ya que el piso estÃ¡ muy viejo y parte quebrada. Para esto comprara cerÃ¡mica, cemento bond, porcelana, separadores para poner en ciento veinte metros cuadrados de su vivienda. Lo que estÃ¡ contenta por este cambio y por el apoyo financiero a plazo que brinda Afodenic.
texts.en: Madeline is 25 years old, married and has one child. She works as a technical unit analyst - project coordinator in a private company. She has the support of her husband who works in advertising. Together they have managed to obtain their own home and their aim is to gradually improve it. They will use this loan to put down tiles throughout their home since the floor is very old and broken in places. For this work they will buy tiles, cement, porcelain and separators so that they can lay down twenty square meters in their home. Madeline is happy to be making this change and happy with the financial support she is receiving through this loan from Afodenic.

loan.use: To put down tiles throughout her home, managing to make this improvement since the floor is very old and broken in places.

loan.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal â€œNUEVO AMANECER DE URUBAMBAâ€; Este banco estÃ¡ ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr: Alejandro; El socio tiene 36 aÃ±os de edad, el socio es casado; el socio tiene 2 hijos; el socio trabaja en su zapaterÃ­a, el socio tiene una zapaterÃ­a ya que Ã©l es zapatero de profesiÃ³n, el socio vende zapatos y tambiÃ©n los repara, su conyugue lo ayuda en su zapaterÃ­a ellos tambiÃ©n venden plantillas, escobillas, tintes, grasas y otros materiales de zapaterÃ­a y accesorios. The member belongs to the Nuevo Amanacer de Urubamba communal bank which is located in Urubamba province in Cusco department.
He is Alejandro, 36, married, with two children. A shoemaker by profession, he works in a shoe store where he sells and also repairs shoes. His wife helps him in the store and they also sell insoles, brushes, dyes, shoe polish and other related items and accessories. Alejandro needs the loan to buy materials to make shoes and that is why he is requesting the loan for this season.
He is very happy with the loan extended to him and he promises to make all the payments in the established time period.

loan.use: The member is requesting a loan to buy material to make shoes for this season

loan.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
El seÃ±or Rogelio U. M. es casado y tiene tres hijos a su responsabilidad quienes son: marÃ­a AngÃ©lica de trece aÃ±o, la otra es Blanca Estela de once aÃ±os y el mÃ¡s pequeÃ±o Ignacio de siete aÃ±os.
El solicito el prÃ©stamo para invertirlo en la compra y venta de becerros y vacas para luego venderlo en la misma regiÃ³n ya que es un negocio de buen resultado dejando buen ingreso en su familia
Inicio por su propia creatividad ya que para tener ingresos en su hogar tiene que tener de donde trabajar algo que le dejara buen resultado y con ello salga adelante.
Con las ganancias que baya obteniendo lo estar a invirtiendo en la compra de mas veceros para seguir trabajando durante dios le preste vida y asÃ­ logre realizar todos su sueÃ±os.
Su sueÃ±o es que sus hijos salgan delante teniendo una buena preparaciÃ³n y de ello puedan vivir en el futuro ya que la mejor herencia es que tengan una buena profesiÃ³n.
texts.en:
Mr. Rogelio U. M. is married and has three children in his care. They are: MarÃ­a AngÃ©lica, 13, Blanca Estela, 11, and the youngest, Ignacio, 7.
He requested a loan to invest in the purchase of calves and cows for subsequent resale in the same region since this is a business that produces good results consisting in income for his family.
He started out thanks to his own creativity since in order to have household income he must have a way of working at something that produces good results in order to get ahead.
He will reinvest profits as they are earned in the purchase of additional calves to continue working as long as God grants him life thus making his dreams come true.
His dream is that all his children succeed having a good preparation so that they can support themselves in the future since the best inheritance a parent can give is a good profession.

loan.use: To buy livestock, like cows and calves, for subsequent resale in the same region.

loan.name: Dolores

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora Dolores L. H. vive en Tecpatan Estado de Chiapas MÃ©xico, es casada con tres hijas a su responsabilidad y son: Tania Guadalupe de 12 aÃ±os, gloria Melisa de cuatro aÃ±os y el mÃ¡s pequeÃ±o es JesÃºs Abey de tres aÃ±os.
Ella esta se dedica a vender la mercancÃ­a de topear ware en donde lleva diez aÃ±os y desde entonces le va muy bien ya que ha obtenido mucha clientela del cual le compra a mayoreo, ya que s mercancÃ­a de buena calidad y la apetecen.
De todo lo que va obteniendo del diario lo ahorra, pues su inspiraciÃ³n es que logre ser una gerentes de ventas en los artÃ­culos delo que ella vende y asÃ­ salir adelante con su familia.
Su mÃ¡s grande sueÃ±o es que con el tiempo logre su meta de ser una ejecutiva de ventas y poner su propio negocio del cual se siente muy orgullosa de ellos pues le ha dejado muy buen resultado.
Para solicitar el prÃ©stamo busco informacion del programa, le pareciÃ³ muy bueno y es asÃ­ como hoy es parte del crÃ©dito que otorga fundaciÃ³n realidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dolores L. H. lives in Tecpatan, Chiapas, MÃ©xico. Sheâ€™s married and has three children in her care. They are: Tania Guadalupe, 12, Gloria Melisa, 4, and the youngest, JesÃºs Abey, 3.

She saves everything she earns daily because her inspiration is to become a Sales Manager for the type of merchandise she sells and thus get ahead with her family.
Her greatest dream is to become a Sales Executive in time and set up her own business of which she can be proud because sheâ€™s had good results to date.
To request the loan she sought information about the programs. She thought it was very good and thatâ€™s how today sheâ€™s part of the loan FundaciÃ³n Realidad grants.

loan.name: Wendy Yamileth

texts.es: Wendy de profesiÃ³n enfermera, habita en casa de sus padres en donde ha venido haciendo su propio cuarto para lograr tener mejor privacidad. Hoy en dÃ­a labora en un hospital desde hace seis aÃ±o estÃ¡ ejerciendo su oficio. Y con financiamiento de la instituciÃ³n ha logrado en su amplitud la construcciÃ³n de su cuarto aparte. En donde con este nuevo crÃ©dito lo harÃ¡ un poco mÃ¡s grande en donde comprara materiales de construcciÃ³n para comenzar la obra. Contenta porque se ha hecho posible mediante estos cinco ciclos de prÃ©stamos la mejora de su casa ya que ante era toda de madera y los cincos ciclos han sido solo para infraestructura
texts.en:
Wendy, a nurse, lives at her parents' house, where she has had a separate apartment built in order to have more privacy. She works at a hospital and has been a nurse for six years.
With funding from AFODENIC she has managed to build her separate apartment. She will use this new loan to buy additional building materials and start the necessary works to extend it.
She is happy because with the five cycles of loans she has managed to improve the infrastructure of her home, which used to be all wood.

loan.use: Buy building materials to extend her apartment.

loan.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora Marcelina U. M., vive en Tecpatan Estado de Chiapas MÃ©xico, es madre soltera en donde tuvo dos hijos quienes ya estÃ¡n casados, con ella viven dos nietos que estÃ¡n estudiando y que son hijos de la seÃ±ora Marbella.
Ella solicito el prÃ©stamo para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes para elaboraciÃ³n de tamales que viene practicando desde hace tiempo y cometa que hasta el momento le va muy bien con este pequeÃ±o trabajo.
En esta actividad se inspiro ya que para sacar adelante a sus hijos tenÃ­a que tener en donde de dicar su tiempo y tener de donde provenir sus ingresos para cubrir sus pequeÃ±os gastos generados en su hogar.
Con la ganancia que va obteniendo comprar mÃ¡s ingredientes que se le terminan cuando helos elabora al mayoreo y le agotan, de eso mismo obtiene para ser puntal en sus pagos que se dan en el prÃ©stamo.
Su sueÃ±o es que logre comprar materiales para mandar a repellar su casa, como tambiÃ©n seguir trabando hasta que dios le preste vida y con ellos salir adelante en estos tiempos.
texts.en:
SeÃ±ora Marcelina U. M. lives in Tecpatan in the state of Chiapas, Mexico. She is a single mother with two children that are married. She has two school-age grandchildren that live with her and are the children of SeÃ±ora Marbella.
She is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients to make tamales. She has been making tamales for some time now and says that so far things are going well. She was drawn to this activity because, in order to help her children get ahead, she needed to find a way to use her time to earn the income needed to pay her minor household expenses.. With the earnings she obtains she will buy more ingredients because she runs out when she makes large quantities of tamales. She will also use her earnings to make her loan payments on time.
Her dream is to be able to buy materials to plaster her house as well as to also continue working for as long as God grants her life and to get ahead in these times.

loan.use: To purchase ingredients to make tamales

loan.name: Marbella

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora Marbella RodrÃ­guez U., vive en Tecpatan Estado de Chiapas MÃ©xico, es casada con el seÃ±or Edin Morales GutiÃ©rrez, en el cual procreo cuatro hijos una mujer y tres varones y son: Marbella de dieciocho aÃ±os, el segundo es Luis Antonio de trece aÃ±os, el otro es Amilsi de siete y el mÃ¡s pequeÃ±o es Edin de dos aÃ±os y medio.
Se dedica a su tienda de abarrotes con el cual acaba de iniciar hace unos meses, comenta que le va bien, pues de ahÃ­ obtiene para sus ingresos de su hogar y tambien para la educaciÃ³n de sus hijos que estudian.
En esta actividad inicio por si sola ya que en el barrio donde ella vive las tiendas estÃ¡n retiradas y se les dificulta ir a comprar sus cosas hasta el centro y mejor decidiÃ³ poner su propia tienda donde sus vecinos tambien le con suman.
Con la ganancia que va obteniendo, de su venta lo invierte comprando mÃ¡s mercancÃ­a, asÃ­ surtir de nuevo su tienda y obtenga mejores ventas e ingresos en su hogar, pues cuado menos tenga para sostenerse con su familia que para ella es muy importante.
Su sueÃ±o mÃ¡s grande es lograr que su negocio aumente y de ello trabajar para obtener dinero del cual pueda ahorrar y apoyar a sus hijos que estÃ¡n estudiando y con eso tenga para terminar una profesiÃ³n.
texts.en:
SeÃ±ora Marbella RodrÃ­guez U. lives in Tecpatan, in the state of Chiapas, Mexico. She is married to seÃ±or Edin Morales GutiÃ©rrez with whom she has four children, one girl and three boys: Marbella (18), Luis Antonio (13), Amilsi (7), and the youngest Edin (2Â½). Marbella runs a grocery store which she opened just a few months ago. She says that all is going well, and she is earning money to pay for household expenses and her childrenâ€™s education.
In the neighbourhood where Marbella lives, the only shops are a distance away so she has to go into the town centre to do her shopping. For this reason she decided it was a good idea to open her own store where her neighbours can also do their shopping.
With the loan she plans to buy more stock for her store so that she can sell more, earn more, and provide for her family--something that is very important to her. Marbellaâ€™s greatest dream is to see the store do well so that she can save money and support her children while they are students. Then they will be able to get good jobs.

loan.use: to buy more stock such as sugar, beans, oil, cookies

loan.name: Orlando Adan

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal â€œNUEVO AMANECER DE URUBAMBAâ€; Este banco estÃ¡ ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr: Orlando; El socio tiene 44 aÃ±os de edad, el socio es conviviente; el socio tiene 3 hijos; el socio trabaja prestando servicio de moto taxi, el socio tiene un vehÃ­culo de servicio pÃºblico el socio maneja la moto taxi diario y todo lo que ahorra le sirve para culminar de construir su casa, el socio ahora requiere le prÃ©stamo para comprar algunos muebles para el hogar, el comprara un mueble para colocar el televisor, la radio y ubicarlo en su sala comedor, el socio trabaja mucho y ahora se encuentra en descanso reunido con su grupo para hacer su requerimiento, el nos manifiesta que con lo que siga generando su trabajo con la moto taxi el pagara sus cuotas y con el resto seguirÃ¡ implementando sus habitaciones. El socio solicita el prÃ©stamo para comprar un mueble para la sala comedor.
El socio estÃ¡ feliz con el prÃ©stamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sr. Orlando is a member of the Nuevo Amanecer Community Bank of Urubamba located in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco. He is 44 years old, married, and has three children. He earns his living driving a motor taxi. Everything he saves goes towards finishing his house.
Now Orlando needs a loan to buy furniture. He plans to buy a stand for the television and radio and put it in the dining room. He is a hard worker currently on his day off. He tells us that he continues to get work through the taxi business and that he will pay back the money he borrows. With part of the money he also plans to furnish other rooms.
Orlando is pleased to be able to obtain a loan and promises to pay it back according to the schedule.

loan.use: to buy furniture

loan.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es: Oscar Danilo es un hombre muy trabajador, casado, como meta ha sido la construcciÃ³n de su casa. Ya que cuenta con una familia y quiere tener lo propio, ya que donde vive es donde sus padres. Hoy en dÃ­a esta laborando en mantenimiento en una bodega de una empresa privada. Y ha tenido varios trabajos. Tiene ya el comienzo bastante avanzada su pequeÃ±a casa en donde lo estÃ¡ logrando con financiamiento de Afodenic. Ya son cinco ciclos y todos con el mismo propÃ³sito, como sus entradas de ingresos tienen que equilibrar todos los gastos va poco a poco haciÃ©ndola. En donde con esta nueva solicitud comprara materiales de construcciÃ³n como mÃ¡s piedra, cemento, bloques y seguir levantando las paredes.
texts.en:
Oscar Danilo is a hardworking man. He is married and his goal is to build his own home, because he has a family and is currently living with his parents. He works doing maintenance work in a store owned by a private company and has had different jobs prior to that.
He has managed to get started with the house thanks to financing from Afodenic. He has already completed five cycles, all of them with the same purpose. He balances out the revenue obtained with his expenses, building the house bit by bit. With this new loan he will buy more building materials, such as stone, concrete and blocks, to continue to build the walls.

loan.use: Buy construction materials such as stone, concrete and blocks in order to continue to build the walls of his house.

She sells her bread at $0.08 each, a liter of milk at $0.80 and a whole cheese at $2.80. Although she works alone, she would like to continue in her business to support her four children aged 11, 9, 5 and 4.
Rosa will use her loan to buy flour and an oven so that she can bake more bread and sweet treats so that she can attract more customers. In the future, she would like to expand her business and have more customers.

texts.es: Carmen tiene 36 aÃ±os, vive en su casa propia con su esposo, y tiene 3 hijos, los cuales estÃ¡n estudiando en el colegio. Carmen, tiene un puesto ambulatorio donde vende ropa usada y entre otros accesorios de uso. Para proveerse de mercaderÃ­as, todos los dÃ­as muy temprano por la maÃ±ana acude a un mercado informal, es donde adquiere los productos que necesita. Luego organiza su negocio con mucha prisa, donde sus clientes la esperan. De esa manera viene trabajando por mÃ¡s de 10 aÃ±os, y seÃ±ala sentirse muy contenta por las utilidades que le genera. Su sueÃ±o, es alquilar un puesto en el mercado, para evitar ser reubicado constantemente. Es su sÃ©ptimo crÃ©dito con MFP, sabe que este dinero le serÃ¡ muy Ãºtil, por ello se compromete pagar puntualmente las cuotas de cada mes, para acceder posteriores ayudas. Con el crÃ©dito que solicita, incrementarÃ¡ mÃ¡s mercaderÃ­as y tambiÃ©n invertirÃ¡ en la compra de lencerÃ­as femeninas, para las fiestas de fin de aÃ±o.

Carmen has a mobile street kiosk where she sells used clothing and accessories. In order to obtain her merchandise, every day very early in the morning she goes to an informal market where she gets the items she needs. Then she quickly organizes her business where her customers await her. She has been doing this work for more than 10 years, and says she is happy to be useful. Her dream is to rent a stall in the market, and not have to constantly relocate. This is her seventh loan with MFP, and she knows that this money will be very useful. She promises to make her monthly payments on time, so as to be eligible for future help. With the loan she is seeking, she will increase her merchandise and also purchase feminine lingerie to sell for the new year's parties.

Marina; ella tiene 58 aÃ±os de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con negocio de tienda de abarrotes y tambiÃ©n se dedica a la agricultura, la socia siembra verduras como papa, maÃ­z y habas y tambiÃ©n siembra frutas como platano, naranjas, uvas y manzanas, la socia las frutas y verduras lo vende en forma ambulatoria, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de verduras y frutas. texts.en:
Marina is a member of the "LOS ANDENES" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.
Marina is 58 years old, married and has two children. She divides her time between her daily activities and her grocery store business. She also works as a farmer. She grows vegetables such as potatoes, corn and beans. She also grows fruit such as bananas, oranges, grapes and apples. She sells her fruit and vegetables as an itinerant street vendor. She would like to expand her fruit and vegetables business.
Marina is requesting her loan to buy fruit and vegetables wholesale. She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loan.use: To buy fruit and vegetables wholesale

La socia estÃ¡ feliz con el prÃ©stamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Adelma is a member of the "MINKA" community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province and department.
Adelma is 46 years old. She is a widow and has 3 children. Her business is running her laundromat. She owns a small laundromat and works serving her customers and delivering her garments. She is requesting this loan to keep her laundromat running and to buy some detergents and clotheslines wholesale. She is requesting this loan to keep her laundromat running. She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loan.use: To keep her laundromat running

loan.name: Anonymous

Urubamba, distrito D. Yucay, la socia quiere tener un puesto para vender la carne. La socia solicita el prÃ©stamo para comprar carne al por mayor.

texts.en:
Ricardina is a member of the "LOS ANDENES" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.
Ricardina is 74 years old, married and has 6 children. She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling meat. She also has a grocery store. Ricardina sells meat as an itinerant street vendor in Urubamba market, in Yucay district. Ricardina would like to have a sales location from which she could sell her meat. She is requesting this loan to buy meat wholesale. She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

El socio solicita el prÃ©stamo para comprar libros para enseÃ±ar y para invertir en turismo.
El socio estÃ¡ feliz por el prÃ©stamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Eyner Edgar is a member of the "LOS ANDENES" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.
Eyner Edgar is 36 years old. He lives with his partner and has 2 children. He divides his time between his daily activities and his work as a teacher. He also works in tourism. He teaches children, giving private lessons. He would like to own a travel agency.
Eyner Edgar is requesting this loan to buy books to teach his students and also to invest in tourism. He is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loan.use: To buy books for teaching and to invest in tourism

Eveling; ella tiene 29 aÃ±os de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azÃºcar, leche y fideos, la socia atiende desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio la scoia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. texts.en:
The associate belongs to "Los Andenes" communal bank, which is located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of Cusco.
Her name is Eveling, and she is 29 years old, with a live-in partner and 2 children. She combines her daily activities with running a grocery store, selling basic necessities such as rice, sugar, milk and noodles. The associate tends the store from 5:00 a.m until 6:00 p.m and by means of this business she is able to provide for her children. She wants to expand the grocery store, and requests this loan in order to purchase wholesale products for her store.
The associate is grateful for this loan and promises to comply with the terms of payment.

loan.use: Purchase wholesale products for her grocery store.

She is Sra. Maria Natividad. She is 42 years old, and she lives with her partner and has 3 children. She alternates her daily activities with her business, which is selling vegetables and small animals. She sells in various fairs in the province of Urubamba, in the Yucay district. She wants to improve her business, and she is applying for the loan to buy vegetables and animals such as rabbits and chickens.
She is happy for the loan and promises to make her payments.

loan.use: Buy vegetables and animals such as rabbits and chickens to sell.

texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank â€œLos Andenesâ€ which is located in the District of Cuzco, in the Province and Department of Cuzco.
The memberâ€™s name is Juana; she is 42 years old and is married with one son. The member alternates her daily business activities between her grocery store in the Province of Urubamba and the District of Yucay. She attends to her store from 5:00 a.m. to 11:00 p.m. The member wants to expand and improve her grocery store. The member requests a loan to purchase products such as rice, sugar, milk, and noodles for her grocery store.
The member is happy to receive this loan, and commits to making her loan payments.

loan.name: Mario Fernando

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal â€œSAN VALENTINâ€; El banco estÃ¡ ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Mario Fernando; el tiene 45 aÃ±os de edad y es soltero; el socio se dedica a la compra y venta de carne para luego distribuirlo a sus clientes del mercado de San Pedro del Cusco este se encuentra ubicado en el centro de la cuidad, a la vez el socio trabaja brindado el servicio de taxi tanto por las noches y por los dÃ­as y de esta forma el socio saca a su familia adelante.
El socio solicita el prÃ©stamo para la compra de mas insumos para su negocio.
El socio estÃ¡ feliz por el prÃ©stamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Mario Fernando is a member of the "SAN VALENTIN" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.
Mario Fernando is 45 years old and single. His business is buying and selling meat which he distributes to his customers in San Pedro del Cusco Market, located in the city center. He also provides a taxi service during the evenings and during the days. This is how he gets his family ahead in life.
Mario Fernando is requesting this loan to buy more supplies for his business. He is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loan.use: To buy more supplies for his business

La socia pertenece al banco comunal â€œLOS ANDENESâ€; El banco estÃ¡ ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco. La socia es la Sra. Doris Emilia; ella tiene 42 aÃ±os de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con negocio de venta de artesanÃ­a, ella vende en forma ambulatoria e independiente en las calles de la ciudad de Urubamba, ella vende diferentes artesanÃ­as como chompas, collares, aretes y mantas, la socia quiere tener una tienda de artesanÃ­a. La socia solicita el prÃ©stamo para comprar artesanÃ­a al por mayor.
La socia estÃ¡ feliz por el prÃ©stamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank â€œLos Andenesâ€ which is located in the District of Cuzco, in the Province and Department of Cuzco.
The memberâ€™s name is Doris Emilia; she is 42 years old and is married with 2 children. The member works selling handicrafts as an independent street vendor in the streets of the City of Urubamba; she sells various handcrafts such as sweaters, necklaces, earrings, and blankets. The member would like to open a handicraft store.
The member requests this loan to purchase wholesale handicrafts.
The member is happy to receive this loan, and commits to making her loan payments.

loan.use: The member requests this loan to purchase wholesale handicrafts.

loan.name: Yovana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunalâ€ SAN VALENTINâ€; El banco estÃ¡ ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Yovana; ella tiene 31 aÃ±os de edad, soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia se dedica al negocio de picanterÃ­a lugar donde venden comida tÃ­pica tambiÃ©n venden chicha hecha a base de maÃ­z, tambiÃ©n vende cerveza, siendo esta la Ãºnica actividad que realiza por el momento la socia es una persona muy alegre y con ganas de seguir adelante.
La socia solicita el prÃ©stamo para la compra de insumos como carne,arroz,azÃºcar entre otros mas para su negocio.
La socia estÃ¡ feliz por el prÃ©stamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the village bank "San Valentin". The bank is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.
Yovana is 31 years old, single, and has two children. She has a food stall where she sells typical foods as well as chicha, a fermented corn-based beverage. They also sell beer. This is the only business that she currently operates. Yovana is a very happy person and wants to get ahead.
She requests a loan to buy ingredients such as meat, rice, sugar and other things for her business.
She is very happy because of the loan and promises to make the payments on time.

loan.use: To buy ingredients such as meat, rice, sugar and other things for her business

loan.name: Charles Victor

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal â€œLOS ANDENESâ€; El banco estÃ¡ ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Charles Victor; el tiene 34 aÃ±os de edad y es soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, el se dedica al transporte de turismo tiene una combi que hace servicio a turistas a las diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cusco, el trabaja en forma independiente, el socio quiere mejorar el servicio que presta a los turistas. El socio solicita el prÃ©stamo para el mantenimiento de su carro.
El socio estÃ¡ feliz por el prÃ©stamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank â€œLos Andenesâ€ which is located in the District of Cuzco, in the Province and Department of Cuzco.
The memberâ€™s name is Charles Victor; he is 34 years old and single. The member works in transport, dedicating himself to tourism transport; he has a combi van which he uses to provide service to tourists headed to different places in the city of Cuzco. He works independently and wants to improve the service he provides tourists.
The member requests this loan for the maintenance of his vehicle.
The member is happy to receive this loan, and commits to making her loan payments.

loan.use: The member requests this loan for the maintenance of his vehicle.

loan.name: Angel Leocadio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal â€œLOS ANDENESâ€; El banco estÃ¡ ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Angel Leocadio; el tiene 55 aÃ±os de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de repuestos de carros y tambiÃ©n se dedica a la crianza de cuyes, el socio atiende el negocio de venta de repuestos carros desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, el socio quiere mejorar el negocio de venta de repuestos de carros. El socio solicita el prÃ©stamo para comprar repuestos de carros.
El socio estÃ¡ feliz por el prÃ©stamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member is part of the village bank "Los Andenes", which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.
Mr. Angel Leocadio is 55 years old and married with two children. He alternates his daily activities between his business selling replacement car parts and raising guinea pigs. He works at the car parts business from 9am until 6pm. He wants to improve his business and is asking for a loan to buy car parts.
He is very happy about the loan and promises to make his payments on time.

loan.use: To buy car repair parts

loan.name: Nicolas

texts.es: NicolÃ¡s vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos en el distrito de San SebastiÃ¡n. El distrito de San SebastiÃ¡n se encuentra ubicada en la provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco, localizÃ¡ndose a 10 km. de la plaza de armas de la capital arqueolÃ³gica de AmÃ©rica del Sur. Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos de los Incas, la ciudad del Cusco estÃ¡ construida en la base de la antigua ciudad Inca. NicolÃ¡s se dedica a brindar servicios de transportes en su propio taxi y trabaja en el cercado del Cusco. Hace varios aÃ±os que se dedica a brindar servicios y le va regular. NicolÃ¡s y su esposa tienen un pequeÃ±o negocio de venta de golosinas de forma ambulatorio, ellos llevan sus productos en una carreta y se instalan en la calle y venden a todos los transeÃºntes que pasan por esa calle. Con su prÃ³ximo prÃ©stamo, NicolÃ¡s que espera recibir S/. 2300 nuevos soles. Por el momento desea incrementar el capital del negocio y va comprar mercaderÃ­a como por ejemplo, dulces, galletas, gaseosas, tortas y muchos productos mÃ¡s. NicolÃ¡s pertenece al banco comunal â€œNueva Esperanzaâ€ de la AsociaciÃ³n Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el segundo aÃ±o de funcionamiento y les va muy bien.
texts.en:
NicolÃ¡s lives with his wife and three children in the District of San SebastiÃ¡n, which is part of the Province and Department of Cusco and located 10km from the town square. It is also the archaeological capital of South America. Cusco is an enchanting city that dates back to the time of the Incas. The city of Cusco is built at the base of an ancient Incan village.

NicolÃ¡s provides transportation services with his own taxi and works along the outskirts of Cusco. He has been providing transportation services for many years and works on a regular basis. NicolÃ¡s and his wife also have a small business selling sweets as street vendors. They haul their products in a cart, park it on the street, and sell to everyone who passes through their location. With this next loan NicolÃ¡s will receive 2300 PEN. At the moment, he wants to increase his business capital and purchase merchandise such as candy, cookies, sodas, cakes, and other products. NicolÃ¡s belongs to the â€œNueva Esperanzaâ€ (New Hope) Communal Bank that is part of AsociaciÃ³n Arariwa. The Communal Bank is in its second year of operation and is doing very well.

loan.use: Purchase candy, cookies, sodas, cakes, and other products to sell

loan.name: Baatarsuren

texts.en: Baatarsuren B. is 21 years old and lives with his parents in Hovd province in central Mongolia. They live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His mother is a teacher in the local school and his father operates a clothes trading business at the local market. Baatarsuren operates an Internet cafÃ© in his town. He started his business in 2009 after building his own workplace next to the local market, a popular spot where he attracts many customers. He has established himself in the local business community and has a steady operation. For the future, he hopes to expand his business by selling a variety of cellphone parts. Baatarsuren is a talkative and open-minded person. He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase cellphone parts and tools for his business.

loan.use: to purchase cellphone parts and tools

loan.name: Erdenebileg

texts.en: Erdenebileg B. is 41 years old and lives with his wife and three daughters in the Hovd province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest daughter attends university while the two youngest ones attend a local high school. His wife operates a clothing retail business while Erdenebileg drives a taxi in the local community. At first, he began his own business in 1998 by operating a clothes trading business. After many years of operation, he was able to start operating a taxi service to supplement his earnings. His wife is now responsible for the clothes retail business. For the future, he plans to expand his business and buy one more shipping container so they can sell a variety of clothing items. Erdenebileg is requesting a 3,200,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more winter clothes and to start providing a car repair service.

loan.use: to purchase more winter clothes and to start providing a car repair service

loan.name: Batdolgor

texts.en: Batdolgor N. is 38 years old single mother and lives with her father and child in an small apartment in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia. Her son attends a high school. Batdolgor operates a small grocery trading business in the city. She started her grocery shop in 2008, and has built a stable operation over the years. Her business' earnings have created financial stablilty for her family. Batdolgor hopes to expand her shop into more bigger grocery shop in the future. She has a car leasing loan which is still paid of her loan. Currently she is planning to pay off her all loan and obtain an apartment leasing loan in the future. She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase grocery products to sell at her shop in order to increase her working capital.

loan.use: To purchase grocery products to sell

loan.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en: Uranchimeg D. is 51 years old and lives with her husband in Hovd province, Mongolia. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. All of their children live on their own. Uranchimeg's husband is retired and works as a guard for a local company, earning a monthly salary of 150,000 MNT. Uranchimeg operates a fuel trading business in her town. She collects dry droppings of cattle (for fuel) from the rural areas and sells those droppings at the local market once a week. Uranchimeg is a talkative and hardworking person. She needs more funds to rent a car in order to transport her products to the local market. She is requesting a 300,000 MNT loan to rent a car for her business.

loan.use: to rent a car for her business

loan.name: Enhzaya

texts.en: Enhzaya M. is 37 years old and lives with his wife and three children in their own house in Bayanhoshuu, in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His oldest two daughters attend a local secondary school and his wife helps him with the business. Enhzaya owns and operates his own wooden products business, specializing in ger parts, ger furniture, and other larger furniture pieces. He started his business in 2008, having worked as a carpenter since 2001. All of his products are made with great care and attention to detail, which has earned him a reputation among his customers as a quality furniture provider. After years of successful operation, he was able to have his own workplace in his enclosure. For the future, he plans to open a workplace in Grand Plaza, where he can attract a larger customer base. He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more wood when prices for such items are cheap.

loan.use: to purchase more wood

loan.name: Gantsetseg

texts.en: Gantsetseg B. is 31 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent, in the Yaarmag of Han-Uul district of UlaanB., the capital city of Mongolia. Her two sons both attend a local secondary school and her husband works as a driver for the "Auto Speed Company". Gantsetseg is self-employed, making a variety of knitted and woven products in her home. She started her business in 2001 with working capital of 100,000 MNT and has built a stable operation. At first, she started her business with only one sewing machine. After many years of hard work, she managed to expand her business and today her working capital exceeds 2,500,000 MNT with 4 sewing machines. For the future, she plans to establish her own knitted clothing factory. She also needs to hire 3 workers for her 3 sewing machines. Gantsetseg is a hardworking and modest person. She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more fabrics, wool yarns and a knitting machine for producing her woolen clothes.

loan.use: to purchase more fabrics, wool yarns and a knitting machine

loan.name: Chuluundolgor

texts.en:
Chuluundolgor G. is 45 years old and lives with her husband and five children in Hovd province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent and enclosure. One of her children is a university student, three children attend a local secondary school and the oldest works as a salesperson in a grocery shop with a monthly salary of 120,000 MNT. Chuluundolgor's husband is a crane mechanist and during summer months their family income has increased greatly.

Chuluundolgor operates a firewood sales business next to her home in her town. She started her business in 2006 selling her products at the local coal and firewood trading market. Her main customers are the neighboring households and she has gained a wide customer base. After years in business, she has built a stable operation. For the future, she hopes to operate a livestock and meat trading business. Chuluundolgor is a talkative and open-minded person. She is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to purchase more wood and coal for her business.

loan.use: to purchase more wood and coal

loan.name: Ty

texts.en:
Mr. Ty P. (pictured) and his wife, Mrs. Ny Son, live in a small village in the suburbs of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 2001 and Ny just got pregnant.
Mr. Ty P. is a motor taxi driver and assists his wife in their joint business when he is free. The couple has supplemented their income with a new business of raising chickens. They are now requesting another loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase additional chickens to raise.

loan.use: to buy chickens to raise

loan.name: Jargaltuya

texts.en:
Jargaltuya L., 31, lives with her husband and two children in a house in the Han-Uul district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family lives together in a house with a fence.
Jargaltuya operates her own clothing business. She makes a variety of deels, which are traditional Mongolian coats. She started her sewing business in 2007 with only one sewing machine. Her business has been so successful that it has allowed her to hire a worker. Currently, she owns two sewing machines. She is a modest and hardworking person and is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more fabric and material to make a variety of traditional clothes for the upcoming Mongolian New Year holiday.

loan.use: to purchase more fabrics and materials

loan.name: Chanthoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthoeun P. (pictured) has been a silkweaver for over 10 years. She is a widow with one son. She lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Her son is a construction worker and farmer.
Chanthoeun hopes to continue her weaving business because it is a traditional profession and she does not want to transition into another business. She is requesting another loan of $1,000 to purchase weaving materials. A portion of her loan will be used to provide capital for her son to continue his farming business.

loan.use: to purchase silk materials for her weaving business and to provide capital for her son's farming business

loan.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophy K. and her husband, Mr. Sok Men, both 41 years old, live in a suburb about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have five children - two sons and three daughters. One is married and lives outside the family home, three have full-time employment and the youngest attends school.
Mrs. Sophy K. has been operating a tailoring business at home for four years. Her husband is a construction worker. She is asking for her first loan of $1000 to buy a motorcycle for commuting.

loan.use: to buy a motorcycle for commuting

loan.name: Nurjan

texts.en: Nurjan H. is 38 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent and enclosure. His daughter attends a local secondary school while his wife works as a teacher for the school. Nurjan operates a raw materials trading business, using his own car, buying raw materials locally and selling them in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, for a profit. He started his business in 2001 with working capital of 1,000,000 MNT which soon grew to 9,000,000 MNT. He has gained a lot of experience and knowledge over the years and he hopes to use this experience and knowledge to keep his business growing. Nurjan is a hardworking and modest person and is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more raw materials to sell in Ulaanbaatar.

loan.use: to purchase more raw materials

loan.name: Norn

texts.en: Mrs. Norn C., 44 years old, and her husband, Mr. Mean Miech, 46 years old, have 8 children - 5 sons and 3 daughters. The family lives along National Road Number Five, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Norn and her husband are rice farmers. They also operate a fishing business when they are not at the farm. Norn is asking for her first loan of $700 to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide and to buy a water pumping machine for her rice farm.

loan.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide and to buy a water pumping machine

loan.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en:
Otgonbayar D. is 27 years old and lives with his parents in the Hovd province of Mongolia. He and his parents live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.
After saving money from his current job as a plumber, Otgonbayar purchased a car which enabled him to start his own transportation business in 2009 to supplement his earnings. For the future, he plans to build a house on his fenced lot.
Otgonbayar is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase machinery parts for his car.

loan.use: To purchase machinery parts

loan.name: Santos Melania

texts.es:
Santos es una madre de familia de 49 aÃ±os de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a un hijo en el caserÃ­o Collique, una zona agrÃ­cola que estÃ¡ habitada por gente humilde y bastante trabajadora. Pertenece al distrito de ZaÃ±a y se encuentra ubicada a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
Se dedica desde hace diez aÃ±os a trabajar en labores agrÃ­colas junto a su esposo. Ella cuenta con un pequeÃ±o de cultivo en donde suele sembrar maÃ­z. Ambos trabajan unidos para mantener este cultivo y poder salir adelante. Sus cosechas las comercializa en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Chiclayo y depende de los ingresos que obtiene para sacar adelante la economÃ­a de su familia.
Santos desea adquirir materiales de abono para poder brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo y de ese modo pueda asegurarse una buena cosecha. Por ello ha creÃ­do conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crÃ©dito de 1500 nuevos soles con los cuales espera lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Santos is a 49 year old mother who lives with her husband and one son in the village of Collique, an agricultural area that is inhabited by modest hardworking people. This community is part of the District of ZaÃ±a and located M. than an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

Santos and her husband have been farming together for ten years. She has a small plot of land where she grows corn. They both work together to maintain this crop so that they can move forward. Her harvest is sold at the wholesale market of the city of Chiclayo and she depends on her earnings so that she can stay ahead with her familyâ€™s finances.

Santos wants to acquire fertilizing supplies so that she can maintain her crop and secure a good harvest. For this reason she is requesting a loan of 1500 PEN from Edypme Alternativa so that she can achieve her goal.

loan.use: Purchase fertilizing supplies to maintain her crop of corn

loan.name: Amando

texts.en:
Amando P. is from the village of Victoria San Mateo. He is 52 years old. Amando is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Amando owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Amando has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 30000 PHP per harvest.
In 2010, Amando joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amando is requesting a loan of 27000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Amando from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.
About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: To buy seeds, seedlings & young crops

loan.name: Bazarhan

texts.en:
Bazarhan T. is 40 years old. He lives with his wife and three children in Hovd province in Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, on a fenced lot. His three children all attend a local secondary school. His wife operates a vegetable growing business in her town.
Bazarhan operates a transportation business in town using his own mini truck. He started this transportation service in 2008. He has had much success and has earned significant experience as a driver. In addition, he operates meat trading business during the autum months to supplement his earnings. He purchases livestock from herders and slaughter them to sell the meat at the local market.
For the future, Bazarhan hopes to continue making progress with his business. He says, "I do everything that can earn money." He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more livestock to sell.

loan.use: To purchase more livestock to sell

loan.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel has been in the farming business for thirty-five years. He has a mixed farm in Kisii town in western Kenya that produces milk, maize, bananas, tomatoes and sugarcane, all of which are sold locally. He is also employed as a civil servant and serves as an assistant chief in his town.
He has requested a loan of 45,000KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that this loan will help him acquire a quality dairy cow that will increase his milk production. His family will therefore be assured of enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The extra income from this investment will help pay school fees for his children.
His biggest challenges have been diseases and lack of market for his products. He would like to open a big retail shop in future.
Daniel is 49 years old and married with 4 school-aged children who all attend school.

loan.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loan.name: Yumdermaa

texts.en:
Yumdermaa R. is a 47-year-old single mother who lives with her 6 children in Hovd province in Mongolia. She and her children live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent, on a fenced lot. Her oldest son works for a security company in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her next oldest sons are university students and her youngest two children attend a local secondary school.
Yumdermaa operates a small cafe in her town. She started her own business in 2006 by operating a flour trading business. After years of operation, she has managed to establish a stable cafe business in her local community. Her earnings have enabled her not only to pay her children's tuition fees but aslo provide for her entire family.
For the future, she hopes to continue operating her business at a stable level so that she can afford to build a house on her fenced lot, and save more money for her children's future education. She requesting a 1,400,000 MNT loan to purchase and preserve a large amount of materials and supplies for her cafe in order to make a variety of meals.

loan.use: To purchase materials and supplies

loan.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira tiene 53 aÃ±os de edad, es soltera y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de PaijÃ¡n, una zona comercial que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Ascope, regiÃ³n La Libertad. La localidad se encuentra situada a mÃ¡s de dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la regiÃ³n Lambayeque.
Se dedica a la comercializaciÃ³n de pan y diversos productos en un puesto ambulante situado en una de las esquinas de la localidad en donde reside. Ella trabaja ofreciendo su mercaderÃ­a generalmente por las tardes y siempre atiende a sus clientes con un buen trato. El negocio le sirve para ayudar a su familia a salir adelante.
Elvira desea aumentar su capital de trabajo para adquirir mas pan y asÃ­ poder satisfacer la demanda con la que cuenta. Por ello ha creÃ­do conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crÃ©dito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Elvira is 53 years old, single, and lives with her family in the District of PaijÃ¡n, a commercial area that is located in Ascope Province in the region of La Libertad. This community is located more than two and a half hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Elvira sells bread and different products from a mobile stand situated on a street corner in the town where she lives. She usually sells her merchandise in the afternoons and always provides good service to her customers. This business helps her family get ahead.

Elvira wants to increase her operating capital so that she can acquire more bread and satisfy the current demand. For this reason she is requesting a loan of 500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to help achieve her goal.

loan.use: Purchase more bread to sell

loan.name: Asunciona

texts.es:
Asunciona tiene 31 aÃ±os de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en uno de los caserÃ­os que conforman el distrito de Lambayeque, una zona agrÃ­cola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
Se dedica a la preparaciÃ³n y venta de alimentos en su domicilio. Ella prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas para comercializarlos entre sus vecinos y trabajadores de la zona. El negocio ya cuenta con tres aÃ±os de funcionamiento y durante este tiempo ha podido obtener una clientela fiel que prefiere sus buena sazÃ³n y buen trato. Los ingresos que percibe de este negocio son una fuente importante de ingreso para la economÃ­a de su familia.
Asunciona desde adquirir insumos para ampliar su negocio y poder aumentar sus ventas, su demanda ha estado aumentando y ello hace que tenga que esforzarse mÃ¡s para satisfacerla. Por ello ha creÃ­do conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crÃ©dito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su meta.
texts.en:
Asunciona is 31 years old, married and lives with her husband and three children in one of the villages that make up Lambayeque district, an agricultural area with quite a lot of commercial activity which is located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.
Asunciona's business is preparing and selling food in her home. She prepares breakfasts, lunches and dinners to sell to her neighbors and workers in the area. She has been running her business for three years and, during this time, she has been able to attract a loyal customer base who prefer her business for the good flavor of her food and her good customer service. The profits that she makes from this business are an important source of income for her family's finances.
Asunciona would like to acquire supplies so that she can expand her business and increase her sales. Her demand has been increasing and this means that she has to work even harder to meet it. For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which will help her to achieve her goal.

loan.use: To acquire supplies to expand her business and increase her sales

loan.name: Alfredy

texts.en:
Alfredy has been practicing mixed farming for the last eighteen years. He employs 6 farmhands. He has a mixed farm in Kisii town in western Kenya that produces tea, milk, maize and beans. These are sold both locally and through the Kenya Tea Development Authority. He also owns a posho mill in the same area.
Alfredy is 34 years old. He is married and has 7 children between the ages of 2 and 16. Six of the children attend school.
Alfredy has requested this loan for 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that with this investment, his milk production will increase and he will earn more income.
In this business, he faces the challenges of diseases, bad debtors and lack of proper market for his products. In five years' time, he plans to acquire more land and expand his farming from small-scale to large-scale.

loan.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loan.name: Tolobubu's Group

texts.en:
Tolobubu J. is the treasurer of this group. She is a resident of Bokonbaevo, a nice village in Isykul region. Tolobubu, 50, is married to a security guard. She receives a monthly salary in the amount of 2000 soms.
A year ago with the initial investment of 15000 soms, Tolobubu started breeding livestock. She makes money by reselling the animals at a higher price after fattening them. In this manner, she earns 2000 soms per month. With the money received from the loan, she wants to purchase four livestock animals for breeding. In the future, Tolobubu wants to improve the familyâ€™s living conditions.
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line â€“ People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan â€“ Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loan.use: To purchase livestock

loan.name: Cheam

texts.en:
The man shown in this picture is Mr. Cheam S.. He is 40 years old. He is a worker responsible for the provision of clean water in the city of Phnom Penh. He has been working in this job since 1996 and earns approximately $2.50 a day. His wifeâ€™s name is Kunthea. She is 38 years old and works as a seamstress. The couple is blessed with two children, one is a student in public school, and the other is a garment worker.
Mr. Cheam S. requested a loan of $1000 in order to purchase a piece of land in good condition for a farming business. He will rent out this land to farmers for a fee.

loan.use: To purchase land to rent to farmers

loan.name: Pedro Miguel

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 63 aÃ±os de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito agrÃ­cola de Tambogrande, una zona de clima semitropical que produce principalmente frutas como el mango, maracuyÃ¡ y limÃ³n. Pertenece a la regiÃ³n Piura y se encuentra ubicada a mÃ¡s de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la regiÃ³n Lambayeque.
Se dedica a trabajar en la ganaderÃ­a desde que era joven. El cuenta con vacas, las cuales crÃ­a cerca a su vivienda, las alimenta de pastos naturales y comercializa su carne y su leche entre los vecinos de la zona. TambiÃ©n las vende a los negociantes que suelen visitar el lugar en donde reside. Adicionalmente siembra frutas. Los ingresos que el percibe de estas actividades le sirven para sacar adelante a su familia.
Pedro desea adquirir alimento balanceado para hacer que sus vacas desarrollen de mejor modo y puedan brindarle mejores ganancias. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crÃ©dito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Pedro is 63 years old, married and lives with his wife and children in the agricultural district of Tambogrande, an area with a semi-tropical climate which produces mainly fruit such as mangoes, passion fruit and lemons. It is located in Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.
Pedro has been working in livestock farming since he was young. He has cows that he raises near his home. He feeds them on natural pasture and sells their meat and milk to his neighbors in the area. He also sells them to the traders who usually visit the place where he lives. Pedro also grows fruit. The income that he makes from these activities help him to get his family ahead.
Pedro would like to acquire balanced animal feed so that his cows develop in the best way possible and so that they can provide him with better profits. For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to help him achieve his goal.

loan.use: To buy balanced animal feed to improve his cattle raising

loan.name: Tuya

texts.en:
Tuya T. is 34 years old. She lives with her husband and child in Tuv province in central Mongolia. She and her family live together in a rented apartment. Her child attends a local primary school.
Tuya operates a CD and DVD rental shop in her town with the help of her husband. They bought latest movies and songs from internet and translate those items into Mongolian and sell a variety of movies out of their rented work place. They started their business in 2004 and have built a stable operation. After years of operation, they have managed to improve their equipment and tools. They plan to expand their business by establishing a mini movie theatre with 3D technology in the future.
Tuya is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase the necessary tools and equipment for her future mini cinema.

loan.use: To purchase the necessary tools and equipment

loan.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora N. is a farmer from the town of Nkubu in eastern Kenya. She has been farming for fifteen years. Her main products are maize, beans, bananas, coffee and milk â€“ all of which she sells locally. She depends mainly on the income from her farm to provide for the basic needs of her family.
Flora recently repaid a previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 30,000 KES. She has requested another loan for 30,000 KES, this time to start a poultry project. The income from this investment will help educate her children and improve her family's livelihood.
Her major challenges have been pests and diseases which affect her production, and the lack of proper markets for her products. She intends to improve her farming and open a cereals store in the future.
Flora is 35 years old and is married with 2 children, ages 2 and 8.

loan.use: To start a poultry project

loan.name: Juanota Victoria

texts.es:
Juanita tiene 46 aÃ±os D. edad, es viuda y resiD. junto a sus dos hijos en el distrito agrÃ­cola D. TambogranD., una zona D. clima semitropical que produce principalmente frutas como el mango, maracuyÃ¡ y limÃ³n. Pertenece a la regiÃ³n Piura y se encuentra ubicada a mÃ¡s D. cuatro horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la regiÃ³n Lambayeque.
Su esposo falleciÃ³ en Octubre pasado y ella ha tenido que ingeniÃ¡rselas para poder salir adelante. Se mudÃ³ a una casa mas pequeÃ±a para alquilar la suya y con algunos ahorros pudo instalar una bodega en su nueva casa. Ella da lo mejor D. si para sacar adelante a su familia y diariamente trabaja con tesÃ³n. El negocio estÃ¡ creciendo gracias a sus esfuerzos y actualmente cuenta con clietela fidelizada
Juanita desea adquirir mas productos para poder ampliar su nivel D. ventas y percibir mas ganancias que le permitan seguir saliendo adelante. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crÃ©dito D. 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Juanita is 46 years old, widowed, and lives with her two children in the agricultural district of TambogranD., an area with a semi-tropical climate that mainly produces fruit such as mangoes, passion fruit and lemons. It is located in Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.
Juanita's husband died last October and she has had to apply her ingenuity in order to get ahead. She moved to a smaller house so that she could rent out her own house and, with a few savings, she was able to set up a small grocery store in her new house. Juanita gives the best of herself in order to get her family ahead and she works with determination every day. Her business is growing thanks to her hard work and she currently has a loyal customer base.
Juanita would like to acquire more products so that she can expand her sales levels and make more profits that will allow her to continue getting ahead. For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which will help her to achieve her goal.

loan.use: To acquire more products so that she can expand her sales levels and make more profits

loan.name: Phanice

texts.en:
Phanice is 61 years old and a married mother of seven children who all are adults. Two of her children are currently attending school. She is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya where she has been farming for 12 years. Her mixed farm produces eggs and milk which she sells to the local market. Farming is her main source of income.

She has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo of 50,000KES to expand her poultry farm. The proceeds from this loan will go a long way in the education of her children and grandchildren. She says that epidermic diseases are rampant in the area and this has been her biggest challenge.

She is grateful to Juhudi for supporting her to undertake her project to another level.

loan.use: To expand her poultry project

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To purchase a motorcycle for transporting products

loan.name: Dinara's Group

texts.en:
Dinara K., 31, is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Bokonbaevo, a nice village in Isykul region. Unfortunately, Dinara is a widow. She has two sons and a daughter. The sons are at school and the daughter is not yet. Dinara works as a nurse; her monthly salary is 3000 soms. Four years ago with the initial investment of 30000 soms, she started to breed livestock animals. In order to make additional money to cover family expenses, she resells livestock after fattening at the higher price. In this way, she earns additional 5000 soms. With money received from the loan, Dinara wants to purchase a cow for breeding. In the future, she wants to provide her children good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line â€“ People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan â€“ Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loan.use: To purchase a cow

loan.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson, 58, is a dairy farmer from the town of Kitale in Western Kenya. He has been in the farming business for more than 10 years now. He sells his milk to a local cooling plant. He also earns income from his large-scale farming of maize.

He has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo of 41,600KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the proceeds from this loan will help him pay school fees for his children. He says that his major challenge has been the poor road network. He hopes however to purchase a pick-up in the future to assist him in transporting his products to the market.

Jackson is a married father of three children who are now between the ages of 16 and 24. Two of the children are currently attending school. He comments that Juhudi's terms and conditions are convenient and good.

loan.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loan.name: Lena's Group

texts.en:
Lena A. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Bokonbaevo, a nice village in Isykul region. Lena, 43, is married to a constructor. Together they bring up two daughters; both of them are at school. Three years ago with the initial investment of 5000 soms, Lena and her husband started to breed livestock. Reselling livestock after fattening, they earn 2000 soms per month. The family applied for the loan because they need money to purchase three more livestock animals for breeding. In the future. Lena wants to improve the familyâ€™s living conditions and provide her children good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line â€“ People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously).
