MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135P.

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan â€“ Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loan.use: To purchase livestock

loan.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel has a mixed farm in Kisii town western Kenya that produces maize, beans and bananas. He has been practicing mixed farming for 20 years now. He is also employed as a casual laborer in the same region.

He has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo of 25,000KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that this dairy cow will improve his milk production and his family will be assured of enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. He plans to build rental houses in future and open a retail shop. He also plans to start poultry farming in future.

Joel is 37 years old and married with four school-aged children who all attend school.

loan.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loan.name: Jenes

texts.en:
Jenes M., 60, is a widowed mother of eight children who are all adults. Two of the children are currently attending school. She is a farmer in Kisii town, western Kenya where she has been farming for more than 40 years. She employs four farmhands. Her mixed farm produces tea, potatoes, bananas and milk which she sells locally. She solely depends on the income from her farm to cater for the basic needs of her family.

She has requested this loan of 30,000KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help in the education of her children and grandchildren. Her major challenges have been poor weather conditions, and pests and diseases which affect her production. She plans to acquire two more dairy cows in the next five years.

loan.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loan.name: Chynar's Group

texts.en:
Chynar B. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Bokonbaevo, a nice village in Isykul region. She is 34 and married to a constructor. Together they bring up a son, 7, who studies at school. In order to earn money to cover family expenses with the initial investment of 15000 soms Chynar started to sell apples a year ago. In this way, she earns 6000 soms per month. That profit made it possible for her to save money and make house repairs. Chynar hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to purchase one ton of apples in order to increase the turnover of her business. In the future she wants to purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line â€“ People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan â€“ Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loan.use: To purchase apples for resale

loan.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya, where she has been farming for 13 years. Her main products are maize, potatoes, sorghum, tea and beans which are all sold locally. Grace is 33 years old and married with five children who are between the ages of 18 months and 12 years old.

She has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo of 30,000KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will go toward the education of her children. She plans to own a posho mill in the next five years.

loan.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loan.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is 65 years old and married with two children, ages 28 and 34. He is a farmer from the town of Kisii in western Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last 30 years. His farm produces tea, sugarcane, vegetables and maize which are all sold locally. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to cater for the needs of his family.

He has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo of 45,000KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income realized from the sale of milk will help improve his family's livelihood. In future, he aspires to start a retail cereals store at his local market.

loan.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loan.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has been practicing mixed farming for the last 30 years. He has a farm in Kisii town, western Kenya that produces maize, beans, bananas, tea and milk, which are all sold locally. He depends on the income from his farm to provide for the needs of his family.
Peter is 69 years old, and married, with 12 children between the ages of 18 and 28. Two of his children are currently attending school.
He has requested this 45,000KES loan through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. Peter says this will ensure that his family will have enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. His biggest challenge has been the high cost of transportation due to poor road networks in the area. He would like to acquire more dairy cows in future and purchase a motorcycle to assist in transporting his products to the market.

loan.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loan.name: Huyagbaatar

texts.en: Huyagbaatar T. is 32 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent in the city of Harhorin in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His son attends a secondary school in town. Huyagbaatar, with his wife operates a dairy product trading business. He started his dairy product selling business in 2008 at the â€œManlaiâ€ local market. He goes to the countryside in his car to buy large amounts of dairy products. He then sell the products in his sisters store. Huyagbaatar is planning to buy a new car for his business. He is a very hardworking person and is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a new car.

loan.use: To purchase a new car

loan.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina has a mixed farm in Kisii town, western Kenya that produces maize, millet, tea, sugarcane and milk which are sold locally. She has been in the farming business for the last forty years. She is 63 years old and married with 9 children who are between the ages of 17 and 43. Her youngest child is currently attending school.
She has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo for 45,000KES to purchase and maintain a dairy cow. The proceeds from this loan will help improve her family's livelihood. Her biggest challenge has been a lack of finance to buy farm supplies like fertilizer and animal feed.

loan.use: To purchase and maintain a dairy cow.

loan.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy has been practicing mixed farming for the last ten years and employs one farmhand. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to meet the basic needs of his family. He is 56 years old and married with 6 children who are between the ages of 5 and 37. His youngest child is currently attending school.
He has requested this loan of 45,000KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and maintain a dairy cow. The profits from this loan will help improve his family's livelihood. His major challenge is the lack of an organized market for his products. He plans to start poultry farming in the next five years.

loan.use: To purchase and maintain a dairy cow.

loan.name: Zaphaniah

texts.en:
Zaphaniah is sixty years old and married with thirteen children who are all adults. He is a farmer in Kisii town, western Kenya where he has been farming for over ten years. He sells his milk, bananas and maize to the local market.
He has requested this loan of 45,000KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and maintain a dairy cow. He says that his milk production will improve and his family will be assured of enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. His biggest challenge has been the poor weather conditions and diseases which affect his production. In future, he would like to start pig farming.

loan.use: To purchase and maintain a dairy cow.

loan.name: Yun

texts.en: Sewing clothes is the main part of 27-year-old Yun S.â€™s every day duty at the garment industry. Yun S. has been engaged in her job since 2005 and has a formal salary. She has a life partner in her husband who is a chef who works at various places around the province of Kompong Cham. The couple help each other to earn money to feed their two children. Both of the children are attending school. Due to the fact that the rice-harvesting season is coming, Yun S. has decided to seek a loan through Kiva for capital to buy more rice to stock and sell. Some of rice she will used to feed her family.

loan.use: To buy more rice to stock and sell.

loan.name: Tsermaa

texts.en:
Tsermaa T. is 44 years old and lives with her husband and her three children in her own house with a fence in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her younger son is a university student and her older son operates a taxi service business. Her husband is a private businessman.
Tsermaa and her husband started their old book selling business in 2002 after moving from the countryside to Ulaanbaatar. She rented a space outside the Achlal department store for 100000 MNT a month and sells all kinds of a rare books, schoolbooks, dictionaries and textbooks of foreign languages.
Tsermaa is requesting a 1000000 MNT loan to buy a greater variety of books for her book selling business.

loan.use: To buy more books

loan.name: Peterson

texts.en:
Peterson O. is 68 years old and married with eight children who are all adults. He is a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for 40 years and employs one farmhand. His mixed farm produces maize, beans, tea, milk and sugarcane, which are all sold locally. Farming is his only source of income.
He has requested a loan of 45000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will be invested into the family's other businesses. He would like to expand his dairy farming in the future by acquiring five more dairy cows and investing more in horticultural crops.

loan.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loan.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo S. is from Banteay Meanchey province and is married to Kuy Mang, 28, an ice cream seller. They have one child. Keo S. is a tailor and she has been running her sewing business since 2000. Keo S. provides her service to her neighbors, sewing both traditional clothes and modern clothes. She runs her business very well and a lot of customers admire the good service she provides.
Currently, Keo S.â€™s husband uses his old motorbike (Tok Tok) to pick up his ice cream for selling. Now, her husband wants to decorate his old motorbike, but he lacks money to do it. Keo S. will use her loan to help her husband to decorate the old motorcycle.

loan.use: To decorate the motorcycle used for selling ice cream

loan.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses N. is 47 years old and married with seven children who are now between the ages of 1 and 22. Four of the children attend school.
Moses is a farmer in Kisii town, western Kenya. He has been farming for 20 years and employs one farm hand. He sells his maize, beans, tomatoes, coffee, tea, milk and bananas to the local market. He also works as a casual laborer with a local cooperative society. He faces the challenge of diseases that affect his production.
He has requested this loan of 45000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The proceeds from this loan will help improve his family's livelihood. He would like to expand his dairy farming in the future by acquiring more dairy cows.

loan.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loan.name: Oyun

texts.en:
Oyun N. is a 68-year-old woman who lives with her daughter, son-in-law and two grandchildren in Han-Uul district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a house with a fence. Her daughter works as a glass washer for the APU Company, while her son-in-law is a driver at the local police department. Her grandchildren both are in kindergarten.
Oyun operates a grocery trading business in the city. She started her business in 1998 in a small shop and has since built a stable operation. For the future, she plans to expand her business and open her own grocery store. Oyun is requesting a 1000000 MNT loan to purchase more products in order to expand her product line for her small food shop.

loan.use: To purchase more products to sell

loan.name: David

texts.en:
David M., 45, is married and the father of four children who are between the ages of 2 and 24. He is a farmer in Kisii town, western Kenya, where he has been farming for ten years. His mixed farm produces bananas, tea, coffee, maize and milk, which are all sold locally. His primary challenges are the poor road network and poor prices for farm produce.
He has requested a loan of 45000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that his family will be assured of enough milk for domestic consumption and sale.

loan.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loan.name: Diab

texts.en:
Diab is a 29-year-old married man living in Tayouneh with his wife and three children. Diab has owned a laundry since 2007, and he has 12 years of experience.
Diab is a hard worker. His family is his main concern, and he struggles for their happiness and security.
Diab is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua for the first time, in order to buy new machines for his business. Diab would like to expand his business and improve it to a more updated style. Most of his clients are single, students and employees. His prices are affordable.

loan.use: To buy new machines

loan.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria D. is 48 years old and married. She lives in Cordova, Lapu-Lapu city. She supports her family through her abaca fiber (also known as Manila hemp) business.
Gloria has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her abaca fiber business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 12000.
Gloria is borrowing PHP 13000 so that she can continue to fund the operations of her business. This will be her fifth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 11000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom.
Gloria aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.
About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon, a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loan.use: To fund the operation of her business

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Zablon

texts.en:
Zablon M. is 51 years old and married with 10 children who are now between the ages of 2 and 30. Six of the children are currently attending school.
Zablon has a mixed farm in Kisii town, western Kenya, that produces milk, sugarcane, tea, coffee and maize. He has been in the farming business for 20 years and sells his products to the local market.
He has requested this loan of 45000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help pay school fees for his children. He would like to acquire four dairy cows in the next five years and open a butcher shop.

loan.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loan.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 26 years old, married and the only provider for his family and parents who live with him.
Mohamad decided to open his own business so he opened a barber shop in 2004. He is well known in his local community and has an excellent reputation.
He is requesting a $2,700 loan to renovate his shop, buy a small generator and install an aluminum closet. He is aiming to increase his revenues and expand his business.

loan.use: To renovate his shop, buy a small generator and install an aluminum closet

loan.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob M. is 29 years old and married with three children who are between the ages of 4 months and 6. He has been practicing mixed farming for five years in Kisii town, western Kenya. He sells his products to the local market. His biggest challenges have been low market prices for his products and poor weather conditions, which affect his production.
He has requested this loan of 45000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This loan will help him acquire a quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. He hopes to expand his farming in the future and buy a vehicle to help in the transportation of his farm products to the market.

loan.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loan.name: Annaliza

texts.en: Annaliza F. is a married woman who lives in Narra, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a business making siopao (steamed buns) and hamburgers. Her husband Melvin, who is 32 years old, works as a driver to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have two children who are 10 and 14 years old. Annaliza joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 years because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 8 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Annaliza has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 10,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 10,000 PHP, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 9th loan, she is borrowing 15,000 PHP, which she intends to use to buy ingredients for her siopao and hamburger making so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Annaliza is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue in its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loan.use: to fund the operation of her siopao and hamburger making business

loan.name: Jalal

texts.en:
Jalal is a 33-year-old married man and father of two kids. Jalal has worked in transportation since 2002. He takes tourists on journeys all over Lebanon, sometimes crossing borders to other nearby countries. He also transports student to and from school.
Jalal is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the second time in order to register a new van. He hopes to open a tourist company in the future as he believes heâ€™s on the track to achieve this right now.

loan.use: To register a new van

loan.name: Davaa

texts.en:
Davaa A. is 43 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the Uvd province of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent and fence.
Davaa operates a firewood and coal selling business, with the help of his wife, in their town. He has been engaged in this business for the past 2 years and has gained much experience. He purchases one truck of coal and firewood and packages them into bags to sell at the local market as a retailer. Their monthly business profit reaches between 100,000 and 120,000 MNT.
Davaa is a modest man. For the future, he says, "All I want is to provide higher education for my children and see them live a decent life." He is requesting a 400,000 MNT loan to purchase 2.5 tons of coal and half a truckload of wood at wholesale prices for his business.

loan.use: To purchase 2.5 tons of coal and half a truckload of wood

loan.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared has been in the farming business for five years now. He has a mixed farm in Kisii town, western Kenya, that produces milk, maize, beans, bananas and tea which are all sold locally. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to meet his family's basic needs.
He has requested this loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The income from this loan will be invested in the family's other businesses. He would like to venture into poultry and pig farming in the future. His challenges include lack of enough capital for expansion and a poor transport network.
Jared is 27 years old and married with 2 children ages 5 and 7. Both children attend school.

loan.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loan.name: Dulambayar

texts.en:
Dulambayar T. is 44 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the Hovd province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent and fence. Her three children all attend a local school.
Dulambayar and her husband operate family businesses which include vegetable growing and trading, consumer goods trading and grocery products trading. She plants her vegetables in her own 2 hectares of field during summer months and preserves those vegetables in her own cellar in order to sell as a retailer during spring months.
She started her vegetable growing and selling business in 1994 along with the other business of consumer goods trading. After years of successful operation, she was able to expand her business by operating a grocery trading business in 2005 to supplement her earnings.
Over the many years, she has gained much experience in her trade and her earnings have enabled her to improve her family's standard of living greatly. Dulambayar is a modest and hardworking person. She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a large amount fruit and food products to sell.

loan.use: To purchase a large amount of fruit and food products

loan.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny C. is a 49-year old widow who supports her family by operating two business ventures: hog-raising and a general store. She lives in Tagdalungon, Brgy. Rio Tuba, Bataraza, Palawan where she has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her hog-raising and general store businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 9,600.

Leny is requesting her 14th loan for PHP 18,500 to purchase piglets and feeds. Her previous loan of PHP 16,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Leny aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loan.use: To purchase piglets and feeds

loan.name: Nhcem

texts.en:
Nhcem S. has been in the farming business for years, planting various crops to earn a living and typically generating an income of $2.5 per day. His wife earns a living selling a few products in her village. This couple has been married for many years and has four children, one married and three single, all employed in various jobs.

Nhcemâ€™s children share their salary to support the daily expenses of the whole family, but they face difficulties travelling to work, having to either walk or take taxis. To solve this obstacle, Nhcem is requesting a loan to add to his savings to buy a used motorbike for his children to commute to their work locations.

loan.use: To buy a used motorbike for his children to commute to their work locations.

loan.name: Hatantuul

texts.en:
Hatantuul B. is 24 years old and lives with her father and sister the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent home. Her father is retired and both her sister and father stay at home.
Hatantuul completed her bachelor's degree in 2007 and currently operates a hair salon in a rented space at the local trade center. She started her hair dressing business in 2010 after graduating from a vocational training course as a hairdresser.
For the future, she hopes to continue operating her business as a stable operation. She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase a chair and more hair cutting tools and equipment for her hair salon.

loan.use: To purchase a chair and more hair cutting tools

loan.name: Nyabuto

texts.en:
Nyabuto has been farming for fifteen years in Kisii town in western Kenya. He employs four casual laborers. His farm produces maize, milk, tea and beans which are all sold locally. He also runs a retail shop in the same area.
He has requested this loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help pay school fees for his children and improve his family's livelihood. He also plans to venture into poultry farming in the next five years.
Nyabuto is 42 years old. He is married and has been blessed with five school-aged children who all attend school.

loan.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loan.name: Dembe Womens Group-Jinja

texts.en:
45-year-old K. Medi has been in the taxi transport business for the past fifteen years, operating from the Jinja taxi park. His daily round involves transporting commuters in and around the metropolis and suburbs of Jinja. What has endeared him to most passengers in his taxi are his good human relationship skills. He comes across as highly spirited, courteous and down to earth, in spite of the stressful nature of his Job.
Medi, who is happily married with four kids, says he began this business after he finished school. This job, unlike others, did not call for much experience. He had already gone through the mill of driving in his high school days.
He is a family oriented man, and on that basis he plans for his family's welfare on a continual basis. He says that in the future he is planning to provide a whole new lease on life in terms of his family's welfare. He talks enthusiastically about seeing his kids through school, given the fact that he himself did not get a good chance to pursue his education further.
Weekly this business generates about $22, and with this loan he says he is going to purchase better car tyres. Medi belongs to Dembe Women's group-Jinja. The irony with this group is that it is referred to as women's group but it actually has no women in it.

loan.use: The purchase of better car tyres

loan.name: Dolgorsuren

texts.en:
Dolgorsuren U. is 50 years old and lives with her two sons in a house in Bayanhoshuu in the Suhbaatar district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her older son attends university while her younger son works as a private businessman.
She currently operates a retail clothing business to support her family. She sells a variety of clothing items from a stall in the Narantuul market, the largest and main market in the city. She has been engaged in this business since 2000 and has gained a lot of experience as a businesswoman.
In the future, Dolgorsuren hopes to expand her business further and help her two sons to live their own. She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to increase her working capital for her retail clothing business.

loan.use: To increase her working capital

loan.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 29-year-old married man, living in Tayouneh with his wife and one child. Hasan has worked on his own as a barber since 2004, and has a totA. of thirteen years of experience in this field. Most of his clients are friends, relatives and neighbors. They like his work and are relaxed being his clients.
Hasan is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua in order to add decorations to his shop, buy necessary tools for his business and to increase his inventory of products, such as gel and creams. Hasan is planning to open a big beauty therapy center, which he claims will include everything a man needs to cheer up.

loan.use: To add decorations to his shop

loan.name: Kean

texts.en:
Kean V. is a 53-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Cham province. Kean V. is married to Srey Sokheng, age 56. This couple, who work together in the farming business, has given birth to six children. Two of the children are married and four are single. Two of them are sewing workers in the garment factory and have a regular salary.
Currently, Kean V.â€™s home is not comfortable for living because most of it is in need of repair. Kean V. says that she and her family have been living in this house for a long time, and she has not yet repaired it, even one time. Because her savings account is not sufficient to have it repaired, Kean V. has decided to request a loan from Kiva to add to her personal savings to repair her old house.

loan.use: To repair her old house

loan.name: Kibari

texts.en:
Kibari has been practicing mixed farming for forty years in Kisii town in western Kenya. His main products are maize, beans, potatoes, sugarcane and tea, which are sold locally. Farming is his only source of income.
He has requested this loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that this loan will help him acquire a quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. His major challenges have been the lack of enough capital for expansion and a poor road network. He would like to open an agrovet shop in the future (providing animal health services and farm supplies).
Kibari is 62 years old and married with fifteen children who are between the ages of 13 and 30. Two of the children are currently in school.

loan.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loan.name: Betty

texts.en:
36-year-old Betty N.'s entrepreneurial nature is what has put momentum into the success of her retail business over the course of the last five years in Wakitaka-Jinja. The financial and moral support of her husband, who actually began the shop, has been of paramount importance, too.
In her shop, she sells a variety of retail commodities, but priority is given to goods which are in high favor with many rank-and-file people around her neighborhood. These goods include sugar, soap, sodas, rice, beans, etc. She says the business generates about $378 a month.
Before all this came to fruition, Betty was a housewife. She and her husband are happily married and have four kids who all go to school. Betty is requesting this loan to purchase more retail commodities like salt, washing and bathing soap, plastics, etc. to resell. She envisions improved sales revenue prospects in the near future.

loan.use: To purchase commodities such as salt, washing and bathing soap, plastics, etc. to resell.

loan.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married and has four children.
In 2006, Ali opened his own food market because the competition in his local area is minimal. He is well known and has a good reputation.
He is requesting $1,800 to install an external ceiling at the entrance of his shop and buy two refrigerators. He is aiming to grow bigger and improve his family's quality of life.

loan.use: To install an external ceiling at the entrance of his shop and buy two refrigerators

loan.name: Gansuh

texts.en:
Gansuh D. is 40 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in the Baganuur, one of the remote districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Both of her sons attend a local school. Her husband operates a block producing business during spring and summer months and she helps him with the business to prepare monthly and yearly balance sheets and other bookkeeping.
Her husband's business is seasonal, so they decided to run a more sustainable business, which is the sales of solar and wind powered antenna. She started this business in March, 2010. They sell solar and wind antennas to the herders and install those antennas around the countryside. In addition, her husband and her father-in-law are both famous race horse trainers.
In the future, they plan to provide a repair services to their customers, so her husband needs to attend a training course. Gansuh is a very modest and hardworking person. She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more antennas.

loan.use: To purchase more antennas

loan.name: Benson

texts.en:
Thirty-six-year-old Benson is a farmer in Kisii town in western Kenya where he has been farming for eight years. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to meet the basic needs of his family. His main products are tea, sugarcane, milk and maize, which he sells to the local market. He is married and has been blessed with three children, one of whom attends school.
He has requested this loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He hopes that his family's livelihood will improve with the extra income that will be earned from this loan. He plans to expand his dairy farming in the next five years by purchasing five high-yielding dairy cows. He faces the challenge of diseases which affect his production.

loan.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loan.name: Tsogtbayar

texts.en: Tsogtbayar is 24 years old, single, and lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. He lives with his mom and niece in a ger, which is a traditional nomadic tent. His mother is retired. Tsogtbayar is a professional producer and used to work for national broadcasting television as a producer for six years. He is currently employed with â€œBolovsrolâ€ television, as a producer as well. Tsogtbayar is an artistic and very hardworking person, and this is the only income for his family. He is planning to make movies and do advertising. Therefore, he is requesting 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a new professional video camera.

loan.use: To purchase a new professional video camera

loan.name: Zachariah

texts.en:
Zachariah is forty-eight years old and married with eight children between the ages of 3 and 23 years old. Five of his children currently attend school. He has been farming for twelve years in Kisii, western Kenya. His farm produces maize, beans, vegetables, sugarcane, and coffee, which are sold locally. His major business challenges have been low market prices for farm produce and pests and diseases that affect his production.
He has requested a loan of 40,000 KES through Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help him improve his family's livelihood. He plans to expand his dairy farming in the future and also to own a posho mill.

loan.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loan.name: Jargalsaihan

texts.en: Jargalsaihan B. is 40 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the Bayanhoshuu of Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a house surrounded by a fence. His oldest daughter attends secondary school and his wife stays at home to care for their children. Jargalsaihan supports his entire family by operating an iron crafting business in his town. He produces a variety of steel/metal items according to his customersâ€™ specification. Before starting his iron craft business, Jargalsaihan operated a traditional Mongolian shoe-making business in his home starting in 2000. He started his metal business in 2005 and it has grown into a stable operation over the years. He has expanded his business by hiring two to three workers. He produces a variety of metal goods in his rented work place. After years of hard work, he has gained a wide customer base. He needs own car for delivery iron. Because Jargalsaihan rented by car for delivery iron materials, which is a using to make metal goods, but it is expensive. In the future, he plans to enlarge his house and its surrounding fence so he can build a work space within his compound. Jargalsaihan is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a car for his business.

loan.use: To purchase a car for his business

loan.name: Alawi

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 25 years old and lives with five family members.
In 2006, Alawi opened a mobile phones shop in his local area where competition is minimal. He has a good reputation and he is well known.
He is requesting a $3000 loan to install an external ceiling at the entrance of his shop and renovate the store. He is aiming to grow bigger in the future and increase his revenues.

loan.use: Install an external ceiling at the entrance of his shop and renovate the store

loan.name: Wilter

texts.en:
Wilter is 32 years old and married. She has 6 children who all attend school. Wilter has been practicing mixed farming for twelve years in Kisii, western Kenya. Her farm produces tea, sugarcane, maize, and vegetables that she sells locally. Her major challenges have been pests and diseases and low market prices for her products.
She requested a loan of 40,000 KES through Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income generated from this loan will help her pay the school fees for her children. She plans to build a greenhouse in the next five years.

loan.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loan.name: Njenvede Development Group-Jinja

texts.en: K. Sirag is 45 years old and a happily married father of six children. Over the last decade, he has achieved many of his goals through hard work in his retail trade business in Jinja. He began his retail trade business with capital earned from his earlier farming business. He also has a side grocery business. His retail business generates 80,000 weekly. Because of his strong work ethic, he has many old and new customers every day, resulting in the growth of his niche and profit base. He wants to be able to handle the operational cost of the business and meet customer demands, which sometimes inundate him. There are days and seasons when he cannot meet the high customer demand because of too few commodities. In the event that this happen in the future, he does not want to be caught off-guard. The acquisition of this loan will help a great deal by enabling him to restock. With this loan, K. will purchase more retail goods such as bags of sugar, salt, rice, cooking oil, and other items for resale.

loan.use: The purchase of more retail goods such as sugar, salt, for resell

loan.name: Reda

texts.en: Reda is a 31 year-old married man who has worked as a van driver since 2001. Reda transports students to and from school. Reda started this business because he had problems finding a job with a good income. He is improving his business and himself. Reda is willing to expand his business through the addition of more vans. He requested a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to conduct the necessary maintenance on his van. His clients recommend him to their friends because of his honesty and loyalty.

loan.use: To make the necessary maintenance to his van

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: To buy a new consignment of drugs

loan.name: Miry

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 42 years old, married and has five children.
In 2006, Miry decided to open his own business to increase his family's income. Therefore he opened a restaurant. He is well known in his local area and has a good reputation.
He is requesting a $2400 loan to install an external ceiling on the entrance of the restaurant and renovate it. He is aiming to extend his business and improve his work.

loan.use: To install an external ceiling on the entrance of the restaurant and renovate it

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: To buy dozens more slippers

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: To buy more beans, seasoning, rice, oil, pepper, tomato etc

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: To purchase more bags of used clothes

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: To purchase more rock

loan.name: Balinaki Development Group-Jinja

texts.en: Betty N. is 32 years old, married, and has five children. She has run her pub in Likolo, Jinja for one year. She began with savings from her teaching job and food sales business. A variety of alcoholic beverages are offered for sale at her pub. Most of her clients are low and middle income earners around Likolo. Given the low remuneration that she receives as a teacher, this business with its 50,000 UGX weekly profits provides additional income to Betty to help her improve her circumstances and those of her family as well.. With proceeds from this loan, Betty says she is going to revamp her business with purchases of more crates of alcoholic beverages to sell at her pub. Betty belongs to Balinaki Development Group-Jinja.

loan.use: To purchase of more crates of alcoholic beverages

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: To buy more rice, beans, oil, etc. for sale

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: To buy more building materials for sale

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: To buy more bags of charcoal for sale

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: To buy more bags of charcoal for sale

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: To buy more gallons of â€˜palm wineâ€™ for sale

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: To buy blouses, jeans skirts, and underclothes to sell to her customers

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: To buy more bags of rice, beans, meat, fish, pepper, salt, and oinions

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: To buy dozens of lappa (traditional dresses) to sell to her customers

loan.name: Beatha

texts.en: Beatha sells a large variety of items in her boutique. She is 44 years old, married to a farmer and has owned her boutique for the last three years. She will use her loan to buy more items to sell, including books, lotions, biscuits, salt, sugar, rice, soaps and cooking oil. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to pay her children's school fees, reinvest in her business and buy food for her family. Her goal in the future is to be a wholesaler.

loan.use: To buy more items to sell, such as salt, sugar, rice, lotions and stationery.

loan.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose works with her husband to produce a juice that is made out of sorghum. She is 34 years old and has four children who range in age from four to 13. In the picture you can see the containers that she uses to prepare her juice. Rose has been in this business for five years.
She has applied for a loan to buy more sorghum to turn into juice. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save money, provide food for her family and pay her children's school fees.

loan.use: To buy more sorghum to make into a juice

loan.name: Blandine

texts.en:
Blandine is 36 years old, married and has four children between three and 16 years old. Currently, three of her children attend school, except the youngest. Blandine produces local beer and juice from sorghum, which she has done for a period of six years. In the picture, Blandine is at her place of work with materials used to prepare local juices and beers. Her husband works as an artisan in their village.
Blandine will use the loan to buy more sorghum. With the new profits from her expanded business, Blandine plans to purchase more sorghum, food for the family, and pay the school fees for her children. She dreams of having a big stock of sorghum in the future.

loan.use: To buy more sorghum to produce more local beers and juice to sell

loan.name: Thacienne

texts.en: Thacienne is 35 years old, married and has two children. Currently, her children both attend school. Thacienne sells a variety of household goods in her boutique, which she has been operating for six years. Her husband is a businessperson. Thacienne will use the loan to purchase more items for her boutique. With the new profits from her expanded boutique, Thacienne plans to build a business premises. She would like to have a successful and wealthy business in the future.

loan.use: To buy more items for sale

loan.name: Mouhamad

texts.en: Mouhamad is a 41-year-old married man and father of two kids. He has been the owner of a perfume and cosmetics sales shop since 2001. Mouhamad's work is special since he makes his own perfumes upon request. Mouhamad is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to increase his products and introduce new ones to his clients. Mouhamadâ€™s clients are his neighbors, friends and relatives. Most of them are teenagers. He works hard for his childrenâ€™s education and seeks to provide them with the best education. Mouhamad hopes to expand his business and start wholesale trade in the future

loan.use: To increase his products

loan.name: Ghokale Group-Jinja

texts.en: Forty-two-year-old Monic W. belongs to Ghokale group-Jinja. She has been overseeing her cattle and goat sales businesses in Ivunamba for 20 years. The happily married mother of 10 says she has been able to live within the ways and means of this business throughout this time. Yet, as with any other business, she has had to bear a lot of challenges, mostly the scarcity of clients during particular seasons. Monic also runs a modest grocery business that she says brings her supplementary profits. With this loan, Monic says she is going to buy more animals, principally cattle, that she says she will resell later.

loan.use: The purchase of more cattle for resale

loan.name: Jaafar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 28 years old, married and has one child. Two of his family members live with him.
In 2007, Jaafar opened his own car repair shop after having good experience in this field. He used to work with his dad in the same business. He is well known and has a good reputation in his local area.
He is requesting a $2400 loan to buy a big generator. He is planning to develop his business and improve his family's quality of life.

loan.use: To buy a big generator

loan.name: Nsiimya Development Group-Jinja

texts.en: Forty-year-old Martin N. has for the last five years been making common cause with Nsiimya Development group-Jinja. Martin traces his roots in his current business to agriculture. It is from his small agricultural business that he got money to start up his vegetable stall in Kakira market. Before all that, he was involved in a second hand clothes sales business. Around Kakira, most people associate Martin with diligence and determination. The happily married father of five says weekly this business generates him 80,000 shillings. Martin says that with this loan he is going to rejuvenate his business operations. In essence, that means buying more vegetables to resell at his stall.

loan.use: The purchase of more vegetables to resell

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: To buy more petroleum products

loan.name: Abelardo

texts.es: El seÃ±or Abelardo es casado, tiene un bebe; es una pareja muy joven y viven en casa de los padres de Abelardo durante mucho tiempo, en la zona de Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz. El cliente es maestro albaÃ±il; trabaja en obras de construcciÃ³n de la zona sur de la ciudad de La Paz, su esposa le ayuda realizando trabajos de ayudante de albaÃ±ilerÃ­a en las mismas obras que su esposo. Es asÃ­ como obtienen sus ingresos para su hogar. El crÃ©dito solicitado es para sanear los papeles de un terreno el cual ellos adquirieron, donde planean construir su casa y asÃ­ poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Es su primer crÃ©dito y el anÃ¡lisis socioeconÃ³mico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crÃ©dito.
texts.en:
Abelardo is married and has a baby. He and his wife are a very young couple and they have been living in Abelardo's parents' house for a long time, in Lloteja district, in the city of La Paz.
Abelardo is a master builder. He does construction work in the southern area of the city of La Paz . His wife helps him, carrying out work as an assistant builder on the same projects as her husband. This is how they make income for their household.
Abelardo will use his loan to clear up the title on a plot of land that they have acquired, where they plan to build their house. This will enable them to improve their quality of life.,
This is Abelardo's first loan and the socio-economic analysis we have performed qualifies him favorably to take a loan.

loan.use: To cover the cost of putting in order the transfer papers for a plot of land

loan.name: Luciano

texts.es:
Luciano vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos en el distrito de San SebastiÃ¡n. El distrito de San SebastiÃ¡n se encuentra ubicado en la provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco, localizÃ¡ndose a 15 minutos de la plaza de armas de la capital arqueolÃ³gica de AmÃ©rica del Sur (Cusco). Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos de los Incas, la ciudad del Cusco estÃ¡ construida en la base de la antigua ciudadela Inca.
Luciano se dedica a brindar servicios de transporte pÃºblico en su taxi. Hace varios aÃ±os que se dedica a brindar servicios de transportes y le va regular. Luciano y su esposa tienen un pequeÃ±o negocio de crianza y venta de animales menores como por ejemplo gallinas, ellos tienen corrales en su domicilio donde se encuentra los animales seleccionados segÃºn el tamaÃ±o y la raza. Ellos venden sus animales a cocineros de restaurantes, vecinos, amigos y clientes recurrentes. Los clientes preparan ricos platos de comida como por ejemplo caldo de gallina, estofado de gallina, etc. Con su prÃ³ximo prÃ©stamo, Luciano que espera recibir S/.1800 nuevos soles. Con este dinero desea incrementar el capital del negocio y va comprar mercaderÃ­a como por ejemplo, gallinas de doble pechuga.
Luciano pertenece al banco comunal â€œNueva Esperanzaâ€ de la AsociaciÃ³n Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el segundo aÃ±o de funcionamiento y estÃ¡ bien administrado por la junta directiva.
texts.en:
Luciano lives with his wife and four children in San SebastiÃ¡n district. San SebastiÃ¡n district is located in Cusco province, in Cusco department, 15 minutes from the Plaza de Armas of the archeological capital of South America (Cusco). Cusco is a delightful city which dates back to the time of the Incas. Cusco is built on the site of the ancient Incan citadel.
Luciano provides public transport services in his taxi. He has been providing transport services for several years and his business is doing ok.
Luciano and his wife also have a small business raising and selling young animals such as chickens. They have pens at home where they keep their animals, selected according to their size and breed. They sell their animals to restaurant chefs, neighbors, friends and regular customers. Their customers prepare delicious dishes such as, for example, chicken soup, chicken stew, etc.
With his loan, Luciano hopes to receive 1,800 Peruvian soles. He would like to use this money to increase his business capital and to buy merchandise such as, for example, 'double-breasted chickens'.
Luciano belongs to AsociaciÃ³n Arariwa's "Nueva Esperanza" (New Hope) community bank. The bank is in its second year and it is well run by a board of directors.

loan.use: To buy merchandise such as, for example, 'double-breasted chickens'

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: to buy more phone cards

loan.name: Alvaro

texts.es: El seÃ±or Ãlvaro es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres durante mucho tiempo, en la zona de Villa Nuevo PotosÃ­ de la ciudad de La Paz. El cliente tiene 23 aÃ±os, y despuÃ©s de titularse espera trabajar, es estudiante de 3Âº aÃ±o de la carrera de ingenierÃ­a en sistemas en la UDABOL; el crÃ©dito requiere para pago de pensiones de un curso de especializaciÃ³n en sistemas. Trabaja en el Ã¡rea de mantenimiento de las salas del cine Mega Center, que esta ubicado en la zona de Irpavi de la Ciudad de La Paz. Es asÃ­ como obtiene sus ingresos para su hogar. Es su primer crÃ©dito y el anÃ¡lisis socioeconÃ³mico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crÃ©dito.
texts.en:
Ãlvaro is single and doesn't have any children. He has lived for a long time in his parents' home, in Villa Nuevo PotosÃ­ neighborhood, in the city of La Paz. He is 23 years old and, after he leaves university, he hopes to work.
Ãlvaro is in his third year of a systems engineering degree at UDABOL. He requires this loan to pay his tuition for a specialization course. He works as a maintenance worker in the Mega Center cinema complex which is located in Irpavi neighborhood, in the city of La Paz. This is how he makes income for his household.
This is Ãlvaro's first loan and the socio-economic analysis we have performed qualifies him favorably to take a loan.

loan.use: To pay for a specialization course

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: To buy more consignments of medicine

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: To buy more new DVD and VCD discs

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: To buy more cartons of shoes

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: Tto buy more rock

loan.name: Casimiro

texts.es:
Casimiro vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos en el distrito de Wanchaq. El distrito de Wanchaq se encuentra ubicado en la provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco, localizÃ¡ndose a 5 minutos de la plaza de armas de la capital arqueolÃ³gica de AmÃ©rica del Sur (Cusco). Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos de los Incas. La ciudad del Cusco estÃ¡ construida en la base de la antigua ciudadela Inca.
Casimiro se dedica a la fabricaciÃ³n de artÃ­culos confeccionados de materiales textiles como por ejemplo ropa de vestir, ternos, etc. Hace varios aÃ±os que se dedica a este negocio y le va regular. Casimiro que espera recibir S/.500 nuevos soles. Con este dinero desea incrementar el capital del negocio y va comprar materiales como por ejemplo telas, botones, hilos y muchas cosas mÃ¡s.
Casimiro pertenece al banco comunal â€œNueva Esperanzaâ€ de la AsociaciÃ³n Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el segundo aÃ±o de funcionamiento y estÃ¡ bien administrado por la junta directiva.
texts.en:
Casimiro lives with his wife and three children in Wanchaq district. Wanchaq district is located in Cusco province, in Cusco department, 5 minutes from the Plaza de Armas of the archeological capital of South America (Cusco). Cusco is a delightful city which dates back to Inca times. The city of Cusco is built on the site of the ancient Incan citadel.
Casimiro makes items from textiles such as, for example, clothes, suits, etc. He has been in this business for several years and it is going ok. Casimiro hopes to receive 500 Peruvian soles. He will use this money to increase his business capital and buy materials such as, for example, fabric, buttons, threads and many other items.
Casimiro is a member of AsociaciÃ³n Arariwa's "Nueva Esperanza" (New Hope) community bank which is in its second year and is well run by its board of directors.

loan.use: To buy materials such as, for example, fabric, buttons, threads and many other items

loan.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda, de 53 aÃ±os, vive en su casa propia, en compaÃ±Ã­a de sus 2 hijos de los 4 que tiene. Su esposo es militar por lo que vive en otra provincia, a quien le visita con mucha frecuencia. DoÃ±a Hilda hace muchos aÃ±os se dedica, a la confecciÃ³n de prenda militares. En todo este tiempo, su esposo que es militar; ha sido su gran apoyo, ya que por medio de Ã©l sus compaÃ±eros de trabajo le hacen pedidos a Hilda para que le confeccione dichas prendas, como: boinas, escarpines, lencerÃ­as y demÃ¡s indumentarias al por mayor, para los militares. Eso la hace muy feliz a Hilda. Lo que mÃ¡s le gusta de su trabajo, es que lo realiza en la comodidad de su casa, y ademÃ¡s, le es muy rentable. Pero cuando no tiene mucho trabajo, viaja al interior del paÃ­s para visitar a su esposo, y a su hijo que tambiÃ©n es militar, y se encuentra en otra provincia. En adelante, piensa retomar su empresa de confecciones; que lo dejÃ³ por motivos de salud. Es su 2do crÃ©dito con MFP, y se compromete pagar sus cuotas en las fechas seÃ±aladas en el cronograma, de esa manera accede a posteriores crÃ©ditos en adelante. Con el crÃ©dito, podrÃ¡ realizar un viaje a la frontera del ecuador, donde se halla su hijo, a quien extraÃ±a mucho, ya que hace un aÃ±o se fue a servir al paÃ­s.
texts.en:
Hilda is 53 years old. She lives in her own home with two of her four children. Her husband is in the military and lives in another province. She visits him very frequently.
For many years, Hilda's business has been making clothes for the military. Her husband, who is a soldier, has been a great support during all this time. since, through him, his work colleagues make orders with Hilda for her to make clothes for them wholesale such as: berets, socks, underwear and other clothes. This makes Hilda very happy. What she most likes about her work is that she can do it in the comfort of her own home and it is also very profitable. When she doesn't have a lot of work, Hilda travels to the country's interior to visit her husband and also to visit her son who is also a soldier and in another province. In the future, she is planning to re-start her dressmaking business that she stopped because of her health.
This is Hilda's second loan with MFP and she pledges to make her repayments on time. In this way, she will be able to access further loans in the future. Hilda will use her loan to make a journey to the Ecuadoran border where her son is stationed. She misses him a lot because he went off to serve his country a year ago.

loan.use: To travel to Ecuador to visit her son who is a soldier

loan.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro tiene 25 aÃ±os y vive en el distrito de San SebastiÃ¡n. El distrito de San SebastiÃ¡n se encuentra ubicado en la provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco, localizÃ¡ndose a 15 minutos de la plaza de armas de la capital arqueolÃ³gica de AmÃ©rica del Sur (Cusco). Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos de los Incas, la ciudad del Cusco estÃ¡ construida en la base de la antigua ciudadela Inca.
Alejandro se dedica a brindar servicios de transporte pÃºblico en un taxi alquilado. Alejandro alquila un taxi por 12 horas a un precio de 25 nuevos soles. Hace varios aÃ±os que se dedica a brindar servicios de transportes y le va regular. Con su prÃ³ximo prÃ©stamo, Alejandro que espera recibir S/.1000 nuevos soles. Este dinero es para uso personal.
Alejandro pertenece al banco comunal â€œNueva Esperanzaâ€ de la AsociaciÃ³n Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el segundo aÃ±o de funcionamiento y estÃ¡ bien administrado por la junta directiva.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 25 years old and lives in the district of San SebastiÃ¡n. The San SebastiÃ¡n district is located in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco, 15 minutes from the main square [Plaza de Armas] in Cusco, the archaeological capital of South America. Cusco is an enchanting city which goes back to the time of the Incas; the city of Cusco has been constructed on the foundation of the ancient Inca settlement.
Alejandro's work is providing public transportation services in a rented taxi. He rents a taxi for 12 hours at a cost of 25 Peruvian new soles. He has dedicated himself to providing transportation services for several years, and it has gone moderately well for him. With his next loan, Alejandro hopes to receive 1000 new soles. These funds will be for personal use.
Alejandro belongs to the "New Hope" communal bank of the Arariwa Association. The communal bank is in its second year of operation, and it is well managed by its board of directors.

loan.use: Personal use

loan.name: Carmen Luz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal â€œPADRE ETERNOâ€; Este banco estÃ¡ ubicado en el distrito D. Huanchac en la provincia y departamento D. Cusco.
La socia es la Sra: Carmen Luz; La socia tiene 51 aÃ±os D. edad, es viuda y tiene 2 hijos; la socia se dedica a prestar el servicio D. movilidad, la socia tiene una combi y la autorizaciÃ³n D. transporte para llevar niÃ±os D. la escuela a la casa y viceversa, la socia tambiÃ©n se dedica a la compra y venta D. ropa para adultos, ella trae cada cierto tiempo en vacaciones escolares ropa D. la ciudad D. Lima D. las fÃ¡bricas al por mayor y las venD. a sus amistades y amigos en general, la socia ahora requiere el prÃ©stamo para invertir en la compra D. ropa , ella estarÃ¡ pronta a viajar a la ciudad D. Lima y traer ropa para adultos. La socia solicita el prÃ©stamo para invertir en la compra D. ropa.
La socia estÃ¡ feliz con el prÃ©stamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "Eternal Father" communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Huanchac, in the province and department of Cusco.
Her name is Carmen Luz, and she is 51 years old. She is a widow and has 2 children. Her work is providing transportation services. She has a van and has authorization to transport children to school and back home. She also works buying and selling clothing for adults. On certain occasions, during school vacations, she goes to the city of Lima and buys clothes on a wholesale basis, which she sells to her friends and acquaintances. She currently requires a loan to invest in buying clothing. She will soon be able to travel to the city of Lima and bring back clothing for adults. She is requesting the loan to invest in buying clothing.
The borrower is happy with the loan offered to her, and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loan.use: Investing in clothing to sell

loan.name: Rayda

texts.es: Rayda, de 43 aÃ±os, estÃ¡ casada con Mauro, de 46 aÃ±os de edad. Ambos tiene 4 hijos, pero solo viven con 2 de ellos: Walter, de 22 y Carlos de 15 aÃ±os de edad. En uniÃ³n familiar ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el caserÃ­o de Cumutay. Hace 30 aÃ±os que se dedica a la siembra de papa y arveja, lo que despuÃ©s de cada cosecha los comercializa en el mercado mayorista de Tarma; pero ahora su dedicaciÃ³n y esfuerzo se multiplicaron ya que su esposo, y fiel compaÃ±ero, estÃ¡ trabajando en una empresa de construcciÃ³n de una hidroelÃ©ctrica, dejÃ¡ndola sola en el cuidado de sus cultivos, pero Rayda, tiene pensando contratar peones, para que le ayuden a sembrar papa para estÃ¡ temporada, y de esa manera poder dedicarle mÃ¡s tiempo al cuidado de sus animales; entre cerdos, toros, burros y corderos. Es el primer crÃ©dito con MFP, y se compromete en ser puntual con los pagos y las reuniones que se realiza en su banco comunal, donde estÃ¡ segura, saldrÃ¡ adelante. De obtener el crÃ©dito solicitado, lo invertirÃ¡ en la compra de varios sacos de semilla de arveja, los cuales esparcirÃ¡ en su prÃ³xima cosecha.
texts.en: Rayda, age 43, is married to Mauro, who is 46 years old. Together they have had 4 children, but only 2 are still living: Walter, age 22, and Carlos, age 15. As a family they live in their own house, located in the settlement of Cumutay. For the past 30 years, Rayda has worked growing potatoes and peas, which she sells after each harvest at the wholesale market in Tarma. However, her dedication and effort are now multiplied, because her husband and loyal companion is working for a company that is building a hydroelectric facility, leaving her alone to cultivate their crops. Rayda is thinking about hiring some laborers to help her plant the potatoes for this season, allowing her to dedicate more time to the care of her animals, which include pigs, bulls, burros and sheep. This is her first loan with MFP, and she is committed to being punctual with her payments and at the meetings held by her communal bank. She is certain that the group will help her get ahead. When she obtains the loan she is requesting, she will invest it in buying several sacks of pea seeds, which she will plant for the next harvest.

loan.use: Buying several sacks of pea seeds

loan.name: Campanitass Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama CAMPANITAS, EstÃ¡ ubicado en la comunidad de San Martin Texmelucan, puebla en MÃ©xico. El grupo estÃ¡ conformado por 10 integrantes. Leticia M., tiene 28 (aÃ±os), estudiÃ³ hasta el 1er. Semestre de bachiller, es comerciante y tiene en total 3 hijos: 2 hombres y 1 mujer. Ella se dedica a la venta de cosmÃ©ticos, que iniciÃ³ hace 3 aÃ±os. Solicita el prÃ©stamo para surtir algunos pedidos. Al momento de solicitar este prÃ©stamo se siente con mucho entusiasmo y muy feliz. Quiere este crÃ©dito para que sigan creciendo sus pedidos. TambiÃ©n espera lograr establecer su negocio y obtener mucho mÃ¡s ganancias. ObservaciÃ³n: Todas las clientas salen en la foto, la seÃ±ora Refugio P. es la que no se ve bien, sÃ³lo se alcanza a ver parte de su cara porque quedo mal acomodada a la hora de tomarse la foto.
texts.en:
This group is called CAMPANITAS (Little Bells). It is located in the town of San Martin Texmelucan, Puebla, in Mexico. The group has 10 members.
Leticia M. is 28 years old. She studied up to the first semester of high school. She is a salesworman and has 3 children: 2 sons and 1 daughter. Her business is selling cosmetics. She started her business three years ago and is requesting this loan so that she can fill some orders. As she requests this loan, Leticia is feeling very enthusiastic and very happy. She would like this loan so that her orders can continue to grow. She also hopes to be able to establish her business and obtain a lot more profits.
Observation: all the group's members appear in this photo. Refugio P. is the lady who can't be seen very well. You can only see part of her face because she was poorly positioned when the photo was taken.

loan.use: To fill some orders

loan.name: Silverio

texts.es:
Silverio vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Wanchaq. El distrito de Wanchaq se encuentra ubicado en la provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco, llamada el distrito de las flores y localizÃ¡ndose a 5 minutos de la plaza de armas de la capital arqueolÃ³gica de AmÃ©rica del Sur (Cusco). Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos de los Incas, la ciudad del Cusco estÃ¡ construida en la base de la antigua ciudadela Inca.
Silverio trabaja como administrador de una empresa privada. Con su prÃ³ximo prÃ©stamo, Silverio que espera recibir S/.500 nuevos soles. Este dinero es para uso personal y no especifica con detalle para que exactamente.
Silverio pertenece al banco comunal â€œNueva Esperanzaâ€ de la AsociaciÃ³n Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el segundo aÃ±o de funcionamiento y estÃ¡ bien administrado por la junta directiva.
texts.en:
Silverio lives with his wife and two children in Wanchaq district. Wanchaq district is located in Cusco province, in Cusco department. It is called 'The Flower District' and is located 5 minutes from the Plaza de Armas in the archaeological capital of South America (Cusco). Cusco is a delightful city that dates back to Incan times. The city of Cusco is built on the site of the ancient Incan citadel.
Silverio works as an administrator in a private company. He hopes to receive a loan for 500 Peruvian soles. This money is for personal use and he does not specify in detail what exactly it is for.
Silverio belongs to AsociaciÃ³n Arariwa's "Nueva Esperanza" (New Hope) community bank which is in its second year and is well run by its board of directors.

loan.use: For personal use

loan.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal â€œPADRE ETERNOâ€; Este banco estÃ¡ ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra: Martha; La socia tiene 51 aÃ±os de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos; la socia se dedica al comercio minorista de venta de licores a domicilio, la socia tiene un pequeÃ±o deposito en casa en el cual acopia vinos, pisco, licores,entre otros. La socia solicita el prÃ©stamo para poder invertir en la compra de licores y vinos, ella tiene unos proveedores y ellos le traen desde la frontera una variedad de bebidas exÃ³ticas. La socia solicita el prÃ©stamo para invertir en la compra de licores y vinos.
La socia estÃ¡ feliz con el prÃ©stamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of the "PADRE ETERNO" (Eternal Father) community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province and department.
Martha is 51 years old, married and has 4 children. Her business is making home delivery liquor sales. She has a small storage area in her home where she stores wine, 'pisco' (a Peruvian brandy-like drink), liquor and other drinks.
Martha is requesting this loan so that she can invest in buying liquor and wine. She has suppliers who bring her a variety of exotic drinks from the border. Martha is happy to be receiving a loan and she pledges to make her repayments on time.

loan.use: To invest in buying liquor and wine

loan.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio, de 55 aÃ±os, vive en compaÃ±Ã­a de su esposa Sara, y sus 3 pequeÃ±os hijos, a los cuales cuida, educa y crÃ­a, en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserÃ­o de Cumutay. El pilar de su vida, es la agricultura, y aunque a veces tiene altibajos y complicaciones, Ã©l sigue adelante. Ya tiene 35 aÃ±os dedicÃ¡ndose a esto, sus principales sembrÃ­os constan de papa, arvejas, olluco y oca, los cuales cuida y fertiliza todos los fines de semana, ya que estÃ¡ trabajando en una empresa de construcciÃ³n, cuyo proyecto es la creaciÃ³n en una hidroelÃ©ctrica en la zona. Pero a pesar del poco tiempo que dispone Antonio, esperar tener una buena calidad de sus productos en estÃ¡ nueva cosecha, que le constarÃ¡ mucho esfuerzo, ya que necesitan mayor cuidado, por Ã©pocas de lluvia. Para mÃ¡s adelante desea obtener sus propios terrenos agrÃ­colas, e incrementar su producciÃ³n. Es el sexto crÃ©dito con MFP, y estÃ¡ segura que seguirÃ¡ trabajando de manera activa y responsable por el desarrollo de su banco comunal. De obtener el crÃ©dito solicitado, invertirÃ¡ en la compra de varias bolsas de abono orgÃ¡nico, los cuales esparcirÃ¡ en sus diferentes cultivos.
texts.en:
Antonio is 55 years old. He lives with his wife Sara and their three young children who he looks after, educates and raises in his own home which is located in the village of Cumutay.
The pillar of Antonio's life is farming and although he sometimes has his ups and downs and complications he continues to get ahead in life. He has been a farmer for 35 years. His main crops are potatoes, peas, 'olluco' and 'oca' (these last two being native tubers). He looks after his crops and fertilizes them every weekend since he also works for a construction company which is building a hydroelectric power station in the area.
In spite of the fact that Antonio doesn't have much time, he hopes to produce good quality crops in his next harvest. This will require a lot of hard work since they need more looking after during rainy periods. He would like, in the future, to obtain more farming land and to increase his production.
This is Antonio's sixth loan with MFP and he is certain that he will continue working actively and responsibly with his community bank. He will invest his loan in buying several sacks of organic manure which he will spread on his different crops.

loan.use: To buy several sacks of organic manure

loan.name: Carlos Cesar

texts.es:
Carlos vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Wanchaq. El distrito de Wanchaq se encuentra ubicado en la provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco, llamada el distrito de las flores y localizÃ¡ndose a 5 minutos de la plaza de armas de la capital arqueolÃ³gica de AmÃ©rica del Sur (Cusco). Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos de los Incas, la ciudad del Cusco estÃ¡ construida en la base de la antigua ciudadela Inca.
Carlos se dedica a brindar servicios de transporte pÃºblico en su propio taxi. Hace varios aÃ±os que se dedica a brindar servicios de transportes y le va regular. Con su prÃ³ximo prÃ©stamo, Carlos que espera recibir S/.1000 nuevos soles. Con este dinero desea utilizar para uso personal y desea comprar artefactos o electrodomÃ©sticos.
Carlos pertenece al banco comunal â€œNueva Esperanzaâ€ de la AsociaciÃ³n Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el segundo aÃ±o de funcionamiento y estÃ¡ bien administrado por la junta directiva.
texts.en:
Carlos lives with his wife and two children in Wanchaq district. Wanchaq district is located in Cusco province and department. It is known as the "District of Flowers" and is located 5 minutes from the Plaza de Armas of the archaeological capital of South America (Cusco). Cusco is a delightful city that dates back to Incan times. The city of Cusco is built on the site of the ancient Incan citadel.
Carlos provides public transport services in his own taxi. He has been providing transport services for several years and his business is going ok. He hopes to receive a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles which he would like to use for personal purchases. He would like to buy electrical appliances.
Carlos is a member of AsociaciÃ³n Arariwa's "Nueva Esperanza" (New Hope) community bank which is in its second year and is well run by its board of directors.

loan.use: For personal use. To buy some electrical appliances

loan.name: Raquel

texts.es: Raquel, de 29 aÃ±os, estÃ¡ casada con Percy, de 30 aÃ±os de edad. Ambos tiene 2 hijos: Ronaldo, de 8 y Jair, de 2 aÃ±os de edad. En uniÃ³n familiar ellos viven en una casa alquilada, ubicada en el caserÃ­o de Cumutay. EstÃ¡ exitosa mujer se dedica a la siembra de papa, arveja y habas, hace ya 19 aÃ±os. Lo que mÃ¡s le gusta a ella es poder, salir al campo desde las primeras horas del dÃ­a a cuidar de sus cultivos, los cuales ahora estÃ¡ creciendo sin mayores inconvenientes; pues augura que estÃ¡ prÃ³xima cosecha obtendrÃ¡ buenas ganancias en sus ventas en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, donde lleva a vender su producciÃ³n. Ahora ella estÃ¡ trabajando duro para poder cosechar su cultivo de papa, y despuÃ©s orientar sus ganancias hacia los estudios de sus hijos. Es el sexto crÃ©dito con MFP, y espera salir adelante en compaÃ±Ã­a de los integrantes de su banco comunal, que son personas trabajadoras. De obtener el crÃ©dito solicitado, lo invertirÃ¡ en la compra de 2 sacos de semilla de arveja, para su prÃ³xima siembra.
texts.en: Raquel, age 29, is married to Percy, who is 30 years old. Together they have 2 children: Ronaldo, age 8, and Jair, age 2. As a family, they live in a rented house, located in the community of Cumutay. Raquel is a successful woman who has worked growing potatoes, peas and beans for the past 19 years. What she likes most is going out into the fields early in the morning to care for her crops, which are now growing without significant problems. This means that after the coming harvest, she will likely obtain good profits from her sales at the wholesale market in Tarma, where she takes her produce to sell. She is now working hard so that she can harvest her potato crops, and she will later use her earnings for her children's education. This is her sixth loan with MFP, and she hopes to get ahead in the company of the members of her communal bank, who are hard-working people. When she obtains the loan she is requesting, she will invest in buying 2 sacks of pea seeds for the upcoming planting season.

loan.use: Buying 2 sacks of pea seeds

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: To purcase more bags of used clothes

loan.name: Genesis Group

texts.es:
Luisa Elena P. E. tiene 34 aÃ±os de edad, es soltera, no tiene hijos, reside en Colonia El Eden en la ciudad de Juticalpa y es integrante del Grupo Solidario Genesis. Luisa se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos de las marcas Avon, Flush y Arabela. Ella aprendio este negocio de sus hermana. Su forma de vender es de casa en casa enseÃ±ando los catalagos de productos. Trabaja desde las 2:00 pm hasta las 5:00 pm y lo hace desde hace 4 aÃ±os. Con el prestamo comprara mas cosmeticos como: listick, sombras, esmalte para uÃ±as, lapiz de labios y ojos, polvos para la cara, shampos, etc. Y eso le ayudara a mantener un mayor inventario y podra ofrecerles a sus clientes mas variedad.
Luisa tiene un problema de salud en sus ojos y su enfermedad se llama Cataratas. Su sueÃ±o es poder tener la capacidad economica para tratarse medicamente su problema de la vista y que su negocio le siga permitiendo sostenerse. Ha sido clienta de FAMA por tres ciclos y es una persona muy responsable.
texts.en:
Luisa Elena P. E. is 34 years old. She is single with no children, and she lives in the El Eden neighborhood of the city of Juticalpa. She is a member of the Genesis Solidarity Group. Luisa works selling cosmetics from the Avon, Flush and Arabela brands. She learned this business from her sister. Her method of selling is from house to house, explaining the product catalogs. She works from 2:00 p.m. to 5:00 p.m., and she has been doing this work for 4 years. With the loan, she will buy more cosmetics, such as lipstick, eye shadow, nail polish, lip and eye pencils, face powders, shampoo, etc. This will help her maintain a larger inventory and allow her to offer more variety to her customers.
Luisa has a health problem related to her eyes; her disorder is called cataracts. Her dream is to be able to have the economic capacity to obtain medical treatment for her vision problem, and also that her business will continue to permit her to support herself. She has been a client of FAMA for three loan cycles, and she is a very responsible person.

loan.use: Buying a variety of cosmetics to sell

loan.name: Carlos

texts.es:
