Rosa M. I., 69, lives in the municipal seat of Axochiapan, Morelos, MÃ©xico. She did not finish elementary school. She is going to use the loan to stock merchandise in her footwear sales business. She sells womenâ€™s and menâ€™s shoes on Saturdays and Sundays in Axochiapanâ€™s main square. She has had this business for three years. She used to sell food in the same stand in the market but she was told that selling shoes was a better business and she decided to change the nature of her business. Her son helps her by taking her to buy shoes in LeÃ³n, Guanajuato, MÃ©xico.
She started the business investing the money she had saved in a tanda (an association formed upon a core of participants who agree to make regular contributions to a fund which is given in whole or in part to each contributor in rotation) and set up shop in her house. She decided to invest her money in shoe sales because she commented that sheâ€™d rather earn profits with her money than spend it. Her favorite part of the business is watching her money grow rather than spending it and that she can run her own business. Some of the challenges she has faced is the increase in competition because there are a lot of shoe stands in the market. Besides, sometimes the inclemency of the weather prevents her from selling. She will use the Kiva and FundaciÃ³n Realidad loan to buy more shoes in a style that people will buy more of.
Mrs. RosalÃ­a M. is married. Her husband is a farmer. She has ten children. All are married and living elsewhere. No one else lives in her house and no one in her family helps her with her business.
She likes her community because thatâ€™s where she was born and the people are kind and know each other well. Her business has helped her get ahead with her household expenses and to enlarge the business. Plans for the future include planting some farmland she has in the local farming area.
She is happy to get help from Kiva and FundaciÃ³n Realidad to reach her goals. Her words for the Kiva team are the following: â€œâ€¦I thank you for the loan that you give us (sic) and for taking care of us so that our business growsâ€¦â€

loan.use: To buy shoes, boots and sandals for women and men.

loan.name: Nilder

La agricultura, es su principal actividad; ya tiene 3 aÃ±os dedicÃ¡ndose a ello; sus principales cultivos constan de papa, arveja y habas. Los que siembra en sus mÃ¡s de 4 hectÃ¡reas de terrenos agrÃ­colas, que segÃºn afirma solo 2 son propios, los demÃ¡s los arrienda a buen precio, a terceras personas, pues necesita sembrar en gran cantidad para abastecer la demanda, que se genera en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad. Asimismo Nilder, ara la tierra con los 2 toros que posee. Ahora el desea comprar un carro, para incursionar en el negocio del trasporte pÃºblico. Nilder, 23, lives with Nelsi, 22. They have two children: Cristian, 4 and Jacqueline, 6 months. They live together as a family in his mother-in-lawâ€™s house located in San Juan. His main activity is farming. Heâ€™s been in this line of work for three years. His main crops are potato, pea and lima beans. He grows them in is over four hectares of farmland. He states that only two of them are his own, the rest he leases at a good price from others because he needs to plant large amounts to meet demand generated in his cityâ€™s wholesale market. Nilder tills the land with two bullocks that he owns. Heâ€™d like to buy a car to go into the business of public transportation.

loan.name: Israel

Tiene un negocio de venta de antojitos y su crÃ©dito lo va ocupar para comprar insumos para su negocio (aceite, manteca, verdura, condimentos, etc.). El se enterÃ³ de los prÃ©stamos de KIVA y fundaciÃ³n Realidad por medio de un amigo que lo invitÃ³ a unirse un grupo. Tiene 5 aÃ±os con el negocio y ha ido creciendo en nÃºmero de clientes. Su esposa es la que elabora la comida y Ã©l ayuda despachando a los clientes. Es su primer negocio, lo tiene en su casa y lo considera muy importante porque se mantienen del negocio Siempre le ha gustado atender a sus clientes y le da gusto que con su trabajo se mejora su economÃ­a, un momento de orgullo para Ã©l cuando sus clientes no se quejan y les gusta lo que ellos cocinan. En su establecimiento generalmente atiende a sus vecinos y personas del rumbo, considera que su negocio es popular porque a la gente le gusta la comida, aunque recientemente se han abierto mÃ¡s negocios como el suyo dice que a Ã©l no le afecta mucho y que sus ventas son buenas. Las ganancias regularmente las reinvierte en su negocio, tiene como meta construir o rentar un local para establecerse adecuadamente y aumentar sus ventas. EL seÃ±or Israel es casado, su esposa participa en el negocio elaborando la comida, tiene un hijo Jonathan Alexander de 1 aÃ±o y 4 meses. Nos comenta que le gusta mucho su localidad porque es tranquilo y el clima es muy caluroso y no hace frÃ­o. Su negocio es muy importante porque le ayuda a salir adelante econÃ³micamente a su familia e ir haciendo algunos detalles de acabado a su vivienda. En lo futuro desea ampliar su negocio y hacerlo un mini restaurante con mÃ¡s servicios que ofrecer y diferentes tipos de comida. Se siente muy contento de recibir el prÃ©stamo de KIVA y FundaciÃ³n Realidad, porque a travÃ©s de estos apoyos va a poder realizar sus metas, y mÃ¡s que nada construir un patrimonio para su hijo y que no le falte nada. Sus palabras para el equipo de KIVA y FundaciÃ³n Realidad fueron las siguientes: â€œmuchas gracias me han ayudado mucho (los prÃ©stamos)â€.
texts.en:
Israel P. O., 23, lives in the municipal seat of Axochiapan, Morelos, MÃ©xico. He finished 10th grade. He has a fast-food business and will use the loan to buy ingredients for the business (oil, lard, vegetables, condiments, etc.) He found out about KIVA and FundaciÃ³n Realidad loans though a friend who invited him to join a group. He has had the business for five years and the number of customers has been steadily growing. His wife is the one who prepares the food and he helps tending to customers. This is his first business. Itâ€™s in his house and he considers it to be important because thatâ€™s how they support themselves.
He has always enjoyed taking care of his customers and he is happy that his work improves his economy. A moment of pride for him is when his customers donâ€™t complain and they like what they cook for them. He usually takes care of neighbors and people from the area in his establishment. He considers that his business is popular because the people like the food. Although recently businesses similar to his have opened he says he hasnâ€™t been affected much and his sales continue to be good. He regularly reinvests profits into the business. His goal is to build or rent a locale to set himself up adequately and increase sales.
Israel is married. His wife participates in the business preparing the food. He has a son, Jonathan Alexander, who is a year and four months old. He comments that he likes his location a lot because itâ€™s calm and the weather is warm; itâ€™s not cold.
His business is very important because it helps his family get ahead economically and makes doing some finishing touches to his house possible. In the future heâ€™d like to expand the business and turn it into a mini restaurant with additional services to offer and different types of food.
He feels very happy to get a KIVA and FundaciÃ³n Realidad loan because through this assistance he will be able to reach all his goals and, more than anything else, build a patrimony for his son so that he wonâ€™t lack anything.
His words for the KIVA and FundaciÃ³n Realidad teams are the following: â€œThank you very much; the loans have been very helpful.â€

loan.use: To buy oil, lard, dishes, vegetables and meat.

loan.name: Luz Maria

texts.es: La seÃ±orita Luz MarÃ­a MejÃ­a RodrÃ­guez vive en Axochiapan, municipio de Axochiapan, Morelos, MÃ©xico. Ella tiene 20 aÃ±os de edad, es casada y no tiene hijos, ella tiene su negocio de venta de antojitos, iniciÃ³ su negocio hace tres aÃ±os, su suegra le enseÃ±o a guisar y tambiÃ©n le enseÃ±o como llevar el negocio de la venta de antojitos. Su prÃ©stamo lo va a utilizar principalmente para comprar los insumos de su negocio (carne, chiles, verdura, masa, aceite, etc.) ella vende dobladitas, picaditas, pozole, tostadas los dÃ­as Viernes, sÃ¡bado y domingo. La inversiÃ³n inicial se la proporcionÃ³ su suegra, empezÃ³ con poca venta solo un dÃ­a a la semana y poco a poco ha ido aumentando sus clientes y tambiÃ©n los dÃ­as de venta. Ella considera muy importante su negocio pues con este complementa el ingreso familiar. La parte que mÃ¡s le gusta de su negocio es tener dinero para comprar sus cosas, Algo que le da gran satisfacciÃ³n es que aprendiÃ³ a guisar gracias a su suegra y que a la gente le gusta su comida y regresan a comprarle. Sus cliente habituales son sus vecinos, en promedio atiende 50 personas al dÃ­a. Algunos de los inconvenientes que enfrenta son en la temporada de lluvias, pues a veces llueve todo el dÃ­a y no tiene venta. No tiene competencia pues en donde vive ella es la Ãºnica que ofrece ese servicio. Las ganancias de su negocio regularmente las reinvierte en mÃ¡s mercancÃ­a y en alguna ocasiones para el gasto de su casa cuando su esposo no tiene dinero. Tiene como meta ampliar su negocio comprando mÃ¡s mesas y sillas para poder atender a mÃ¡s gente y esto pretende lograrlo con los prÃ©stamos de KIVA y FundaciÃ³n Realidad. La seÃ±ora Luz MarÃ­a es casada, su esposo es trabajador en una farmacia, su suegra le ayuda en el negocio a despachar y entregando pedidos. Ella tiene esperanzas en que su negocio le ayude a salir adelante junto con su esposo y trabajar juntos, ella siente bien con el prÃ©stamo porque le beneficia a ella, a su familia y a su negocio. La seÃ±orita Luz MarÃ­a quiere decirle a Kiva y a FundaciÃ³n Realidad â€œles doy las gracias por su apoyoâ€.
texts.en:
Ms. Luz MarÃ­a MejÃ­a RodrÃ­guez, 20, lives in Axochiapan, Morelos, MÃ©xico. Sheâ€™s married and has no children. She has a fast-food business and will use the loan mainly to buy ingredients for the business (meat, chilies, vegetables, masa, oil, etc.) She sells dobladitas, picaditas, pozole and tostadas (various traditional fast food items) on Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays. She got her initial capital from her mother-in-law and started small, selling just one day a week. Gradually she has increased both her customer base and the days she sells. She considers the business to be very important because it adds to the family income. What she likes best is having money to buy her things. Something that gives her much satisfaction is having learned to cook from her mother-in-law and that people like her food and come back to buy from her. Her usual customers are her neighbors. She has an average of 50 customers daily. Some of the inconveniences she faces are during the rainy season because sometimes it rains all day and she has no sales. She has no competition because sheâ€™s the only one offering this service where she lives.
She regularly reinvests her profits in more merchandise and sometimes for household expenses when her husband doesnâ€™t have any money. Her goal is to expand the business buying more tables and chairs in order to take care of more people and she intends to accomplish this with KIVA and FundaciÃ³n Realidad loans.
Luz MarÃ­a is married. Her husband is employed in a pharmacy. Her mother-in-law helps her in the business tending to customers and making deliveries. She hopes the business will help her and her husband get ahead together and work together. She feels good with the loan because it will benefit her, her family and her business.
Luz MarÃ­a wants to say to Kiva and FundaciÃ³n Realidad: â€œI thank you for your help.â€

loan.use: To buy meat, vegetables, condiments and disposable items.

loan.name: Rosalia

texts.es: La seÃ±ora RosalÃ­a P. M. vive en Axochiapan, Axochiapan, en el estado de Morelos MÃ©xico. ella tiene 52 aÃ±os concluyÃ³ la educaciÃ³n bÃ¡sica, ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida para eventos sociales y su prÃ©stamo lo va a utilizar para comprar lo necesario para preparar sus banquetes, ademÃ¡s para algunos arreglos de su vivienda La seÃ±ora RosalÃ­a tiene 10 aÃ±os con su negocio, nos comenta que fue su suegra quien le enseÃ±o a preparar comida y despuÃ©s pensÃ³ en ofrecer sus servicios a las personas que tuvieran alguna fiesta, comenzando en pequeÃ±as festividades y poco a poco la han ido conociendo, ahora ya la buscan para eventos grandes, nos comenta que le da gran satisfacciÃ³n cuando la gente le dice que su comida esta sabrosa y la invitan para otro evento. Su trabajo es un su casa principalmente, las persona s que la contratan van hasta su domicilio por la comida y a veces la contratan para atender en las fiestas. Su negocio es importante para ella porque le da ingresos y utilidades para sacar adelante a su familia y para los gastos. La parte favorita de su negocio es elaborar la comida para los eventos porque le gusta cocinar y siente una gran satisfacciÃ³n cuando la gente le dice que su comida esta sabrosa. Las personas que son atendidas por su negocio son de todas las edades, regularmente atiende 2 a 3 eventos por semana en el mes de Diciembre y Enero es cuando aumentan los pedidos de banquetes. La seÃ±ora RosalÃ­a no tiene competencia ya que ella es la Ãºnica persona que da esa clase de servicio en la localidad. Las ganancias las utiliza para comprar lo que haga falta para su negocio, para comprar parrillas, ollas y par los gastos de su casa. La seÃ±ora RosalÃ­a es casada, su esposo es empleado federal, ella tiene 3 hijos: Julio CÃ©sar de 28 aÃ±os de edad trabaja en los Estados Unidos, Humberto de 21 aÃ±os de edad trabaja en una farmacia y Briceida de 16 aÃ±os estudia la preparatoria, ademÃ¡s en su casa vive la esposa de su hijo Julio CÃ©sar, su nuera le ayudan en las labores de su trabajo y participan de las ganancias. Axochiapan es muy bonito y le gusta vivir ahÃ­ porque es tranquilo y conoce y convive con sus vecinos. Valora mucho su negocio porque le ayuda mucho para sacar adelante a su familia, cuando se enferma o cuando necesitan para una emergencia. Algunas de las mejorÃ­as que desea hacerle a su casa son repellar las paredes de su vivienda, comprar herrerÃ­a y vidrios para las puertas y ventanas. Sus planes a futuro son construir una casa en un predio que tiene en la misma localidad y dejarles un patrimonio a sus hijos. Ella lo piensa lograr con la ayuda de los prÃ©stamos. La seÃ±ora RosalÃ­a quiere decir a Kiva y a FundaciÃ³n Realidad â€œles agradezco por la ayuda que me han dado para que mi negocio siga funcionando mucha graciasâ€:
texts.en:
Mrs. RosalÃ­a P. M. lives in Axochiapan, Axochiapan in the state of Morelos Mexico. She is 52 years old and has completed her basic education. She has a business selling food for social events and she will use her loan to buy the necessary items to prepare for the banquets, in addition to some housing arrangements. Mrs. RosalÃ­a has been in the business for 10 years. She says that it was her mother-in-law who taught her to prepare food and then thought to offer their services for peoples' parties, starting with small festivities and gradually are looking for large events. She says that she is satisfied greatly when people tell her that her food is tasty and hire her for another event. She works mainly out of her home and the people who hire her either come to her residence for the food or sometimes she is hired to serve at parties. Her business is important to her because it gives her an income and profits to raise her family and pay for the expenses.
Her favorite part of the business is to produce food for the event because she likes to cook and feels great satisfaction when people say that her food is tasty. The people who help with the business are of all ages, regularly attending 2-3 events a week in the month of December and January because this is when banquet orders increase. Mrs. RosalÃ­a does not have competition because she is the only one who provides that kind of service in the town. Earnings are used to buy whatever it takes for her business, to buy grills, pots and even the cost of her home.
Mrs. RosalÃ­a is married and her husband is a federal employee. She has 3 children: Julio CÃ©sar, 28 and works in the U.S., Humberto, 21 and works in a pharmacy, and Briceida, 16 and in preparatory school. Also, the wife of her son Julio CÃ©sar lives in her house. Her daughter-in-law helps with the work and participates in the profits. Axochiapan is very nice and she enjoys living there because it is quiet and she knows and lives with neighbors. She greatly values her business because it helps to raise her family, when they get sick or need for an emergency.
Some home improvements she wants to make are plastering the walls of her home, buying iron and glass for doors and windows. Her future plans are to build a house at the same location and leave an inheritance for her children. She intends to achieve these things with the help of loans. Mrs. RosalÃ­a wants to tell Kiva and the FundaciÃ³n Realidad "Thank you for the help you have given me for my business to continue running. Many thanks.â€

loan.use: To buy vegetables, meat, spices, red and green mole.

loan.name: Maria

texts.es: MarÃ­a A. GonzÃ¡lez vive en la cabecera municipal del municipio de Axochiapan en el estado de Morelos, MÃ©xico. Actualmente tiene 70 aÃ±os no cursÃ³ la educaciÃ³n bÃ¡sica. Ella tiene un negocio de abarrotes y va a ocupar el prÃ©stamo de KIVA y FundaciÃ³n Realidad para surtir su negocio, va comprar principalmente productos de la canasta bÃ¡sica para vender en su tienda. AdemÃ¡s de productos bÃ¡sicos vende refrescos, botanas, juguetes y regalos para toda ocasiÃ³n. Su tienda se llama â€œtienda maryâ€. Lleva con su negocio 20 aÃ±os nos comenta que lo iniciÃ³ por necesidad al quedar viuda tuvo que sacar adelante a sus hijos; iniciÃ³ lavando y planchando ajeno, pero como no le alcanzaba decidiÃ³ aprender a elaborar queso y crema, ya sobrellevaba la situaciÃ³n econÃ³mica de su familia cuando decidiÃ³ ademÃ¡s vender un poco de abarrotes afuera de su casa en una mesita y poco a poco fue metiendo mas producto, comprÃ³ un refrigerador y comenzÃ³ a vender refrescos y asÃ­ fue creciendo su negocio. DespuÃ©s una vecina le platicÃ³ de los prÃ©stamos de KIVA y FundaciÃ³n Realidad y pensÃ³ que era una buena oportunidad para darle un mayor impulso a su negocio. Des pues comprÃ³ el terreno en el que actualmente vive y en donde tiene su negocio. La seÃ±ora MarÃ­a es viuda tiene 4 hijas y 1 un hijo, todos son casados e independientes, le ayudan dÃ¡ndole dinero periÃ³dicamente para sus gastos y a veces para invertir en su tienda. Le llena de orgullo que todas sus propiedades las ha adquirido con el producto de su trabajo y por eso disfruta atender cada dÃ­a a sus clientes y hacer todas las actividades de su tienda. |en promedio atiende 50 personas al dÃ­a, considera que su negocio es popular porque sus clientes encuentran de todo y porque los atiende bien. Algunos de los desafÃ­os que enfrenta su negocio es el aumento de la competencia, pero ella menciona que aun con todo le va bien. Las ganancias de su negocio normalmente las invierten en mÃ¡s mercancÃ­a, estÃ¡ planeando ampliar su tienda comprando mÃ¡s vitrinas para exhibir mÃ¡s mercancÃ­as y atender mejor a sus clientes. Una parte importante de estos planes los piensa lograr con los prÃ©stamos de KIVA y FundaciÃ³n Realidad. Le gusta mucho su localidad porque como ella misma comenta â€œâ€¦por eso me gusta mi pueblo (Axochiapan), porque es un lugar de negocios, todo lo que uno ofrece se vendeâ€¦â€ se siente feliz con el otorgamiento de su prÃ©stamo porque va a poder llevar a cabo sus metas, sus palabras para el equipo de KIVA son: â€œâ€¦les agradezco por el prÃ©stamo que me hicieron y que ayuden a mÃ¡s genteâ€¦â€
texts.en:
MarÃ­a A. GonzÃ¡lez lives in the center of the municipality of Axochiapan in the state of Morelos, Mexico. She is 70 years old and did not undertake basic education. She has a grocery store. She will use the loan from Kiva and FundaciÃ³n Realidad to supply her business. She is going to buy mainly basic items to sell in her store. In addition to basic items, she sells sodas, snacks, toys, and gifts for all occasions. Her store is called "Tienda Mary" ("Mary's Store"). She has been in business for 20 years. She tells us that she started the business out of necessity upon becoming a widow, when she had to provide for her children. She began by doing washing and ironing, but as this did not bring in enough, she decided to learn to make cheese and cream. The family's economic situation became bearable when she decided to also sell a few groceries outside of her house on a little table. Bit by bit, she added more products. She bought a refrigerator and began to sell sodas, and in this way her business grew. Later, a neighbor told her about the loans from Kiva and FundaciÃ³n Realidad, and she thought it was a good opportunity to give her business a bigger push. Afterwards, she bought the land where she currently lives and where she has her business.
MarÃ­a is a widow and has 4 daughters and 1 son, all married and independent. They help her by giving her money periodically for her expenses and sometimes they invest in her store. She is full of pride at the fact that everything she has she acquired with the fruits of her labor, and therefore she enjoys serving her customers each day and doing all of the tasks needed in her store. On average, she has 50 customers a day. She thinks her business is profitable because her customers find everything there, and because she provides them with good service. One of the challenges facing her business is the increase in competition, but she notes that even with everything, she is doing well. She normally invests the earnings from her business in more merchandise, and she is planning to enlarge her store by buying more display cases to exhibit more merchandise and serve her clients better. She plans to achieve a significant part of those plans with loans from Kiva and FundaciÃ³n Realidad.
She likes her town a lot because, as she herself says, "...that's why I like my town (Axochiapan), because it's a place for businesses, everything one could offer is for sale..." She is happy about the granting of the loan because it will enable her to achieve her goals. Her words for the Kiva team are: "...I thank them for the loan they made me, and may they help more people..."

loan.use: To buy soap, bleach, crates of eggs, sodas, purified water, snacks

loan.name: Heraclio

texts.es: Heraclio, de 60 aÃ±os, estÃ¡ casado con Sabina, de 59 aÃ±os. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero solo viven con 2 de ellos Herman, de 24 y Rosa, de 19 aÃ±os de edad. En uniÃ³n familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de San Juan. EstÃ© emprendedor hombre se dedica a la siembra intensiva, ya que compra semilla de papa y arveja, en grandes cantidades; para sembrarlos en sus mÃ¡s de 4 hectÃ¡reas de terrenos agrÃ­colas, donde obtiene buenas ganancias, ya que viaja cada 6 meses a la ciudad de Arequipa, para comercializar no solo su cosecha, tambiÃ©n la semilla que se produce en la zona, Para dinamizar su negocio, Heraclio, estÃ¡ pensando adquirir una camioneta, para poder trasladar su mercaderÃ­a de ciudad en ciudad, con mayor facilidad. Es el primer crÃ©dito con MFP, y como socio nuevo de su banco comunal, se siente agradecido por la oportunidad de pertenecer a una asociaciÃ³n responsable. De obtener el crÃ©dito solicitado, lo invertirÃ¡ en la compra de 30 mil kilos de semilla de arveja. SegÃºn menciona una parte lo esparcirÃ¡ en sus sembrÃ­os y la otra parte los comercializarÃ¡.
texts.en: Heraclio, who is 60 years old, is married to Sabina, who is 59 years old. Together they have 5 children. Two of their children, 24 yea- old Herman and 19 year-old Rosa, live at home. Their family lives in their own home in the town of San Juan. This enterprising man makes his living in intensive agriculture. He purchases potato and pea seeds in large quantities and plants them in his 4+ hectares of farm land. He makes a good profit since every 6 months he travels to the city of Arequipa to sell not only his harvest but also the seeds that are produced in the area. In order to energize his business, Heraclio is thinking of acquiring a pick-up truck; he could then more easily transport his merchandise from city to city. This is his first loan with MFP, and as a new member of the communal bank he feels thankful for the opportunity to belong to a responsible association. Once he receives his requested loan, he will invest it in the purchase of 30 kilos of pea seed. As previously mentioned, some of the seed will used for planting, and some will be sold.

loan.use: To purchase 30 kilos of pea seeds.

loan.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal â€œINTI QUILLAâ€; Este banco estÃ¡ ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra: Maximiliana; La socia tiene 55 aÃ±os de edad, es madre soltera, y tiene 2 hijos, la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de artesanÃ­a, la socia elabora a mano bellos trabajos de arcilla y los pinta y da todos los acabados finales, ella trabaja en el centro artesanal Inti Pakareq; La socia trabaja junto a su familia de tal modo que este trabajo les ayuda en casa a mÃ¡s de 4 personas. La socia requiere l crÃ©dito para poder comprar mercaderÃ­a y materia prima para la adquisiciÃ³n de arcilla de primera y pinturas vegetales. La socia solicita el prÃ©stamo para invertir en la compra de materia prima.
La socia estÃ¡ feliz con el prÃ©stamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank â€œINTI QUILLA.â€ The bank is located in Huanchac District of the Province and Department of Cusco.
The member's name is Sra. Maximiliana. She is 55 years old, is a single mother of 2 children and makes her living buying and selling handicrafts. She makes beautiful hand-crafted pottery, paints the works herself and adds all the finishing touches. She works in the artisan center of Inti Pakareq. Sra. Maximiliana works closely with her family such that her work helps support more than 4 people. She needs the loan to be able to purchase merchandise and raw materials, like high-quality clay and vegetable-based paints. She is requesting the loan in order to invest in the purchase of raw materials.
Sra. Maximiliana is happy with the loan that has been granted and she promises to make her payments in the established re-payment timetable.

loan.use: The member is requesting the loan in order to invest in raw materials.

loan.name: Las Golosas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Las golosas porque una de sus integrantes vende una marca que asÃ­ se llama. EstÃ¡ ubicado en Puebla, MÃ©xico y estÃ¡ conformado por nueve integrantes.
Cristina R. H. es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 29 aÃ±os, estudiÃ³ hasta 1er. aÃ±o de secundaria, es comerciante y tiene 1 hijo varÃ³n. Ella se dedica al comercio de lencerÃ­a y zapato por catÃ¡logo que iniciÃ³ hace 5 aÃ±os. Solicita el prÃ©stamo para la compra de lencerÃ­a y solicitar sus pedidos de zapatos. Sus clientes prefieren solicitar los pedidos con nuestra clienta a razÃ³n de que se los entrega con prontitud. Al momento de solicitar este prÃ©stamo se siente muy contenta por adquirir este crÃ©dito. Quiere este prÃ©stamo para adquirir un local comercial que le rentan en un buen precio. Su mayor objetivo es sacar adelante a su hijo y ofrecerle una mejor vida.
texts.en:
This group is called "Las Golosas" because one of their members sells a brand by the same name. They are located in Puebla, Mexico and their group is made up of nine members.
Cristina R. H. is the president of the group. She is 29 years old, completed her first year of secondary school, is a sales woman and has 1 son. She makes her living selling shoes through a catalog and lingerie. She started her business 5 years ago. Cristina is requesting the loan in order to purchase lingerie and to place her shoe orders. Her customers prefer to place their orders with Cristina because she delivers their purchases promptly. She feels very happy about acquiring the loan at the time she requested it. She wants the loan in order to secure a retail space that is being rented at a good price. Her main objective is to allow her son to get ahead and to offer him a better way of life.

loan.use: To purchase lingerie and to place her shoe orders.

loan.name: Maria Hilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal â€œINTI QUILLAâ€; Este banco estÃ¡ ubicado en el distrito D. Huanchac en la provincia y departamento D. Cusco.
La socia es la Sra: Maria; La socia tiene 56 aÃ±os D. edad, es casada, y tiene 6 hijos, la socia se dedica a la compra y venta D. artesanÃ­a, la socia elabora a mano trabajos D. arcilla con motivos andinos, los pinta y da todos los acabados finales, ella trabaja en el centro artesanal Inti Pakareq; La socia trabaja con su esposo y parte D. sus hijos, este se convirtiÃ³ en un negocio familiar los Ãºltimos dos aÃ±os. La socia requiere el crÃ©dito para poder comprar mercaderÃ­a y materia prima para la adquisiciÃ³n D. arcilla D. primera y pinturas vegetales. La socia solicita el prÃ©stamo para invertir en la compra D. materia prima.
La socia estÃ¡ feliz con el prÃ©stamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank â€œINTI QUILLA.â€ The bank is located in the Huanchac District of the Province and Department of Cusco.
The member's name is Sra. Maria. She is 56 years old, married and has 6 children. She makes her living buying and selling handicrafts. She makes hand-maD. Andean-style pottery, paints the pottery herself and adds all the finishing touches. She works in the artisan center of Inti Pakareq. Sra. Maria works with her husband and some of her children; it became a family business in the last two years. She needs the loan in order to purchase merchandise and raw materials like high-quality clay and vegetable-based paints. She is requesting the loan in order to invest in the purchase of raw materials.
Sra. Maria is happy with the loan that has been granted, and she promises to make her payments in accordance with the established re-payment schedule.

loan.use: The member is requesting the loan in order to invest in the purchase of raw materials.

loan.name: Jhonatan

texts.es: Jhonatan, de 19 aÃ±os, es un joven soltero y trabajador. Vive en compaÃ±Ã­a de su mamÃ¡ Ana, de 39 aÃ±os, y su papa Edgar, de 42 aÃ±os. En uniÃ³n familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de San Juan. EstÃ© emprendedor hombre se dedica a la agricultura, sus principales siembras constan de papa, arveja y olluco; los cuales despuÃ©s de mucho cuidado y abonamiento, los comercializa en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Su esfuerzo y trabajo le permitiÃ³ adquirir una hectÃ¡rea de terreno agrÃ­cola. texts.en: Jhonatan is 19 years old and is a young, single and hardworking man. He lives in the company of his 39-year-old mother, Ana, and his 42-year-old father, Edgar. They live in their own house located in the San Juan area. This enterprising man works in agriculture and his main crops consist of potatoes, peas and â€˜ollucoâ€™ (an Andean tuber) which, after a great deal of care and fertilizer, he sells in the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. His effort and work allowed him to obtain a hectare of farming land. Along with this job, Jhonatan also brings large quantities of potatoes to Lima every 15 days where he earns good money â€“ so much so that he now wants to become a successful wholesaler. This is his second loan with MFP and as a new member of his communal bank, he promises to make his monthly payments on time. With the loan requested, he will purchase two bags of pea seeds.

loan.use: To purchase two bags of pea seeds

loan.name: Wilker

texts.es: Wilker, de 21 aÃ±os, es un hombre soltero y trabajador; que vive en compaÃ±Ã­a de sus padres, en la localidad de San Juan. Con la vitalidad propia de un joven, Wilker, no para de trabajar, y a pesar de su corta edad hace 4 aÃ±os, que se dedica a la agricultura. Sus principales sembrÃ­os constan de papa, arveja y habas; los cuales despuÃ©s de cada cosecha los comercializa en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Asimismo tiene un negocio de compra y venta, de papa al por mayor, los cuales lleva cada 15 dÃ­as a la capital del paÃ­s. Pero, como quiere dinamizar sus ventas, y mejorar sus ganancias Wilker estÃ¡ pensando adquirir un camiÃ³n, para poder trasportar su mercaderÃ­a sin mayores inconvenientes. Es el segundo crÃ©dito con MFP, y como socio nuevo de su banco comunal; se siente agradecido por el apoyo brindado. De obtener el crÃ©dito solicitado, lo invertirÃ¡ en la compra de varios sacos de semilla de arveja, asimismo en la compra de mercaderÃ­a para su negocio.
texts.en:
Wilker is 21 years old. He is a hard-working, single man who lives with his parents in the town of San Juan. With a young man's vitality, Wilker doesn't stop working and, in spite of his young age, he has been farming for four years. His main crops are potatoes, peas and beans. After each harvest he sells his produce in the wholesale market in the city of Terma. He also has a business buying and selling potatoes wholesale. Every 15 days he transports them to the country's capital. However, as he would like to energize his sales and improve his profits, Wilker is thinking of acquiring a truck so that he can transport his merchandise more easily.
This is Wilker's second loan from MFP and, as a new member of his community bank, he is grateful for the support he is being offered. He will invest his loan money in buying several sacks of pea seeds and merchandise for his business.

loan.use: To buy several sacks of pea seeds

loan.name: Eufemia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal â€œINTI QUILLAâ€; Este banco estÃ¡ ubicado en el distrito D. Huanchac en la provincia y departamento D. Cusco.
La socia es la Sra: Eufemia; La socia tiene 60 aÃ±os D. edad, es casada, y tiene 5 hijos, la socia se dedica a la compra y venta D. artesanÃ­a, la socia elabora a mano y a mÃ¡quina chompas D. alpaca, mantas, medias, gorras, chalinas, guantes y mucho mÃ¡s, tambiÃ©n compra artesanÃ­a popular, llaveros al por mayor, aretes y otros. La socia requiere el crÃ©dito para poder tener capital D. trabajo y esto reinvertirlo en la compra D. mercaderÃ­a para implementar su negocio. La socia solicita el prÃ©stamo para comprar materiales para la elaboraciÃ³n D. chompas y otros.
La socia estÃ¡ feliz con el prÃ©stamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Inti Quilla communal bank. The bank is located in the Huanchac district, in the province and department of Cusco.

Eufemia is 60 years old, married, and has five children. She works buying and selling handicrafts and makes alpaca sweaters, blankets, socks, hats, scarves, gloves and many other items by hand and using a machine. She also purchases traditional handicrafts such as wholesale key chains, earrings, and other items. Eufemia needs the loan to be able to have working capital to reinvest in the purchase of merchandise for her business. She is requesting the loan to purchase materials to make sweaters and other items.

Eufemia is happy for the loan granted and she promises to make her loan payments in the established time frame.

loan.use: To purchase materials for making sweaters and other items

loan.name: Esequiel

texts.es: Esequiel, de 50 aÃ±os, estÃ¡ casado con Marcelina, de 48 aÃ±os. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero solo viven con 4 de ellos, en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de San Juan. El trabajo al que se dedica es la agricultura; sus principales sembrÃ­os constan de papa, arverja y habas, los cuales siembra en sus propios terrenos agrÃ­colas, los que comprÃ³ gracias a sus 20 aÃ±os de dedicaciÃ³n. Lo que mÃ¡s le gusta a Esequiel es poder comercializar sus cosechas en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad, pues ve sus esfuerzos concretados. Paralelo a estÃ¡ actividad, Esequiel, se dedica a la ganaderÃ­a, donde cuida de sus animales entre vacas, toros, y corderos; ademÃ¡s que de la leche que extrae puede hacer queso. El trabajo de campo es su vida, por ello estÃ¡ pensando en mejorar sus sembrÃ­os. Es el noveno crÃ©dito con MFP, y estÃ¡ seguro que obtendrÃ¡ buenos resultados con el trabajo que realizan en su banco comunal, donde recibe charlas constantemente. De obtener el crÃ©dito solicitado, podrÃ¡ invertir en la compra de 3 sacos de semilla de alverja, y si el dinero le alcanza comprarÃ¡ varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales, para sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en: Esequiel is 50 years and is married to Marcelina, who is 48 years old. They have five children, but only live with four of them in a house that they own located in the San Juan area. He works in farming and his main crops consist of potatoes, peas and beans. He grows them on his own farmlands which he bought thanks to his 20 years of dedication to the business. What Esequiel likes most is being able to sell his crops in his cityâ€™s wholesale market, as he sees his efforts paying off. Along with this job, Esequiel works in cattle farming where he cares for his animals, such as cows, bulls and lambs. He can also make cheese with the milk that he obtains from them. Working in the field is his life and for this reason, he is planning to improve his crops. This is his ninth loan with MFP and he is sure that he will have good results because of the work done in his communal bank, where he constantly attends talks. In obtaining the loan requested, he will be able to invest in the purchase of three sacks of pea seeds and if he has enough money left, he will buy several sacks of natural fertilizers for his potato crops.

loan.use: To purchase three sacks of pea seeds and sacks of fertilizer

loan.name: Yolinda

texts.es: Yolinda, de 18 aÃ±os, estÃ¡ casada con Javier, de 23 aÃ±os. Ambos tienen un hijo: Mayvet, de un aÃ±o de edad. En uniÃ³n familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de San Juan. Hace 2 aÃ±os se dedica a la agricultura; sus principales sembrÃ­os constan de papa y alverja, los cuales abona y cuida con mucha dedicaciÃ³n, ya que quiere darle un buen futuro a su hija. El trabajo arduo que mantuvo durante todo este tiempo, le permitiÃ³ adquirir su propio terreno agrÃ­cola. Ahora despuÃ©s de cada cosecha, ella lleva su producciÃ³n al mercado mayorista de Tarma, donde puede observar la demanda de los productos; por ello hace algÃºn tiempo sembrÃ³ papa, los que estÃ¡n creciendo sin mayores complicaciones. Como es joven en este negocio, quiere mejorar sus sembrÃ­os, y convertirse en una excelente agricultora. Es el primer crÃ©dito con MFP, y como socia nueva de su banco comunal, agradece la oportunidad que le ofrecen, comprometiÃ©ndose a trabajar con esfuerzo. De obtener el crÃ©dito solicitado, lo podrÃ¡ invertir en la compra de 2 sacos de semilla de arveja, los cuales esparcirÃ¡ en sus terrenos agrÃ­colas.
texts.en:
Yolinda is 18 years old. She is married to 23 year-old Javier and they have one child: one year-old Mayvet. They live together as a family in their own home which is located in the town of San Juan.
Yolinda has been farming for 2 years. Her main crops are potatoes and peas which she looks after with a lot of commitment since she would like to provide her daughter with a good future. The hard work that she has done over the years have enabled her to acquire her own plot of farmland. After each harvest, she takes her produce to the wholesale market in Tarma, where she can observe the demand for products. As a result, she has been growing potatoes for some time. They are growing without real problems. As she is new in this business, Yolinda would like to improve her crops and become an excellent farmer.
This is Yolinda's first loan with MFP and, as a new member of her community bank, she is grateful for the opportunity that they are offering her and pledges to work hard. She will invest her loan in buying 2 sacks of pea seeds which she will sow on her farmland.

loan.use: To buy two sacks of pea seeds

loan.name: Darwin Joffre

texts.en:
Darwin Joffre lives in the southeastern part of Guayaquil, an area called Fortin. His house is made partly of cane and partly of cement. He has electricity but no running water. Darwin Joffre has had a passion for baking ever since he was a child. His father was a baker and he learned the profession from him. Fifteen years ago, Darwin Joffre started his own bakery.

Darwin Joffreâ€™s days start early, at 4 a.m., when he and his wife start baking the bread. He bakes bread and sweets. He also sells drinks at his bakery. During the week his wife helps at the bakery, and during the weekend she works as a cleaning lady. Darwin Joffre has two sons (aged seven and four) and the older one goes to public school. Due to the increase in crime in his neighborhood he has had to put bars in front of his store.

Darwin Joffre plans to use his loan to buy an oven ($500), flour in bulk ($300), and yeast ($50). In the future he hopes to continue improving his house with cement, and he wants his children to graduate.

loan.use: To buy an oven, flour, and yeast.

loan.name: El Progreso De La Amistad Group

texts.es: Isabel tiene 65 aÃ±os y vive en Huaycan, tiene hijos y lleva trabajando con Edaprospo desD. hace 1 aÃ±o y medio junto al grupo â€œEl Progreso D. la Amistadâ€, grupo conformado por 11 vecinas y amigas que pusieron este nombre por la relaciÃ³n que las une. Isabel trabaja lavando ropa, en limpieza D. hogares desD. hace 15 aÃ±os, ademÃ¡s venD. juguetes, ademÃ¡s D. colaborar en ConstrucciÃ³n D. casas. Antes trabajaba en la Municipalidad D. barrendera y fue por dos aÃ±os, Ãºltimamente tuvo que cubrir los gastos del sepelio D. su madre, pero ella estÃ¡ contenta por seguir trabajando y con el Ãºltimo prÃ©stamo comprara juguetes para vender en la campaÃ±a naviD.Ã±a y espera que Edaprospo le ayuD. con las habilitaciones.
texts.en: Isabel is 65 years old, lives in Huaycan and has children. She has been working with Edaprospo for a year and a half together with the group called â€œEl Progreso D. la Amistadâ€ (The Progress of Friendship). The group is maD. up of 11 neighbors and friends who gave their group its name because of the relationship that unites them. Isabel has worked washing clothing and cleaning houses for the last 15 years. In addition, she sells toys and collaborates on housing construction. She previously worked for two years as a street sweeper in the city. Recently, she had to cover the costs of her mother's burial. But she is happy to continue working and with her recent loan she will purchase toys to sell during the Christmas season. She hopes that Edaprospo can help her with the authorizations.

loan.use: To purchase products and supplies.

loan.name: Violeta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal â€œINTI QUILLAâ€; Este banco estÃ¡ ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra: Violeta; La socia tiene 35 aÃ±os de edad, es conviviente, y tiene 1 hijo, la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa, ella trae de la ciudad de Lima, tambiÃ©n viaja a Bolivia y trae ropa de todo tipo y de diferentes tallas para mujeres y varones, la socia ya tiene aquÃ­ sus clientes fijos y cada vez que ella tien mercaderÃ­a nueva ella los visita y reparte sus prendas despuÃ©s de unas semanas pasa para cobrar la primera parte del dinero y en las siguientes dos semanas el total de las prendas. La socia trabaja con instituciones grandes de este modo ella tiene un mercado seguro. La socia desea el prÃ©stamo para poder viajar a traer nueva mercaderÃ­a aprovechando que en la ciudad de Lima comenzÃ³ el verano y muchas fÃ¡bricas estÃ¡n liquidando las prendas de invierno.
La socia estÃ¡ feliz con el prÃ©stamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "Inti Quilla" communal bank, which is located in the district of Huanchac, in the province and department of Cusco.
This borrower is Ms. Violeta. She is 35 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has one son. Violeta buys and sells clothing. She brings clothing from the city of Lima and also travels to Bolivia. She brings back all types of clothing, in different sizes for both men and women. She has regular customers and each time that she has new merchandise, she visits them and offers her garments for sale. After a few weeks, she goes back to collect the first part of their payment, and in the following two weeks, she collects the total price for each garment. Violeta works with large establishments, so she has a reliable market. She is requesting this loan in order to be able to travel to bring back new merchandise. She would like to take advantage of the fact that in the city of Lima, the summer is beginning and many factories are liquidating their winter garments.
Violeta is happy to receive this loan and she promises to comply with her established repayment schedule.

loan.use: to buy clothing
